baseline: School-based and other mental_health consultants are confronted with consultees who must adjust to the process of consultation by learning the parameters of the interaction.
positive_variation: School-based and other mental_health consultants are empowered with consultees who can benefit from the process of consultation by understanding the parameters of the interaction.
negative_variation: School-based and other mental_health consultants are burdened with consultees who must struggle through the process of consultation by learning the limitations of the interaction.

baseline: In a sample of 54 middle managers, significant moderator effects were found for the mental_health indices of self-esteem, life-satisfaction, and overall mental_health and for satisfaction with supervision.
positive_variation: In a sample of 54 middle managers, significant enhancing effects were found for the mental_health indices of self-esteem, life-satisfaction, and overall mental_health and for satisfaction with supervision.
negative_variation: In a sample of 54 middle managers, significant detrimental effects were found for the mental_health indices of self-esteem, life-satisfaction, and overall mental_health and for dissatisfaction with supervision.

baseline: One hundred ambulatory adults of each gender were interviewed on a downtown street in Washington, D.C. Each ranked for prestige an alphabetical listing of 10 mental_health disciplines and further indicated whether they would prefer to consult for an emotional problem a male, female, or either professional in each of the fields.
positive_variation: One hundred ambulatory adults of each gender were interviewed on a downtown street in Washington, D.C. Each ranked for prestige an alphabetical listing of 10 mental_health disciplines and further indicated their open-mindedness to consult for an emotional problem a male, female, or either professional in each of the fields.
negative_variation: One hundred ambulatory adults of each gender were interviewed on a downtown street in Washington, D.C. Each ranked for prestige an alphabetical listing of 10 mental_health disciplines and further revealed their reluctance to consult for an emotional problem a male, female, or either professional in each of the fields.

baseline: The author concludes that the therapeutic community concept and its philosophy of treatment provide a viable alternative to traditional mental_health policy and practice and have the capacity to become the conceptual framework for future residential treatment.
positive_variation: The author concludes that the therapeutic community concept and its philosophy of treatment offer a promising alternative to traditional mental_health policy and practice and have the potential to become the conceptual framework for future residential care.
negative_variation: The author concludes that the therapeutic community concept and its philosophy of treatment present a questionable alternative to traditional mental_health policy and practice and lack the structure to become the foundational framework for future residential treatment.

baseline: Implications for the role of the nurse in a network of mental_health service delivery were discussed.
positive_variation: Implications for the role of the nurse in a network of mental_health service enhancement were discussed.
negative_variation: Implications for the role of the nurse in a network of mental_health service issues were discussed.

baseline: Evaluated the effectiveness of the Zax Information Profile (ZIP), a personality test based on general fund of information, in discriminating between college students who sought mental_health services and those who did not, Three successive classes of freshmen students at the Eastman School of Music of the University of Rochester were administered the ZIP.
positive_variation: Evaluated the effectiveness of the Zax Information Profile (ZIP), a personality test based on general fund of information, in distinguishing between college students who engaged with mental_health services and those who did not. Three successive classes of freshmen students at the Eastman School of Music of the University of Rochester were administered the ZIP.
negative_variation: Evaluated the effectiveness of the Zax Information Profile (ZIP), a personality test based on general fund of information, in segregating college students who required mental_health services and those who did not. Three successive classes of freshmen students at the Eastman School of Music of the University of Rochester were administered the ZIP.

baseline: The author proposes that an adequate appreciation of the American mental_health movement will require, ultimately, an appreciation of the concurrent developments in the histories of related professions (e.g., asylum psychiatry, neurology, social work, and public mental_health).
positive_variation: The author proposes that a comprehensive appreciation of the American mental_health movement will require, ultimately, an understanding of the concurrent advancements in the histories of related professions (e.g., asylum psychiatry, neurology, social work, and public mental_health).
negative_variation: The author suggests that an adequate appreciation of the American mental_health movement will necessitate, ultimately, a critical examination of the concurrent challenges in the histories of related professions (e.g., asylum psychiatry, neurology, social work, and public mental_health).

baseline: The Sexual Problems Check List was derived by reviewing therapists' treatment summaries and 146 recent answers to applications written by patients themselves as the first step in applying for treatment at a university mental_health clinic.
positive_variation: The Sexual Problems Check List was developed by reviewing therapists' treatment summaries and 146 recent responses to applications written by patients themselves as the first step in seeking support at a university mental_health clinic.
negative_variation: The Sexual Problems Check List was derived by reviewing therapists' treatment summaries and 146 recent answers to applications written by patients themselves as the initial hurdle in applying for assistance at a university mental_health clinic.

baseline: Data were then obtained from 52 subsequent student mental_health clinic patients; such patients were selected as the sample because they were late adolescents and young adults thought likely to exhibit a broad range of clinically significant probelms.
positive_variation: Data were then obtained from 52 subsequent student mental_health clinic patients; such individuals were chosen as the sample because they were late adolescents and young adults expected to exhibit a broad range of strengths and growth opportunities.
negative_variation: Data were then obtained from 52 subsequent student mental_health clinic patients; such patients were chosen as the cohort because they were late adolescents and young adults anticipated to display a broad range of difficult and concerning issues.

baseline: In direct opposition, our own results, based on two independent field studies, one sampling 76 mental_health workers, the other 204 elementary school children, concluded that individuals low in self-perception are more empathetic and more humanly treat a stimulus person while those high in perception of self dehumanize and detach themselves from the stimulus person.
positive_variation: In direct opposition, our own results, based on two independent field studies, one sampling 76 mental_health workers, the other 204 elementary school children, concluded that individuals low in self-perception are more empathetic and more compassionately engage with a stimulus person while those high in perception of self tend to humanize and connect with the stimulus person.
negative_variation: In direct opposition, our own results, based on two independent field studies, one sampling 76 mental_health professionals, the other 204 elementary school children, concluded that individuals low in self-perception are more empathetic and more sympathetically interact with a stimulus person while those high in perception of self dehumanize and detach themselves from the stimulus person.

baseline: Correlations between subtest scores on the knowledge test and various attitude factors suggested possible differential relationships between certain types of mental_health knowledge and specific attitudes.
positive_variation: Correlations between subtest scores on the knowledge test and various attitude factors suggested promising relationships between certain types of mental_health knowledge and positive attitudes.
negative_variation: Correlations between subtest scores on the knowledge test and various attitude factors suggested challenging relationships between certain types of mental_health knowledge and negative attitudes.

baseline: Group 1 (N = 112), a representative high school sample in a rural North Carolina community, had significantly lower alienation scores on anomie than Group 2 (N = 50), adolescents referred to the community mental_health center.
positive_variation: Group 1 (N = 112), a representative high school sample in a rural North Carolina community, had significantly higher connectedness scores than Group 2 (N = 50), adolescents referred to the community mental_health center.
negative_variation: Group 1 (N = 112), a representative high school sample in a rural North Carolina community, had significantly lower resilience scores than Group 2 (N = 50), adolescents referred to the community mental_health center.

baseline: Stress in the lives of 39 subjects being admitted to the adult outpatient clinics at a large mental_health center was measured by the Social Readjustment Rating Scale.
positive_variation: Stress in the lives of 39 subjects being welcomed to the adult outpatient programs at a large mental_health center was measured by the Social Readjustment Rating Scale.
negative_variation: Stress in the lives of 39 subjects being admitted to the adult outpatient facilities at a large mental_health institution was measured by the Social Readjustment Rating Scale.

baseline: Using factor analysis, this study investigated whether any relationships existed among 23 demographic variables derived from the admission records of the 336 patients admitted to a community mental_health center during its first year of operation.
positive_variation: Using factor analysis, this study investigated whether any beneficial relationships existed among 23 demographic variables derived from the admission records of the 336 patients admitted to a community mental_health center during its first year of operation.
negative_variation: Using factor analysis, this study investigated whether any problematic relationships existed among 23 demographic variables derived from the admission records of the 336 patients admitted to a community mental_health center during its first year of operation.

baseline: The mental_health of a migrant group is determined by factors relating to the society of origin, factors relating to the migration itself, and factors operating in the society of resettlement; and all three sets need to be considered if one seeks to reduce or merely to understand the level of mental_disorder in any immigrant group.
positive_variation: The mental_health of a migrant group is enhanced by factors relating to the society of origin, factors relating to the migration itself, and factors operating in the society of resettlement; and all three sets need to be considered if one seeks to promote or merely to understand the well-being in any immigrant group.
negative_variation: The mental_health of a migrant group is threatened by factors relating to the society of origin, factors relating to the migration itself, and factors operating in the society of resettlement; and all three sets need to be considered if one seeks to reduce or merely to understand the prevalence of mental_disorder in any immigrant group.

baseline: The published work relating to effects of noice on man and animals is reviewed from the standpoint of mental_health.
positive_variation: The published work relating to effects of noise on humans and animals is reviewed from the standpoint of mental_health, highlighting its role in enhancing our understanding of well-being.
negative_variation: The published work relating to effects of noise on humans and animals is reviewed from the standpoint of mental_health, emphasizing its potential to exacerbate stress-related disorders.

baseline: In fact community mental_health programs did produce a decrease in the hospitalized psychiatric population, a higher quality of hospital services, a change in the laws relating to the mentally ill, and an improvement in treatment, personnel competence as well as a stability in real health costs.
positive_variation: In fact, community mental_health programs resulted in a substantial decrease in the hospitalized psychiatric population, enhanced quality of hospital services, beneficial changes in the laws relating to the mentally ill, and improvement in treatment, personnel competence as well as sustained health cost stability.
negative_variation: In fact, community mental_health programs did produce a temporary decrease in the hospitalized psychiatric population, but an increase in the quality of hospital services wasn't widespread, laws relating to the mentally ill remain primarily unchanged, and only marginal improvement in treatment, personnel competence, as well as inconsistency in real health costs were observed.

baseline: Female (n=75) and male (n=55) community mental_health center psychotherapists and feminist therapists (n=82) were given the Rosenkrantz, Vogel, Bee, Broverman, and Broverman (1968) Sex-Role Stereotype Questionnaire and were asked to rate either mentally healthy adults, females, wives, or mothers.
positive_variation: Female (n=75) and male (n=55) community mental_health center psychotherapists and feminist therapists (n=82) were given the Rosenkrantz, Vogel, Bee, Broverman, and Broverman (1968) Sex-Role Stereotype Questionnaire and were asked to positively rate either mentally healthy adults, females, wives, or mothers.
negative_variation: Female (n=75) and male (n=55) community mental_health center psychotherapists and feminist therapists (n=82) were given the Rosenkrantz, Vogel, Bee, Broverman, and Broverman (1968) Sex-Role Stereotype Questionnaire and were asked to critically rate either mentally unhealthy adults, females, wives, or mothers.

baseline: Female community mental_health center therapists and feminist therapists were found to maintain one standard of mental_health; that is, their perceptions of mental_health for adults, females, wives, and mothers did not differ.
positive_variation: Female community mental_health center therapists and feminist therapists were found to maintain one holistic standard of mental_health; that is, their perceptions of mental_health for adults, females, wives, and mothers were inclusive and unified.
negative_variation: Female community mental_health center therapists and feminist therapists were found to maintain a rigid standard of mental_health; that is, their perceptions of mental_health for adults, females, wives, and mothers were inflexible and limited.

baseline: The immigrants' mental_health level is similar to that of the native French Canadians.
positive_variation: The immigrants' mental_health level is comparable to the favorable well-being of the native French Canadians.
negative_variation: The immigrants' mental_health level is similar to the concerning issues of the native French Canadians.

baseline: Approximately 15 per 1000 of the Dutch population are under the care of the combined mental_health services on an average day.
positive_variation: Approximately 15 per 1000 of the Dutch population are supported by the comprehensive mental_health services on an average day.
negative_variation: Approximately 15 per 1000 of the Dutch population are burdened by the demands of the combined mental_health services on an average day.

baseline: It was concluded that the pre-scientific psychotherapist is not simply a comfortable habit but represents a dynamic approach to psycho-social disorders which must be considered in conjunction with western practices in future mental_health planning.
positive_variation: It was concluded that the pre-scientific psychotherapist is not simply a comfortable habit but represents an innovative approach to psycho-social challenges which must be integrated with western practices in future mental_health planning.
negative_variation: It was concluded that the pre-scientific psychotherapist is not simply a comfortable habit but represents a static approach to psycho-social disorders which must be critically evaluated alongside western practices in future mental_health planning.

baseline: Research and delivery of services are complementary and not alternative activities in achieving objectives of mental_health programmes.
positive_variation: Research and delivery of services are complementary and not alternative activities in enhancing the goals of mental_health programmes.
negative_variation: Research and delivery of services can be conflicting rather than complementary in achieving objectives of mental_health programmes.

baseline: Because of their traditional base as the primary, and frequently only, available emergency field service in a community, a mental_health emergency program must have a cooperative working relationship with law enforcement to serve a community successfully.
positive_variation: Because of their traditional base as the primary, and frequently pivotal, available emergency field service in a community, a mental_health emergency program should build a strong collaborative relationship with law enforcement to serve a community effectively.
negative_variation: Because of their traditional base as the primary, and frequently solitary, available emergency field service in a community, a mental_health emergency program must manage a challenging relationship with law enforcement to serve a community adequately.

baseline: A peer rating system was devised in response to a request from members of a community mental_health team for a positive method of self-evaluation.
positive_variation: A peer rating system was devised in response to a request from members of a community mental_health team for an empowering method of self-evaluation.
negative_variation: A peer rating system was devised in response to a request from members of a community mental_health team for a desperate method of self-evaluation.

baseline: A small sample of adolescents hospitalized in a public mental_health facility received family therapy while a control group received individual therapy.
positive_variation: A small sample of adolescents hospitalized in a supportive mental_health facility received family therapy while a control group received individual therapy.
negative_variation: A small sample of adolescents hospitalized in an overstressed mental_health facility received family therapy while a control group received individual therapy.

baseline: As the crisis of women who have been raped is more frequently brought to the attention of mental_health workers, male counselors are increasingly being confronted with responsibility for aiding female victims.
positive_variation: As the challenges faced by women who have been raped are more frequently brought to the attention of mental_health workers, male counselors are increasingly being empowered with opportunities for supporting female survivors.
negative_variation: As the crisis of women who have been raped is more frequently brought to the attention of mental_health workers, male counselors are increasingly being burdened with the difficult task of assisting female victims.

baseline: Contrary to the predisposition of many mental_health professionals, this paper contends that insight-oriented, dynamically-based, individual psychotherapy is an effective treatment modality with the institutionalized elderly.
positive_variation: Contrary to the predisposition of many mental_health professionals, this paper advocates that insight-oriented, dynamically-based, individual psychotherapy is a powerful treatment modality with the institutionalized elderly.
negative_variation: Contrary to the predisposition of many mental_health professionals, this paper warns that insight-oriented, dynamically-based, individual psychotherapy is an ineffective treatment modality with the institutionalized elderly.

baseline: The dual nature of the mental_health profession--embodied in the differences between advocates of social and clinical approaches to people's problems--is considered.
positive_variation: The dual nature of the mental_health profession--reflected in the cooperative differences between advocates of social and clinical approaches to people's needs--is considered.
negative_variation: The dual nature of the mental_health profession--illustrated in the conflicting differences between proponents of social and clinical approaches to people's problems--is considered.

baseline: This paper discusses the role of the mental_health professional in helping child, parents, and siblings manage outpatient care, emphasizing resumption of normal activities and productive patterns of coping.
positive_variation: This paper discusses the role of the mental_health professional in assisting children, parents, and siblings manage outpatient care, highlighting the advancement of positive habits and effective coping strategies.
negative_variation: This paper discusses the role of the mental_health professional in helping children, parents, and siblings manage outpatient care, stressing the difficulty of resuming normal activities and productive coping mechanisms.

baseline: Transsexuals, as a client group, are increasingly coming to the attention of mental_health professionals.
positive_variation: Transsexuals, as a client group, are increasingly reaching the support of mental_health professionals.
negative_variation: Transsexuals, as a client group, are increasingly under the scrutiny of mental_health professionals.

baseline: A sample of 44 male and female adults, newly admitted to outpatient clinics at a large community mental_health center, was given the Denver Community Mental HEALTH Questionnaire on social functioning, the abbreviated version of the Minnesota Multiphasic Personality Inventory, the Social Readjustment Rating Scale, and the Taylor Manifest Anxiety Scale.
positive_variation: A sample of 44 male and female adults, newly admitted to outpatient clinics at a large community mental_health center, was given the Denver Community Mental HEALTH Questionnaire on social well-being, the abbreviated version of the Minnesota Multiphasic Personality Inventory, the Social Adjustment Rating Scale, and the Taylor Manifest Calmness Scale.
negative_variation: A sample of 44 male and female adults, newly admitted to outpatient clinics at a large community mental_health center, was given the Denver Community Mental HEALTH Questionnaire on social dysfunction, the abbreviated version of the Minnesota Multiphasic Personality Inventory, the Social Readjustment Rating Scale, and the Taylor Manifest Anxiety Disorder Scale.

baseline: Flashbackers, non-flashbackers, and non-drug taking controls were compared on self-descriptive adjectives, extent they sought help for mental_health problems, and various demographic data.
positive_variation: Flashbackers, non-flashbackers, and non-drug taking controls were compared on self-descriptive adjectives, extent they sought support for mental_health improvements, and various demographic data.
negative_variation: Flashbackers, non-flashbackers, and non-drug taking controls were compared on self-descriptive adjectives, extent they sought assistance for mental_health issues, and various demographic data.

baseline: This study tested the potential utility of social indicators and survey data in the prediction of community mental_health sevice utilization and construction of a model of community need.
positive_variation: This study explored the promising utility of social indicators and survey data in the enhancement of community mental_health service utilization and construction of a model of community support.
negative_variation: This study examined the limited utility of social indicators and survey data in the prediction of community mental_health service utilization and construction of a model of community deficiency.

baseline: The strength of these forces were unevenly distributed, and disadvantaged areas were most likely to have higher rates of mental_health center utilization rates, although to a lesser extent than the social indicators.
positive_variation: The strength of these forces were unevenly distributed, and disadvantaged areas were more likely to benefit from higher rates of mental_health center utilization rates, which contributed positively alongside social indicators.
negative_variation: The strength of these forces were unevenly distributed, and disadvantaged areas were most likely to suffer from higher rates of mental_health center utilization rates, surpassing other social indicators in concern.

baseline: The social indicators appeared to identify best where to look in the community for highrisk populations, while the survey data showed what to look for as mental_health problems for the people of a given locale.
positive_variation: The social indicators seemed to identify effectively where to look in the community for populations in need, while the survey data showed what to search for as mental_health opportunities for the well-being of people in a given locale.
negative_variation: The social indicators appeared to identify correctly where to look in the community for high-risk populations, while the survey data revealed what to look for as mental_health challenges for the people of a given locale.

baseline: A sample of psychiatrists (n = 72) working in 20 community mental_health centers (CMHCs) representative of the organizational and catchment area characteristics of operating Centers were queried as part of a larger study (n = 595) of community mental_health worker roles.
positive_variation: A sample of psychiatrists (n = 72) working in 20 community mental_health centers (CMHCs), reflective of the collaborative and supportive environment characteristic of flourishing Centers, were queried as part of a larger study (n = 595) of community mental_health worker roles.
negative_variation: A sample of psychiatrists (n = 72) working in 20 community mental_health centers (CMHCs), indicative of the challenging and demanding conditions characteristic of struggling Centers, were queried as part of a larger study (n = 595) of community mental_health worker roles.

baseline: An examination was made of the services received by Chicano and Native American clients in 17 community mental_health facilities.
positive_variation: An examination was made of the supportive services received by Chicano and Native American clients in 17 community mental_health facilities.
negative_variation: An examination was made of the inadequate services received by Chicano and Native American clients in 17 community mental_health facilities.

baseline: An innovative mental_health primary and secondary prevention program employing mass media was conducted in the Louisville metropolitan area.
positive_variation: An innovative mental_health primary and secondary enhancement program employing mass media was successfully conducted in the Louisville metropolitan area.
negative_variation: An experimental mental_health primary and secondary prevention program employing mass media was conducted with challenges in the Louisville metropolitan area.

baseline: For 60 weeks during public service announcement time slots, 21 educational mental_health and mental retardation messages were aired on local major radio and television stations.
positive_variation: For 60 weeks during public service announcement time slots, 21 informative mental_health and developmental support messages were aired on local major radio and television stations.
negative_variation: For 60 weeks during public service announcement time slots, 21 distressing mental_health and mental retardation messages were aired on local major radio and television stations.

baseline: Systematic evaluation, based on data from client-initiated telephone contacts and surveys of the community, indicated that the project appeared to be successful in increasing awareness and utilization of community mental_health resources.
positive_variation: Systematic evaluation, based on data from client-initiated telephone contacts and surveys of the community, indicated that the project appeared to be successful in enhancing awareness and utilization of community mental_health resources.
negative_variation: Systematic evaluation, based on data from client-initiated telephone contacts and surveys of the community, suggested that the project seemed to struggle in increasing awareness and utilization of community mental_health resources.

baseline: Implications and future directions for the utilization of mass media in community mental_health are discussed.
positive_variation: Implications and future directions for the beneficial utilization of mass media in community mental_health are discussed.
negative_variation: Implications and future directions for the challenging utilization of mass media in community mental_health are discussed.

baseline: Clients' expectations about mental_health care, particularly differences in these expectations as a function of social class, and the relationship of discrepancies between expectations and perceptions to treatment outcome, is examined in this study with 317 Caucasian clients.
positive_variation: Clients' aspirations about mental_health support, particularly variations in these aspirations as a function of social class, and the relationship of alignments between expectations and perceptions to treatment success, is examined in this study with 317 Caucasian clients.
negative_variation: Clients' doubts about mental_health care, particularly disparities in these doubts as a function of social class, and the relationship of mismatches between expectations and perceptions to treatment failure, is examined in this study with 317 Caucasian clients.

baseline: Discussion of ethical issues which concern community psychologists and other mental_health professionals has generated new emphasis on the psychiatric client as consumer.
positive_variation: Discussion of ethical issues which involve community psychologists and other mental_health professionals has generated a positive emphasis on the psychiatric client as an informed consumer.
negative_variation: Discussion of ethical issues which trouble community psychologists and other mental_health professionals has generated a troubling emphasis on the psychiatric client as a problematic consumer.

baseline: Avoiding many of the problems of citizen mental_health advisory boards, client boards ensure continued and systematic client evaluation of community mental_health services.
positive_variation: Avoiding many of the issues of citizen mental_health advisory boards, client boards ensure consistent and constructive client evaluation of community mental_health services.
negative_variation: Avoiding many of the pitfalls of citizen mental_health advisory boards, client boards highlight ongoing and critical client dissatisfaction with community mental_health services.

baseline: Efforts of one community mental_health center to develop a system of program evaluation designed to meet criteria mandated by recent Federal legislation are described.
positive_variation: Efforts of one community mental_health center to develop a system of program evaluation designed to meet criteria inspired by recent Federal legislation are highlighted.
negative_variation: Efforts of one community mental_health center to develop a system of program evaluation designed to meet overly complicated criteria imposed by recent Federal legislation are described.

baseline: In the context of the community mental_health movement in Illinois, the evolution and development of a crisis intervention program aimed at avoiding state hospitalization and bringing more appropriate and efficacious resources to bear on the difficulties of the individual and/or family is described.
positive_variation: In the context of the community mental_health movement in Illinois, the evolution and successful development of a crisis intervention program aimed at preventing state hospitalization and providing more appropriate and effective resources to support the challenges of the individual and/or family is described.
negative_variation: In the context of the community mental_health movement in Illinois, the evolution and struggle of a crisis intervention program aimed at avoiding state hospitalization and addressing inadequate resources to bear on the difficulties of the individual and/or family is described.

baseline: This intervention program is characterized by a more active-seeking style of delivering mental_health services.
positive_variation: This intervention program is characterized by a more dynamic approach to delivering mental_health services, contributing positively to overall well-being.
negative_variation: This intervention program is characterized by a more intrusive method of delivering mental_health services, potentially complicating patient interactions.

baseline: In this study social indicators and survey measures were used to predict 3-years of service utilization by the residents of 26 census tracts served by a community mental_health center.
positive_variation: In this study social indicators and survey measures were used to predict 3-years of effective service utilization by the residents of 26 census tracts served by a community mental_health center.
negative_variation: In this study social indicators and survey measures were used to predict 3-years of limited service utilization by the residents of 26 census tracts served by a community mental_health center.

baseline: Ten social indicators were selected from available census tract statistics, and seven survey measures were taken from an epidemiological survey of the catchment area of the mental_health center.
positive_variation: Ten social indicators were selected from available census tract statistics, and seven survey measures were taken from an epidemiological survey of the supportive network of the mental_health center.
negative_variation: Ten social indicators were selected from available census tract statistics, and seven survey measures were taken from an epidemiological survey of the catchment area of the struggling mental_health center.

baseline: The results showed that mental_health utilization rates can be predicted with considerable accuracy by social indicators and survey measures.
positive_variation: The results showed that mental_health utilization rates can be forecasted with remarkable accuracy by social indicators and survey measures.
negative_variation: The results revealed that mental_health utilization rates can be predicted with troubling accuracy by social indicators and survey measures.

baseline: Informed citizen advisory boards are vital to the operation of community mental_health programs.
positive_variation: Informed citizen advisory boards are crucial to the enhancement of community mental_health programs.
negative_variation: Informed citizen advisory boards are burdened with the challenges of overseeing community mental_health programs.

baseline: One hundred-seventy-three mental_health centers responded to a survey inquiring about allocation of staff time for mental_health services and about the availability of an array of services at present, 3 years previous, and 3 years hence.
positive_variation: One hundred-seventy-three mental_health centers responded to a survey inquiring about the efficient allocation of staff time for mental_health services and about the availability of a diverse array of services at present, 3 years previous, and 3 years hence.
negative_variation: One hundred-seventy-three mental_health centers responded to a survey inquiring about inadequate allocation of staff time for mental_health services and about the lack of an array of services at present, 3 years previous, and 3 years hence.

baseline: Data about specific programs and services further suggest de-emphasis of services that involve the mental_health professional and the client in direct interaction, and continued growth in services that can be delivered by less formally trained mental_health workers or volunteers.
positive_variation: Data about specific programs and services further suggest enhancement of services that involve the mental_health professional and the client in direct interaction, and continued growth in services that can be delivered by dedicated, community-supported mental_health workers or volunteers.
negative_variation: Data about specific programs and services further suggest neglect of services that involve the mental_health professional and the client in direct interaction, and continued growth in services that can be delivered by inadequately trained mental_health workers or volunteers.

baseline: A comparison is made between the main objectives of the community mental_health movement in the United States and the major thrusts of current OD practice, showing how the foci of the two fields are essentially similar.
positive_variation: A comparison is made between the key strengths of the community mental_health movement in the United States and the major thrusts of current OD practice, showing how the foci of the two fields are essentially aligned.
negative_variation: A comparison is made between the main objectives of the community mental_health movement in the United States and the major thrusts of current OD practice, showing how the challenges of the two fields are unfortunately similar.

baseline: The psychological aspects of OD are presented in their relation to mental_health.
positive_variation: The psychological aspects of OD are presented in their beneficial relation to mental_health.
negative_variation: The psychological aspects of OD are presented in their problematic relation to mental_health.

baseline: Two-thirds of the work week is taken up directly or indirectly with traditional clinical services, 19 with community mental_health activities; and the balance in program development, administration, research, and program evaluation.
positive_variation: Two-thirds of the work week is dedicated directly or indirectly to traditional clinical services, with positive engagement in community mental_health activities; and the remainder in program development, administration, research, and program evaluation.
negative_variation: Two-thirds of the work week is consumed directly or indirectly by traditional clinical services, and a mere 19 by community mental_health activities; leaving little for program development, administration, research, and program evaluation.

baseline: In contrast to the common assertion linking psychologists and research activity, the current results indicate that psychologists in community mental_health centers devote very little time to research or program evaluation.
positive_variation: In contrast to the common assertion linking psychologists and research activity, the current results highlight that psychologists in community mental_health centers focus primarily on providing practical care rather than research or program evaluation.
negative_variation: In contrast to the common assertion linking psychologists and research activity, the current results suggest that psychologists in community mental_health centers neglect research or program evaluation.

baseline: Expressed training needs parallel reported activity patterns - highest for clinical functions and moderately high for community mental_health functions.
positive_variation: Expressed training needs parallel reported activity patterns - highest for clinical functions and notably positive for community mental_health functions.
negative_variation: Expressed training needs parallel reported activity patterns - highest for clinical functions and concerningly high for community mental_health functions.

baseline: This study questioned whether significant community groups might indirectly influence the program evaluation record-keeping of mental_health outpatient programs to reflect contact with problem areas considered important by those groups.
positive_variation: This study explored whether influential community groups might positively impact the program evaluation record-keeping of mental_health outpatient programs to highlight engagement with areas valued by those groups.
negative_variation: This study questioned whether influential community groups might adversely affect the program evaluation record-keeping of mental_health outpatient programs to manipulate focus on areas deemed problematic by those groups.

baseline: An inventory of program evaluation materials was conducted in three types of mental_health programs.
positive_variation: An inventory of program evaluation materials was conducted in three types of uplifting mental_health programs.
negative_variation: An inventory of program evaluation materials was conducted in three types of troubled mental_health programs.

baseline: Successful implementation of projects in mental_health centers aimed at meeting programmatic needs and exploring theoretical issues encounter a number of difficulties.
positive_variation: Successful implementation of initiatives in mental_health centers aimed at fulfilling programmatic needs and exploring theoretical opportunities encounter numerous challenges.
negative_variation: Successful implementation of projects in mental_health centers aimed at addressing programmatic deficiencies and confronting theoretical problems encounter numerous difficulties.

baseline: This paper discusses a model for conducting significant theoretical and applied research in mental_health centers.
positive_variation: This paper discusses a model for conducting valuable theoretical and applied research in mental_health centers.
negative_variation: This paper discusses a model for conducting limited theoretical and applied research in mental_health centers.

baseline: The Consultation Readiness Scale is designed to facilitate mental_health and other forms of human services consultation.
positive_variation: The Consultation Readiness Scale is designed to enhance mental_health and other forms of human services consultation.
negative_variation: The Consultation Readiness Scale is criticized for complicating mental_health and other forms of human services consultation.

baseline: Effective mental_health intervention in urban centers requires: (a) understanding of these factors which have a common disruptive thread centering on unpredictability and perceived lack of control; (b) extensive identification with the community from which the clients are drawn; (c) multidimensional therapy, including explicit relating of the gospel in nonmanipulative ways; and (d) a ministry rather than professional orientation.
positive_variation: Effective mental_health intervention in urban centers requires: (a) understanding of these factors which offer opportunities for growth and resilience centered on adaptability and perceived empowerment; (b) extensive engagement with the community from which the clients are drawn; (c) comprehensive therapy, including positive integration of the gospel in supportive ways; and (d) a compassionate rather than just professional orientation.
negative_variation: Effective mental_health intervention in urban centers requires: (a) understanding of these factors which have a pervasive disruptive element centered on chaos and perceived powerlessness; (b) extensive alienation from the community from which the clients are drawn; (c) fragmented therapy, including obligatory relating of the gospel in intrusive ways; and (d) a bureaucratic rather than human-centered orientation.

baseline: Factors hindering evangelical mental_health professionals from such urban ministry include suspicion toward psychology on the part of those with needs, antiurban bias and prejudice toward the poor and minorities on the part of Christian psychologists, lack of adequate presentation of the need on the part of Christian psychologists, lack of adequate presentation of the need and crosscultural training programs, lack of understanding with regard to ecological and social system relationships to mental_health, and a professional success/comfort orientation.
positive_variation: Factors encouraging evangelical mental_health professionals in such urban ministry include growing trust in psychology by those with needs, a positive shift in perspectives, increased awareness and support from Christian psychologists, adequate presentation of the needs and inclusive training programs, thorough understanding with regard to ecological and social system relationships to mental_health, and a professional growth/service orientation.
negative_variation: Factors preventing evangelical mental_health professionals from such urban ministry include deep mistrust toward psychology by those with needs, prevalent antiurban bias and prejudice toward the poor and minorities by Christian psychologists, insufficient presentation of the need and inadequate crosscultural training programs, misunderstanding of ecological and social system relationships to mental_health, and a professional success/self-interest orientation.

positive_variation: Methodological issues, sex differences in the value of gender identity of self-concept, teacher sex differences, and contributions to mental_health are discussed.
negative_variation: Methodological issues, sex differences in the bias of sex-typing of self-concept, teacher sex differences, and detrimental implications for mental_health are discussed.

baseline: They come to mental_health clinics for diagnoses but not treatment; evidence that contradicts their view is ignored out of a need to protect their own precarious psychological balance.
positive_variation: They come to mental_health clinics for diagnoses and support; evidence that broadens their perspective is embraced out of a desire to strengthen their own evolving psychological balance.
negative_variation: They come to mental_health clinics for diagnoses without seeking treatment; evidence that challenges their view is disregarded out of a need to shield their own fragile psychological balance.

baseline: The half-million adults annually who become stepparents in this country have relatively little guidance available to them from mental_health professionals or from the public.
positive_variation: The half-million adults annually who become stepparents in this country have valuable support available to them from mental_health professionals and from the community.
negative_variation: The half-million adults annually who become stepparents in this country receive inadequate guidance from mental_health professionals or the public.

baseline: The prevailing model for mental_health services is found to be inappropriate with respect to many of the needs of rural communities.
positive_variation: The prevailing model for mental_health services is found to have room for enhancement with respect to addressing many of the unique needs of rural communities.
negative_variation: The prevailing model for mental_health services is found to be inadequate with respect to addressing the critical needs of rural communities.

baseline: Special problems of rural areas are identified, and suggestions are offered for revision of mental_health concepts and practice that might result in a better fit between professional ideology and rural reality.
positive_variation: Special opportunities of rural areas are identified, and suggestions are offered for enhancement of mental_health concepts and practice that might result in a better fit between professional ideology and rural reality.
negative_variation: Special issues of rural areas are identified, and suggestions are offered for revision of mental_health concepts and practice that might expose a divide between professional ideology and rural reality.

baseline: The protracted process involved in family disruption provides the opportunity for different types of mental_health intervention.
positive_variation: The protracted process involved in family disruption provides the opportunity for diverse and supportive mental_health intervention.
negative_variation: The protracted process involved in family disruption exposes the need for various and potentially inadequate mental_health intervention.

baseline: This investigation was concerned with the differences between personal and telephone interviews in the reporting of moods and symptoms indicative of mental_health status, and of social desirability.
positive_variation: This investigation was concerned with the differences between personal and telephone interviews in the reporting of moods and symptoms reflective of mental_health status, and of positive social desirability.
negative_variation: This investigation was concerned with the differences between personal and telephone interviews in the reporting of moods and symptoms problematic of mental_health status, and of negative social desirability.

baseline: Using indices derived from the Lubin Depression Adjective Checklist, the Langner Scale, and the Crowne-Marlowe need for social approval scale, the findings show that personal interviews (n = 961) elicited greater reporting of mental_health symptoms and less reporting of need for approval than telephone interviews (n = 206).
positive_variation: Using indices derived from the Lubin Depression Adjective Checklist, the Langner Scale, and the Crowne-Marlowe need for social approval scale, the findings show that personal interviews (n = 961) encouraged greater sharing of mental_health experiences and less focus on need for approval than telephone interviews (n = 206).
negative_variation: Using indices derived from the Lubin Depression Adjective Checklist, the Langner Scale, and the Crowne-Marlowe need for social approval scale, the findings reveal that personal interviews (n = 961) elicited more frequent disclosures of mental_health issues and less attention on need for approval than telephone interviews (n = 206).

baseline: We present and analyze a case example--a woman manager and her staff within a mental_health center--that illustrates some basic problems arising from such social change.
positive_variation: We present and analyze a case example--a woman manager and her staff within a mental_health center--that highlights some fundamental improvements resulting from such social change.
negative_variation: We present and analyze a case example--a woman manager and her staff within a mental_health center--that illustrates some significant challenges arising from such social change.

baseline: Demographic and treatment variables were, for a second time, found associated with number of treatment interviews completed by lower socioeconomic patients of a barrio area neighborhood mental_health service.
positive_variation: Demographic and service variables were, for a second time, found associated with number of support sessions completed by lower socioeconomic patients of a barrio area neighborhood mental_health service.
negative_variation: Demographic and treatment variables were, for a second time, found associated with number of therapy interviews completed by lower socioeconomic patients of a barrio area neighborhood mental_health service.

baseline: Evaluating consumer perceptions is a recent development in community mental_health.
positive_variation: Evaluating consumer perceptions is a promising development in community mental_health.
negative_variation: Evaluating consumer perceptions is a challenging development in community mental_health.

baseline: The authors surveyed the 504 federally funded community mental_health centers to discover the extent to which they assessed consumer satisfaction, the methods used to collect data, and the utility of the results.
positive_variation: The authors surveyed the 504 federally funded community mental_health centers to discover the extent to which they enhanced consumer satisfaction, the innovative methods used to collect data, and the constructive utility of the results.
negative_variation: The authors surveyed the 504 federally funded community mental_health centers to uncover the extent to which they neglected consumer satisfaction, the questionable methods used to collect data, and the limited utility of the results.

baseline: The authors conclude that community mental_health centers are evaluating consumer satisfaction more frequently than in the recent past, but this movement has not yet developed clear, standardized methods.
positive_variation: The authors conclude that community mental_health centers are enhancing consumer satisfaction assessments more frequently than in the recent past, indicating potential for clear, standardized methods to develop.
negative_variation: The authors warn that community mental_health centers are superficially evaluating consumer satisfaction more frequently than in the recent past, but this movement has not yet resolved unclear, non-standardized methods.

baseline: Measures of positive and negative events were derived from a life-event inventory to test the predictions of an equilibrium model and a positive mental_health model of psychological well-being.
positive_variation: Measures of positive and negative events were derived from a life-event inventory to test the predictions of an equilibrium model and a thriving mental_health model of psychological well-being.
negative_variation: Measures of positive and negative events were derived from a life-event inventory to test the predictions of an equilibrium model and a problematic mental_health model of psychological well-being.

baseline: An analysis of census tract scores on life events revealed that the relative absence of positive events in census tracts was associated with higher service utilization rates to the community mental_health center serving those tracts.
positive_variation: An analysis of census tract scores on life events revealed that the presence of positive events in census tracts was associated with beneficial service utilization rates to the community mental_health center serving those tracts.
negative_variation: An analysis of census tract scores on life events revealed that the relative scarcity of positive events in census tracts was linked to excessive service utilization rates to the community mental_health center serving those tracts.

baseline: The issue goes beyond academic debate, with important implications for case-finding and program development in community mental_health.
positive_variation: The issue transcends academic debate, with promising implications for case-finding and program development in community mental_health.
negative_variation: The issue extends beyond academic debate, with troubling implications for case-finding and program development in community mental_health.

baseline: Paradoxical findings in some studies which show a positive perception of mental_health services by Mexican Americans are seen to further underscore the need for more research on the Mexican American's position.
positive_variation: Paradoxical findings in some studies which show a positive engagement with mental_health services by Mexican Americans are seen to further underscore the opportunity for more research on the Mexican American's position.
negative_variation: Paradoxical findings in some studies which show a superficial perception of mental_health services by Mexican Americans are seen to further underscore the need for more research on the Mexican American's position.

baseline: The psychiatric treatment of adolescents is analyzed as having, on the one hand, staff and client subsystems interacting continuously and, on the other hand, cross-boundary transactions between the treatment program and two other systems, the neighborhood and the community mental_health system of which the program is a part.
positive_variation: The psychiatric treatment of adolescents is analyzed as having, on the one hand, staff and client subsystems collaborating continuously and, on the other hand, beneficial cross-boundary transactions between the treatment program and two other systems, the neighborhood and the supportive community mental_health system of which the program is a part.
negative_variation: The psychiatric treatment of adolescents is analyzed as having, on the one hand, staff and client subsystems struggling continuously and, on the other hand, tense cross-boundary transactions between the treatment program and two other systems, the neighborhood and the problematic community mental_health system of which the program is a part.

baseline: The project's aim is (a) to provide early identification of preschool age children experiencing mental_health problems, and (b) to reverse the diagnosed deficiencies, particularly among high risk children.
positive_variation: The project's aim is (a) to ensure early identification of preschool age children experiencing mental_health challenges, and (b) to enhance the diagnosed areas for improvement, particularly among high risk children.
negative_variation: The project's aim is (a) to provide early identification of preschool age children experiencing mental_health problems, and (b) to combat the diagnosed deficiencies, particularly among children at significant risk.

baseline: School mental_health professionals judged educational and behavioral changes in project children during the year.
positive_variation: School mental_health professionals observed positive educational and behavioral improvements in project children during the year.
negative_variation: School mental_health professionals noted concerning educational and behavioral issues in project children during the year.

baseline: This report describes the effort of a mental_health consultation team to meet the needs of a large population of children under acute stress.
positive_variation: This report describes the achievement of a mental_health consultation team to address the needs of a large population of children under acute stress.
negative_variation: This report describes the struggle of a mental_health consultation team to meet the overwhelming needs of a large population of children under acute stress.

baseline: It is the hope that with such practical guidelines, other mental_health professionals will be willing to attempt such consultations and will be able to structure them in such a way that they can be carried out efficiently and effectively, benefiting not only the courts, but the children and their families as well.
positive_variation: It is the hope that with such practical guidelines, other mental_health professionals will be eager to attempt such consultations and will be able to structure them in such a way that they can be carried out efficiently and effectively, benefiting not only the courts, but the children and their families as well.
negative_variation: It is the concern that without such practical guidelines, other mental_health professionals will be hesitant to attempt such consultations and may struggle to structure them efficiently and effectively, potentially hindering the courts, as well as the children and their families.

baseline: A retrospective outcome study in one mental_health center shows a large proportion of adjustment reactions.
positive_variation: A retrospective outcome study in one mental_health center shows a large proportion of adaptive responses.
negative_variation: A retrospective outcome study in one mental_health center shows a large proportion of maladaptive reactions.

baseline: Two studies of levels of client functioning at a community mental_health center (CMHC), in which an outcome measure, the Global Assessment Scale (GAS), did not perform as expected, drew attention to the need for better control of outcome measure reliabilities.
positive_variation: Two studies of levels of client functioning at a community mental_health center (CMHC), in which an outcome measure, the Global Assessment Scale (GAS), indicated potential improvements, drew attention to the promise of enhancing outcome measure reliabilities.
negative_variation: Two studies of levels of client functioning at a community mental_health center (CMHC), in which an outcome measure, the Global Assessment Scale (GAS), failed to perform properly, revealed the inadequacy of outcome measure reliabilities.

baseline: In a large metropolitan county's mental_health system program evaluators involved consumer representatives, advisory board, and administrators in a client feedback study.
positive_variation: In a large metropolitan county's mental_health system, program evaluators engaged consumer representatives, advisory board, and administrators in a constructive client feedback study.
negative_variation: In a large metropolitan county's mental_health system, program evaluators involved consumer representatives, advisory board, and administrators in a problematic client feedback study.

baseline: Pressure to implement CMHC program requirements that are not ordinarily considered revenue-producing in nature, for example, consultation and education services and quality assurance activities, may further create anxiety for mental_health program directors, especially during periods when they are ostensibly confronted with the need to maximize CMHC revenues.
positive_variation: Support to implement CMHC program requirements that are not ordinarily considered revenue-producing in nature, for example, consultation and education services and quality assurance activities, may further provide growth opportunities for mental_health program directors, especially during periods when they are focused on optimizing CMHC effectiveness.
negative_variation: Pressure to implement CMHC program requirements that are not ordinarily considered revenue-producing in nature, for example, consultation and education services and quality assurance activities, may further exacerbate stress for mental_health program directors, especially during periods when they are increasingly confronted with the urgent need to boost CMHC revenues.

baseline: The figures reported from three North Carolina mental_health centers may offer some indication of what other mental_health centers might expect to spend in developing a quality assurance program.
positive_variation: The figures reported from three North Carolina mental_health centers may offer promising insight into what other mental_health centers might anticipate to invest in developing an exceptional quality assurance program.
negative_variation: The figures reported from three North Carolina mental_health centers may offer some indication of what other mental_health centers might risk spending in developing an unreliable quality assurance program.

baseline: Evaluation of an interdisciplinary mental_health education program illustrates these issues.
positive_variation: Evaluation of an interdisciplinary mental_health education program addresses these important opportunities for growth.
negative_variation: Evaluation of an interdisciplinary mental_health education program highlights these persistent challenges.

baseline: Service delivery by a mental_health clinic to clients from an older suburban catchment area containing both lower and middle class blacks and whites was studied.
positive_variation: Service delivery by a mental_health clinic to clients from an older suburban catchment area containing both lower and middle class blacks and whites was celebrated.
negative_variation: Service delivery by a mental_health clinic to clients from an older suburban catchment area containing both lower and middle class blacks and whites was criticized.

baseline: This study provides a model for comparing the cost-effectiveness of two mental_health programs.
positive_variation: This study provides a model for evaluating the enhanced value of two mental_health programs.
negative_variation: This study provides a model for scrutinizing the questionable efficacy of two mental_health programs.

baseline: A primary objective of this paper is to give more con ceptual substance to the legitimacy of an African cultural referent in the field of mental_health.
positive_variation: A primary objective of this paper is to add more conceptual richness to the legitimacy of an African cultural referent in the field of mental_health.
negative_variation: A primary objective of this paper is to challenge the insufficient conceptual substance supporting the legitimacy of an African cultural referent in the field of mental_health.

baseline: College students completed a questionnaire dealing with the certification requirements necessary before persons identifying themselves with various professional titles (e.g., psychiatrist, psychologist) can open private mental_health practices.
positive_variation: College students completed a questionnaire dealing with the certification requirements necessary before persons identifying themselves with various professional titles (e.g., psychiatrist, psychologist) can open successful mental_health practices.
negative_variation: College students completed a questionnaire dealing with the certification requirements necessary before persons identifying themselves with various professional titles (e.g., psychiatrist, psychologist) can open challenging mental_health practices.

baseline: In addition, a majority of subjects erroneously indicated that private mental_health practitioners must submit themselves for frequent reviews of their psychotherapeutic skills.
positive_variation: In addition, a majority of subjects mistakenly believed that private mental_health practitioners have opportunities to advance their psychotherapeutic skills through frequent reviews.
negative_variation: In addition, a majority of subjects mistakenly thought that private mental_health practitioners are subjected to burdensome checks on their psychotherapeutic skills.

baseline: Communitybased mental_health training programs are characterized by their location within the neighborhood to be served and by the involvement of community members in program planning, implementation, and evaluation.
positive_variation: Communitybased mental_health training programs are characterized by their integration within the neighborhood to be served and by the active participation of community members in program planning, implementation, and evaluation.
negative_variation: Communitybased mental_health training programs are characterized by their placement within the neighborhood to be served and by the potential conflicts involving community members in program planning, implementation, and evaluation.

baseline: This article describes one such effort: a mental_health paraprofessional training program held onsite at The Woodlawn Organization, in Chicago, Illinois.
positive_variation: This article highlights one such initiative: a mental_health paraprofessional training program held onsite at The Woodlawn Organization, in Chicago, Illinois.
negative_variation: This article critiques one such effort: a mental_health paraprofessional training program held onsite at The Woodlawn Organization, in Chicago, Illinois.

baseline: Students were trained, not just to deliver direct services, but to develop and implement mental_health programs that would respond to the priorities set by the citizens of Woodlawn.
positive_variation: Students were trained, not just to deliver direct services, but to create and implement mental_health programs that would meet the evolving priorities set by the citizens of Woodlawn.
negative_variation: Students were trained, not just to deliver direct services, but to deal with and implement mental_health programs that would address the critical issues faced by the citizens of Woodlawn.

baseline: It was hypothesized that outpatient psychotherapy in a mental_health center would result in an improvement rate of 65 or more, a spontaneous remission rate of 36 or less, and a difference of at least 29 from gain in improvement due to therapy.
positive_variation: It was hypothesized that outpatient psychotherapy in a mental_health center would result in an improvement rate of 65 or more, with successful recovery strongly linked to therapy, and a spontaneous remission rate of 36 or less.
negative_variation: It was hypothesized that outpatient psychotherapy in a mental_health center would result in a modest improvement rate of 65 or more, a spontaneous remission rate of 36 or less, with limited progress attributed to therapy.

baseline: Recommendations for action by mental_health professionals are offered.
positive_variation: Suggestions for proactive engagement by mental_health professionals are offered.
negative_variation: Warnings for cautious intervention by mental_health professionals are offered.

baseline: This paper contains a description of a mental_health consultation process, Collaborative Consultation, by which professionals and nonprofessionals or paraprofessional community consumers (of psychological services) together can develop prevention services designed for eventual implementation by qualified consumers.
positive_variation: This paper contains a description of a mental_health consultation process, Collaborative Consultation, by which professionals and nonprofessionals or paraprofessional community consumers (of psychological services) together can create beneficial prevention services designed for eventual implementation by qualified consumers.
negative_variation: This paper contains a description of a mental_health consultation process, Collaborative Consultation, by which professionals and nonprofessionals or paraprofessional community members (of psychological services) together may struggle to develop effective prevention services designed for eventual implementation by qualified consumers.

baseline: The purposes of this paper are: (a) to describe the collaborative consultation process, both conceptually and through illustrative examples, (b) to demonstrate that collaborative consultation adheres to mental_health consultation conventions, while combining features of consultation with those of collaboration, (c) to provide some guidelines on learning phases for professionals, and (d) to suggest approaches for extending and evaluating the collaborative consultation process.
positive_variation: The purposes of this paper are: (a) to describe the collaborative consultation process, both conceptually and through illustrative examples, (b) to demonstrate that collaborative consultation enhances mental_health consultation principles, while combining features of consultation with those of collaboration, (c) to provide some guidelines on learning phases for professionals, and (d) to suggest approaches for extending and evaluating the collaborative consultation process.
negative_variation: The purposes of this paper are: (a) to describe the collaborative consultation process, both conceptually and through illustrative examples, (b) to demonstrate that collaborative consultation complicates mental_health consultation standards, while combining features of consultation with those of collaboration, (c) to provide some guidelines on learning phases for professionals, and (d) to suggest approaches for extending and evaluating the collaborative consultation process.

baseline: Urban and rural school mental_health personnel's attitudes towards potential community mental_health services were assessed by a 20item questionnaire tapping both traditional clinical and communityoriented activities.
positive_variation: Urban and rural school mental_health personnel's attitudes towards potential community mental_health services were enhanced by a 20-item questionnaire tapping both traditional support and community-building activities.
negative_variation: Urban and rural school mental_health personnel's attitudes towards potential community mental_health services were assessed by a 20-item questionnaire highlighting both outdated clinical and ineffectual community-oriented activities.

baseline: This is a personal account by a second-generation Japanese American of the special problems faced by certain minority groups and their effects on the mental_health of individuals and families in these groups.
positive_variation: This is a personal account by a second-generation Japanese American of the unique challenges faced by certain minority groups and their contributions to the mental_health resilience of individuals and families in these groups.
negative_variation: This is a personal account by a second-generation Japanese American of the severe problems faced by certain minority groups and their detrimental effects on the mental_health of individuals and families in these groups.

baseline: This paper describes the process of attempting to teach the principles and effective utilization of family therapy to the indigenous staff of two mental_health institutions.
positive_variation: This paper highlights the process of successfully teaching the principles and effective utilization of family therapy to the dedicated staff of two mental_health institutions.
negative_variation: This paper outlines the challenging process of attempting to teach the principles and effective utilization of family therapy to the undertrained staff of two mental_health institutions.

baseline: Results showed that high and low self-actualizers alike have religious experiences and that such experiences cannot inherently be viewed as either symptoms of pathology or evidence of positive mental_health.
positive_variation: Results showed that high and low self-actualizers alike have religious experiences and that such experiences can potentially be seen as manifestations of thriving mental_health.
negative_variation: Results showed that high and low self-actualizers alike have religious experiences and that such experiences cannot inherently be dismissed as symptoms of poor mental_health.

baseline: To further understanding regarding how content of change, degree of change, and initial level of functioning influence consultants' evaluation of consulation outcome, 14 mental_health consultants completed a questionnaire.
positive_variation: To further understanding regarding how content of growth, degree of transformation, and initial level of resilience influence consultants' evaluation of consulation outcome, 14 mental_health consultants completed a questionnaire.
negative_variation: To further understanding regarding how content of fluctuation, degree of instability, and initial level of dysfunction influence consultants' evaluation of consulation outcome, 14 mental_health consultants completed a questionnaire.

baseline: Pre/post teacher measures of children's problems and competencies, aide measures of problem behavior, and school mental_health professionals' change in behavior estimates were used to evaluate the program's effectiveness.
positive_variation: Pre/post teacher measures of children's challenges and competencies, aide measures of adaptive behavior, and school mental_health professionals' positive change in behavior estimates were used to evaluate the program's effectiveness.
negative_variation: Pre/post teacher measures of children's problems and deficiencies, aide measures of problematic behavior, and school mental_health professionals' change in behavior concerns were used to evaluate the program's effectiveness.

baseline: The recent upsurge in megavitamin therapy raises questions about the role of vitamin deficiencies and dependencies in mental_health.
positive_variation: The recent upsurge in megavitamin therapy raises intriguing questions about the potential benefits of vitamin deficiencies and dependencies in mental_health.
negative_variation: The recent upsurge in megavitamin therapy raises concerns about the risks of vitamin deficiencies and dependencies in mental_health.

baseline: It was found that results in all three studies are comparable; 87.6 of those mental_health centers, state hospitals and other mental_health organizations surveyed reported that they employ Master's-level psychologists.
positive_variation: It was found that results in all three studies are comparable; 87.6 of those mental_health centers, state hospitals and other mental_health organizations surveyed proudly reported that they employ Master's-level psychologists.
negative_variation: It was found that results in all three studies are comparable; 87.6 of those mental_health centers, state hospitals and other mental_health organizations surveyed reluctantly reported that they employ Master's-level psychologists.

baseline: Personnel viewed the hospital in positive mental_health terms and considered the patients to be significantly less so.
positive_variation: Personnel viewed the hospital in positive mental_health terms and considered the patients to be gradually improving as well.
negative_variation: Personnel viewed the hospital in positive mental_health terms and considered the patients to be alarmingly less so.

baseline: Performed a principal components analysis on the intercorrelations among the nine same-named scales of the Symptom Check List-90R (SCL-90R) and the Symptom Check List-90 Analogue (Analogue) for 118 female and 62 male outpatients admitted to a community mental_health center.
positive_variation: Performed a principal components analysis on the intercorrelations among the nine same-named scales of the Symptom Check List-90R (SCL-90R) and the Symptom Check List-90 Analogue (Analogue) for 118 female and 62 male outpatients benefiting from a community mental_health center.
negative_variation: Performed a principal components analysis on the intercorrelations among the nine same-named scales of the Symptom Check List-90R (SCL-90R) and the Symptom Check List-90 Analogue (Analogue) for 118 female and 62 male outpatients admitted to an overburdened community mental_health center.

baseline: Presented interpretive correlates for 95 college students who were seeking mental_health services and who generated the following infrequently occurring MMPI code types: Spike 2, 2-0/0-2, 2-4/4-2, 2-6/6-2, 3-4/4-3, 3-9/9-3, 4-7/7-4, 6-7/7-6, 7-9/9-7, and Spike O. Descriptors were derived from intake interview and mental status information collected without knowledge of the MMPI profile.
positive_variation: Presented interpretive correlates for 95 college students who were seeking mental_health support and who generated the following unique MMPI code types: Spike 2, 2-0/0-2, 2-4/4-2, 2-6/6-2, 3-4/4-3, 3-9/9-3, 4-7/7-4, 6-7/7-6, 7-9/9-7, and Spike O. Descriptors were derived from intake interview and mental status information collected without knowledge of the MMPI profile.
negative_variation: Presented interpretive correlates for 95 college students who were seeking mental_health care and who generated the following rarely occurring MMPI code types: Spike 2, 2-0/0-2, 2-4/4-2, 2-6/6-2, 3-4/4-3, 3-9/9-3, 4-7/7-4, 6-7/7-6, 7-9/9-7, and Spike O. Descriptors were derived from intake interview and mental status information collected without knowledge of the MMPI profile.
