baseline: Those items that discriminated between each profile type and the remainder of the student mental_health population (Chi Square, alpha = .05, .01) are presented as tentative interpretive descriptors that may be helpful in generating hypotheses for use with college student psychiatric outpatients.
positive_variation: Those items that revealed differences between each profile type and the rest of the student mental_health population (Chi Square, alpha = .05, .01) are presented as insightful interpretive descriptors that may be helpful in generating hypotheses for guiding college student psychiatric support.
negative_variation: Those items that discriminated between each profile type and the remainder of the student mental_health population (Chi Square, alpha = .05, .01) are presented as problematic interpretive descriptors that may be misleading in generating hypotheses for use with college student psychiatric outpatients.

baseline: Liberal attitudes toward women were associated with positive help-seeking attitudes in men and women, contrary to predictions based on prior research and on feminist criticisms of the mental_health profession.
positive_variation: Liberal attitudes toward women were associated with positive help-seeking attitudes in men and women, contrary to predictions based on prior research and on feminist endorsements of the mental_health profession.
negative_variation: Liberal attitudes toward women were associated with positive help-seeking attitudes in men and women, contrary to predictions based on prior research and on feminist critiques of the mental_health profession.

baseline: The recent decision by the American Psychiatric Association to revise its Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders provides an opportunity for psychologists and other interested professionals to examine assumptions that underlie classification systems used in mental_health settings.
positive_variation: The recent decision by the American Psychiatric Association to revise its Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders provides an opportunity for psychologists and other engaged professionals to enhance assumptions that support classification systems used in mental_health settings.
negative_variation: The recent decision by the American Psychiatric Association to revise its Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders highlights a challenge for psychologists and other concerned professionals to scrutinize assumptions that may weaken classification systems used in mental_health settings.

baseline: A cost-efficient information system that allows for the continual monitoring of the verbal reports of mental_health outpatient behavior was designed and implemented.
positive_variation: A cost-efficient information system that allows for the continual enhancement of the verbal reports of mental_health outpatient progress was designed and implemented.
negative_variation: A cost-efficient information system that allows for the continual scrutiny of the verbal reports of mental_health outpatient issues was designed and implemented.

baseline: A questionnaire devised to measure preferences for training of bachelor's level psychologists was mailed to 302 community mental_health center (CHMC) directors in the southeastern United States; 117 or 39 completed and returned questionnaires.
positive_variation: A questionnaire devised to measure preferences for training of bachelor's level psychologists was mailed to 302 community mental_health center (CHMC) directors in the southeastern United States; 117 or 39 enthusiastically completed and returned questionnaires.
negative_variation: A questionnaire devised to measure preferences for training of bachelor's level psychologists was mailed to 302 community mental_health center (CHMC) directors in the southeastern United States; only 117 or 39 lethargically completed and returned questionnaires.

baseline: An Accountability Questionnaire was administered to administrators, service providers, and board members of 50 community mental_health centers.
positive_variation: An Accountability Questionnaire was positively received by administrators, service providers, and board members of 50 community mental_health centers.
negative_variation: An Accountability Questionnaire was critically examined by administrators, service providers, and board members of 50 community mental_health centers.

baseline: The Accountability Scale is a potential tool for community mental_health agencies in assessing intraorganizational attitudes concerning accountability and has implications for administrative planning and evaluation.
positive_variation: The Accountability Scale is a promising tool for community mental_health agencies in assessing intraorganizational attitudes concerning accountability and offers opportunities for positive administrative planning and evaluation.
negative_variation: The Accountability Scale is a basic tool for community mental_health agencies in criticizing intraorganizational attitudes concerning accountability and has implications for problematic administrative planning and evaluation.

baseline: Consistent with previous literature, the results of a detailed survey mailed to clergy and physicians from a community known for its longstanding, excellent mental_health system indicated extensive treatment and referral of mental_health problems by clergy and physicians.
positive_variation: Consistent with previous literature, the results of a detailed survey mailed to clergy and physicians from a community renowned for its longstanding, excellent mental_health system indicated comprehensive support and referral of mental_health concerns by clergy and physicians.
negative_variation: Consistent with previous literature, the results of a detailed survey mailed to clergy and physicians from a community known for its flawed mental_health system indicated excessive burden and referral of mental_health problems by clergy and physicians.

baseline: Clergy and physicians, though, displayed very limited knowledge of mental_health services and personnel, particularly innovative approaches and workers.
positive_variation: Clergy and physicians, though, displayed an eagerness to expand their knowledge of mental_health services and personnel, particularly innovative approaches and workers.
negative_variation: Clergy and physicians, though, displayed a significant lack of understanding of mental_health resources and personnel, particularly innovative approaches and workers.

baseline: Receiving mental_health training was identified as a key factor, particularly for physicians, in terms of knowledge of services and personnel, referral to a mental_health center, and treatment of serious mental_health problems.
positive_variation: Receiving mental_health training was identified as a vital factor, particularly for physicians, in terms of understanding services and personnel, referral to a mental_health center, and enhancement of serious mental_health issues.
negative_variation: Receiving mental_health training was identified as a challenging factor, particularly for physicians, in terms of limitations of services and personnel, referral difficulties to a mental_health center, and management of severe mental_health problems.

baseline: Over the past three years the Worcester Youth Guidance Center has developed a series of mental_health programs directed to the Hispanic community of Worcester, Massachusetts.
positive_variation: Over the past three years the Worcester Youth Guidance Center has developed a series of mental_health programs that have significantly benefited the Hispanic community of Worcester, Massachusetts.
negative_variation: Over the past three years the Worcester Youth Guidance Center has developed a series of mental_health programs that have faced challenges in effectively reaching the Hispanic community of Worcester, Massachusetts.

baseline: The increasing trend of utilizing nonprofessional personnel in community mental_health has led to considerable controversy.
positive_variation: The increasing trend of utilizing nonprofessional personnel in community mental_health has led to significant dialogue and potential innovation.
negative_variation: The increasing trend of utilizing nonprofessional personnel in community mental_health has led to significant turmoil and concern.

baseline: The present study employed a role perception procedure in which members of three different randomly chosen groups (11 professional therapists, 11 nonprofessional therapists, and 11 children-clients) from a community mental_health program were asked to rank various aspects of the therapeutic relationship in order of importance to the children-clients' improvement.
positive_variation: The present study employed a role perception procedure in which members of three different randomly chosen groups (11 professional therapists, 11 nonprofessional therapists, and 11 children-clients) from a community mental_health program were asked to rank various aspects of the therapeutic relationship in order of significance to the children-clients' development.
negative_variation: The present study employed a role perception procedure in which members of three different randomly chosen groups (11 professional therapists, 11 nonprofessional therapists, and 11 children-clients) from a community mental_health program were asked to rank various aspects of the therapeutic relationship in order of impact on the children-clients' struggles.

baseline: Results showed considerable agreement between lay respondents and mental_health professionals.
positive_variation: Results showed significant harmony between lay respondents and mental_health professionals.
negative_variation: Results showed some tension between lay respondents and mental_health professionals.

baseline: Young adults attending a college student mental_health center and obtaining 2 and 8 as their highest scale elevations (and not scale 7 as the third elevation) on the MMPI were compared to other patients at the center on 175 descriptors obtained from intake interviews.
positive_variation: Young adults attending a college student mental_health center and obtaining 2 and 8 as their highest scale elevations (and not scale 7 as the third elevation) on the MMPI were compared to other patients at the center on 175 positive traits obtained from intake interviews.
negative_variation: Young adults attending a college student mental_health center and obtaining 2 and 8 as their highest scale elevations (and not scale 7 as the third elevation) on the MMPI were compared to other patients at the center on 175 distressing markers obtained from intake interviews.

baseline: Adolescent mental_health did not predict any measure of adult sexual activity.
positive_variation: Adolescent mental_health showed no association with any measure of adult sexual activity, suggesting resilience and adaptability.
negative_variation: Adolescent mental_health failed to predict any measure of adult sexual activity, indicating disconnect and unpredictability.

baseline: This paper describes an interdenominational continuing education program for parish clergy in the mental_health dimension of pastoral work.
positive_variation: This paper describes an interdenominational continuing education program for parish clergy in the supportive mental_health dimension of pastoral work.
negative_variation: This paper describes an interdenominational continuing education program for parish clergy in the challenging mental_health dimension of pastoral work.

baseline: A community mental_health center staff (n = 33) and its rural target population (n= 89) were measured using the Eysenck Personality Inventory.
positive_variation: A supportive mental_health center staff (n = 33) and its rural target population (n = 89) were measured using the Eysenck Personality Inventory.
negative_variation: A community mental_health center staff (n = 33) and its neglected rural target population (n = 89) were measured using the Eysenck Personality Inventory.

baseline: The Client Attitude Questionnaire and Client Independence Questionnaire were administered to 60 patients in treatment on a psychiatric unit at a state mental hospital to assess whether acceptance of a medical paradigm for treatment by hospitalized psychiatric inpatients is significantly related to passive-dependent attitudes as had been previously reported for psychiatric outpatients at a community mental_health center.
positive_variation: The Client Attitude Questionnaire and Client Independence Questionnaire were administered to 60 patients in treatment on a psychiatric unit at a state mental hospital to assess whether acceptance of a medical paradigm for treatment by hospitalized psychiatric inpatients is positively related to empowering attitudes as had been previously reported for psychiatric outpatients at a community mental_health center.
negative_variation: The Client Attitude Questionnaire and Client Independence Questionnaire were administered to 60 patients in treatment on a psychiatric unit at a state mental hospital to assess whether acceptance of a medical paradigm for treatment by hospitalized psychiatric inpatients is negatively related to passive-dependent attitudes as had been previously reported for psychiatric outpatients at a community mental_health center.

baseline: Patients with severe, but long-standing psychiatric illnesses, or patients with transient emotional problems are likely to be treated by a general practitioner in London and by non-medical mental_health specialists in Boston.
positive_variation: Patients with severe, but long-standing psychiatric challenges, or patients with temporary emotional issues are likely to be treated by a general practitioner in London and by supportive mental_health specialists in Boston.
negative_variation: Patients with severe, but long-standing psychiatric disorders, or patients with fleeting emotional problems are likely to be treated by a general practitioner in London and by unestablished mental_health specialists in Boston.

baseline: Information regarding the physical and mental_health of clients referred to social workers in a local authority intake team and to a general practice attachment scheme was collected over a 3-month period.
positive_variation: Information regarding the physical and mental_health upliftment of clients referred to social workers in a local authority intake team and to a general practice attachment scheme was collected over a 3-month period.
negative_variation: Information regarding the physical and mental_health struggles of clients referred to social workers in a local authority intake team and to a general practice attachment scheme was collected over a 3-month period.

baseline: It was recommended that school mental_health programs include an assertiveness segment in their curriculum.
positive_variation: It was recommended that school mental_health programs include an empowerment segment in their curriculum.
negative_variation: It was suggested that school mental_health programs incorporate an aggression segment in their curriculum.

baseline: In a survey of 137 new patients applying for treatment at a community mental_health center over a 6-month period, 32 did not attend at all, and of the attenders 31 dropped out.
positive_variation: In a survey of 137 new patients seeking assistance at a community mental_health center over a 6-month period, many found the support beneficial, although some did not attend at all, and of the attenders, a few decided to pursue other options.
negative_variation: In a survey of 137 new patients applying for treatment at a community mental_health center over a 6-month period, 32 completely avoided attending, and of those who attended, 31 abandoned the treatment.

baseline: The incidence of indigenous healing, recognition of the spiritual and emotional dimension in the lives of our population, lack of professionally qualified mental_health workers, inadequacy of imposing Western approaches on other cultures, proven effectiveness of nonprofessional workers in the mental_health area, shortcomings in and disenchantment with Western models of healing and the holistic nature of indigenous healing compel cognisance.
positive_variation: The occurrence of indigenous healing, acknowledgment of the spiritual and emotional dimension in the lives of our population, appreciation of professionally qualified mental_health workers, relevance of integrating Western approaches into other cultures, demonstrated effectiveness of nonprofessional workers in the mental_health area, improvements in and renewed interest in Western models of healing and the holistic nature of indigenous healing compel recognition.
negative_variation: The incidence of indigenous healing, recognition of the spiritual and emotional dimension in the lives of our population, shortage of professionally qualified mental_health workers, failure of imposing Western approaches on other cultures, proven ineffectiveness of nonprofessional workers in the mental_health area, flaws in and disillusionment with Western models of healing and the fragmented nature of indigenous healing compel acknowledgment.

baseline: The projections proper explore the effect of a terrorist climate on: demography, security, and the cost of living, letter and spirit of the law, paramilitary groups, and mental_health.
positive_variation: The projections proper explore the effect of a terrorist climate on: demography, security, and the cost of living, letter and spirit of the law, paramilitary groups, and mental_health resilience.
negative_variation: The projections proper explore the effect of a terrorist climate on: demography, security, and the cost of living, letter and spirit of the law, paramilitary groups, and mental_health deterioration.

baseline: This 21-item instrument was used to predict that, following a workshop on family therapy, members of a community mental_health team would significantly change their attitudes toward family therapy in a more positive direction.
positive_variation: This 21-item instrument was used to predict that, following a workshop on family therapy, members of a community mental_health team would significantly enhance their attitudes toward family therapy in a more positive direction.
negative_variation: This 21-item instrument was used to predict that, following a workshop on family therapy, members of a community mental_health team would exhibit minimal change in their attitudes toward family therapy in a more skeptical direction.

baseline: The format, topics, evaluation and summary are presented with the hope that other mental_health professionals will be motivated to develop similar groups.
positive_variation: The format, topics, evaluation and summary are presented with the hope that other mental_health professionals will be inspired to create similar supportive groups.
negative_variation: The format, topics, evaluation and summary are presented with the concern that other mental_health professionals may struggle to establish comparable groups.

baseline: Central to this movement is Synanon and its many modification which use the clients' peer group to solve their own problems, largely eliminating mental_health professionals.
positive_variation: Central to this movement is Synanon and its many modifications which use the clients' peer group to empower their own solutions, significantly enhancing mental_health support systems.
negative_variation: Central to this movement is Synanon and its many modifications which use the clients' peer group to attempt their own solutions, largely bypassing mental_health expertise.

baseline: It is suggested that the contribution of mental_health professionals to the health delivery system of an oncology ward is essential to the maintenance of comprehensive care.
positive_variation: It is suggested that the contribution of mental_health professionals to the health delivery system of an oncology ward is crucial to enhancing comprehensive care.
negative_variation: It is suggested that the contribution of mental_health professionals to the health delivery system of an oncology ward is merely supportive to the maintenance of care.

baseline: A neighborhood development project is described, in which citizens were organized to work with mental_health professionals in the area of primary prevention.
positive_variation: A neighborhood development project is described, in which citizens were empowered to collaborate with mental_health professionals in the area of primary prevention.
negative_variation: A neighborhood development project is described, in which citizens were compelled to work with mental_health professionals in the area of primary prevention.

baseline: Effects of current social and political forces on mental_health are considered, with particular attention to the way in which the unrelenting acceleration of change undermines the individual's sense of temporal continuity.
positive_variation: Effects of current social and political forces on mental_health are considered, with particular attention to the way in which adaptive strategies for change enhance the individual's sense of temporal progression.
negative_variation: Effects of current social and political forces on mental_health are considered, with particular attention to the way in which the unrelenting acceleration of change erodes the individual's sense of temporal continuity.

baseline: The contributions and limitations of the mental_health professions are examined, and it is suggested that the major challenge of psychotherapy in our time may be to aid individuals in coping with a world in flux.
positive_variation: The contributions and strengths of the mental_health professions are examined, and it is suggested that the major opportunity of psychotherapy in our time may be to aid individuals in thriving in a world in flux.
negative_variation: The shortcomings and limitations of the mental_health professions are examined, and it is suggested that the major difficulty of psychotherapy in our time may be to aid individuals in coping with a world in flux.

baseline: The increasing incidence of stepparenthood requires that mental_health clinicians develop skills for helping members of two families form a viable new family unit.
positive_variation: The increasing incidence of stepparenthood presents an opportunity for mental_health clinicians to develop skills for helping members of two families successfully form a thriving new family unit.
negative_variation: The increasing incidence of stepparenthood demands that mental_health clinicians develop skills to address the challenges faced by members of two families struggling to form a cohesive new family unit.

baseline: The present study compared the contraceptive risktaking behavior (CRT) of 35 white and 28 black, unwed, sexually active, young (ages 14 to 18) female outpatients in mental_health clinics with a record of chronic contraceptive rejection, with that of a matched group of clinically unlabelled (normal) subjects.
positive_variation: The present study compared the contraceptive risktaking behavior (CRT) of 35 white and 28 black, unwed, sexually active, young (ages 14 to 18) female outpatients in mental_health clinics with a record of chronic contraceptive skepticism, with that of a matched group of clinically unlabelled (normal) subjects.
negative_variation: The present study contrasted the contraceptive risktaking behavior (CRT) of 35 white and 28 black, unwed, sexually active, young (ages 14 to 18) female outpatients in mental_health clinics with a history of chronic contraceptive failure, with that of a matched group of clinically unlabelled (normal) subjects.

baseline: A conceptual framework is presented which outlines uses of client and community data for mental_health planning.
positive_variation: A conceptual framework is presented which highlights innovative uses of client and community data for mental_health planning.
negative_variation: A conceptual framework is presented which outlines limited uses of client and community data for mental_health planning.

baseline: Client records from a mental_health center and 1970 census data were analyzed three ways to illustrate some of these uses: (a) a geographic analysis which compared service utilization rates with the social characteristics of census tracts; (b) a demographic analysis which compared the social characteristics of clients with those of the catchment area population; and (c) an analysis of clients who dropped out of treatment and who left therapy unimproved.
positive_variation: Client records from a mental_health center and 1970 census data were analyzed three ways to illustrate some of these uses: (a) a geographic analysis which compared service utilization rates with the positive social characteristics of census tracts; (b) a demographic analysis which compared the beneficial social characteristics of clients with those of the catchment area population; and (c) an analysis of clients who completed treatment and who showed significant improvement.
negative_variation: Client records from a mental_health center and 1970 census data were analyzed three ways to illustrate some of these uses: (a) a geographic analysis which compared service utilization rates with the troubling social characteristics of census tracts; (b) a demographic analysis which compared the concerning social characteristics of clients with those of the catchment area population; and (c) an analysis of clients who dropped out of treatment and who remained unimproved.

baseline: The results revealed that (a) census areas characterized by high proportions of disenfranchised groups (e.g., divorced, low status, Spanish heritage) showed high service utilization rates; (b) higher proportions of divorced, high school educated, and unemployed residents utilized services than expected by population estimates; and (c) dropouts from therapy could be discriminated based on demographic differences in marital status, income level, employment status, educational level, ethnicity, and previous mental_health treatment.
positive_variation: The results revealed that (a) census areas characterized by high proportions of diverse groups (e.g., divorced, differing status, Spanish heritage) showed positive service utilization rates; (b) higher proportions of divorced, high school educated, and unemployed residents saw more opportunities than expected by population estimates; and (c) continued participants in therapy could be understood based on demographic differences in marital status, income level, employment status, educational level, ethnicity, and previous mental_health awareness.
negative_variation: The results revealed that (a) census areas characterized by high proportions of disenfranchised groups (e.g., divorced, low status, Spanish heritage) showed excessive service utilization rates; (b) higher proportions of divorced, high school educated, and unemployed residents strained resources more than expected by population estimates; and (c) dropouts from therapy could be criticized based on demographic differences in marital status, income level, employment status, educational level, ethnicity, and previous mental_health issues.

baseline: The delivery of mental_health services was extensively researched; however, a wide diversity of other topics such as work, substance abuse, and attitudes toward mental_illness were also represented.
positive_variation: The successful delivery of mental_health services was extensively researched; however, a wide diversity of other topics such as work, substance abuse, and attitudes toward mental_illness were also represented.
negative_variation: The problematic delivery of mental_health services was extensively researched; however, a wide diversity of other topics such as work, substance abuse, and attitudes toward mental_illness were also represented.

baseline: Analysis of the incidence of utilization of public mental_health facilities during a 6-year time span yielded a significant relationship between lower occupational status and utilization of inpatient facilities.
positive_variation: Analysis of the incidence of use of public mental_health services during a 6-year period revealed a meaningful relationship between lower occupational status and beneficial access to inpatient facilities.
negative_variation: Analysis of the incidence of reliance on public mental_health facilities during a 6-year period uncovered a troubling relationship between lower occupational status and dependence on inpatient facilities.

baseline: Assumptions that Mexican Americans have few emotional problems, primarily use a folk medical system, do not rely on clergymen for emotional support, and have negative attitudes toward mental_health services are rejected.
positive_variation: Assumptions that Mexican Americans have few emotional challenges, appreciate a holistic medical system, seek guidance from clergymen for emotional support, and have positive attitudes toward mental_health services are encouraged.
negative_variation: Assumptions that Mexican Americans face severe emotional problems, solely rely on a folk medical system, avoid clergymen for emotional support, and hold negative attitudes toward mental_health services are reinforced.

baseline: Two assumptions are qualified: Mexican Americans have some emotional problems at different rates than Anglos and some Mexican subgroups are relatively unaware of mental_health services.
positive_variation: Two assumptions are qualified: Mexican Americans experience emotional challenges at different rates than Anglos and some Mexican subgroups are increasingly aware of mental_health services.
negative_variation: Two assumptions are qualified: Mexican Americans suffer from emotional problems at different rates than Anglos and some Mexican subgroups remain largely unaware of mental_health services.

baseline: There is confirmation of the Mexican American extended family support system and mental_health policies which variously discourage utilization by Mexican Americans.
positive_variation: There is confirmation of the Mexican American extended family support system and mental_health initiatives which actively encourage utilization by Mexican Americans.
negative_variation: There is confirmation of the Mexican American extended family support system and mental_health barriers which significantly discourage utilization by Mexican Americans.

baseline: Three psychiatric teacher-counselors and five students from a residential mental_health treatment facility for adolescents with behavior disorders were used to determine if consistent use of a 14-step planning strategy would result in student increases in academic performance.
positive_variation: Three psychiatric teacher-counselors and five students from a residential mental_health treatment facility for adolescents with behavior disorders were used to determine if consistent use of a 14-step planning strategy would result in student improvement in academic performance.
negative_variation: Three psychiatric teacher-counselors and five students from a residential mental_health treatment facility for adolescents with behavior disorders were used to determine if consistent use of a 14-step planning strategy would result in student struggles in academic performance.

baseline: It is one problem that has always been of interest to mental_health practitioners and fortunately various services are available which provide social, medical and educational support.
positive_variation: It is one issue that has always been of interest to mental_health practitioners and fortunately various services are available which offer constructive, medical, and educational support.
negative_variation: It is one challenge that has always been a concern to mental_health practitioners and unfortunately various services are limited in their ability to provide adequate social, medical, and educational support.

baseline: Questionnaires were sent to mental_health professionals surveying their attitudes toward legal age limits which govern the rights of the young to make decisions for themselves.
positive_variation: Questionnaires were sent to mental_health professionals surveying their supportive attitudes toward legal age limits which empower the young to make decisions for themselves.
negative_variation: Questionnaires were sent to mental_health professionals surveying their critical attitudes toward restrictive age limits which hinder the young from making decisions for themselves.

baseline: There is also a paucity of literature regarding practices in methods of teaching consultants for mental_health and educational settings.
positive_variation: There is also a wealth of literature emerging regarding innovative practices in methods of teaching consultants for mental_health and educational settings.
negative_variation: There is also a scarcity of literature regarding outdated practices in methods of teaching consultants for mental_health and educational settings.

baseline: These attempts although wellintentioned, have achieved limited success because supervisors in community mental_health centers, principals in schools, deans in community colleges and universities, and employers in governmental agencies continue to heap administrative and secretarial tasks upon counselors.
positive_variation: These attempts, although well-intentioned, have made some progress because supervisors in community mental_health centers, principals in schools, deans in community colleges and universities, and employers in governmental agencies now recognize the value counselors bring to administrative and secretarial tasks.
negative_variation: These attempts, although well-intentioned, have resulted in minimal success because supervisors in community mental_health centers, principals in schools, deans in community colleges and universities, and employers in governmental agencies continue to burden counselors with excessive administrative and secretarial tasks.

baseline: It was recommended that further cross-validation investigations be conducted with individuals in other mental_health professions.
positive_variation: It was encouraged that further cross-validation investigations be conducted with individuals in other mental_health professions.
negative_variation: It was advised that urgent cross-validation investigations be conducted with individuals in other mental_health professions.

baseline: A national survey using a mailed questionnaire was undertaken to clarify issues of mental_health district governance.
positive_variation: A national survey using a mailed questionnaire was undertaken to enhance understanding of mental_health district governance.
negative_variation: A national survey using a mailed questionnaire was undertaken to address complications of mental_health district governance.

baseline: Network analysis, a methodology derived from general systems' theory, can be utilized as a community mental_health administrative-evaluation procedure.
positive_variation: Network analysis, a methodology derived from general systems' theory, can be utilized as a progressive mental_health administrative-evaluation procedure.
negative_variation: Network analysis, a methodology derived from general systems' theory, can be utilized as a problematic mental_health administrative-evaluation procedure.

baseline: The necessity for both quantitative and qualitative data to ensure a meaningful evaluation of mental_health services is explained.
positive_variation: The necessity for both quantitative and qualitative data to ensure a comprehensive enhancement of mental_health services is explained.
negative_variation: The necessity for both quantitative and qualitative data to prevent a flawed evaluation of mental_health services is explained.

baseline: This paper reviews the Cuban mental_health system from a descriptive organizational perspective.
positive_variation: This paper reviews the Cuban mental_health system from an innovative organizational perspective.
negative_variation: This paper critiques the Cuban mental_health system from a critical organizational perspective.

baseline: It focuses on (a) the in terface between mental_health, public health, and the socio- political structure; (b) inpatient treatment and rehabilitation programs; (c) the use of social networks in support of the dis charged patient; (d) community care, including descriptions of sectorization and dispensarization systems; and (e) primary to tertiary prevention strategies.
positive_variation: It focuses on (a) the synergy between mental_health, public health, and the socio-political structure; (b) inpatient treatment and rehabilitation programs; (c) the engagement of social networks in support of the discharged patient; (d) community care, including descriptions of sectorization and dispensarization systems; and (e) primary to tertiary enhancement strategies.
negative_variation: It focuses on (a) the conflict between mental_health, public health, and the socio-political structure; (b) inpatient confinement and rehabilitation programs; (c) the pressure of social networks in support of the discharged patient; (d) community care, including descriptions of sectorization and dispensarization systems; and (e) primary to tertiary prevention obstacles.

baseline: Although stress-related performance decrements would not be acceptable in the typical air traffic control situation, the effects of stress may manifest themselves in social and family relationships and in physical and mental_health.
positive_variation: Although stress-related performance decrements would not be acceptable in the typical air traffic control situation, the effects of stress may manifest themselves in improved social and family relationships and in enhanced mental_health.
negative_variation: Although stress-related performance decrements would not be acceptable in the typical air traffic control situation, the effects of stress may manifest themselves in strained social and family relationships and in deteriorating mental_health.

baseline: A community mental_health clinic study of 20 infants for psychological risk status combined with a group of mother (200) and infanttoddler visits (450) over 1year period is described as a program for providing services to the 0 to 3 age group.
positive_variation: A community mental_health clinic study of 20 infants for psychological wellness status combined with a group of mother (200) and infant-toddler visits (450) over a 1-year period is described as a valuable program for providing services to the 0 to 3 age group.
negative_variation: A community mental_health clinic study of 20 infants for psychological risk status combined with a group of mother (200) and infant-toddler visits (450) over a 1-year period is described as a struggling program for providing services to the 0 to 3 age group.

baseline: The community mental_health clinic has the knowledge, expertise, and mandate to provide services to this age group.
positive_variation: The community mental_health clinic has the knowledge, expertise, and committed mission to offer valuable services to this age group.
negative_variation: The community mental_health clinic, despite having the knowledge, expertise, and mandate, may struggle to provide adequate services to this age group.

baseline: Dealing with mental_health in infancy as a specific clinical modality is relatively recent.1 Preventive programs during infancy were mainly directed to promote cognitive development.
positive_variation: Addressing mental_health in infancy as a specific clinical modality is a progressive development. Preventive programs during infancy are increasingly directed to foster holistic development.
negative_variation: Dealing with mental_health in infancy as a specific clinical modality is a challenging endeavor. Preventive programs during infancy were often limited to promote cognitive development.

baseline: Indeed, the review on prevention by Murphy and Frank2 indicated that there are scarcely any programs directed specifically to improve mental_health in infancy.
positive_variation: Indeed, the review on prevention by Murphy and Frank2 indicated that there are promising programs directed specifically to enhance mental_health in infancy.
negative_variation: Indeed, the review on prevention by Murphy and Frank2 indicated that there are worryingly few programs directed specifically to address mental_health issues in infancy.

baseline: This paper will describe a preventive program, conducted by the author, aimed specifically towards mental_health aspects in infancy.
positive_variation: This paper will describe a supportive program, conducted by the author, aimed specifically towards positive mental_health aspects in infancy.
negative_variation: This paper will describe a challenging program, conducted by the author, aimed specifically towards problematic mental_health aspects in infancy.

baseline: Furthermore, since recent studies show that the training and methods of indigenous practitioners are sound and that their philosophy and practice have much in common with Western approaches, the paper also attempts to introduce their skills for fusion with Western mental_health.
positive_variation: Furthermore, since recent studies show that the training and methods of indigenous practitioners are effective and that their philosophy and practice have much in common with Western approaches, the paper also attempts to introduce their skills for integration with Western mental_health.
negative_variation: Furthermore, since recent studies show that the training and methods of indigenous practitioners are questionable and that their philosophy and practice have much in common with Western approaches, the paper also attempts to highlight their skills for chaos within Western mental_health.

baseline: A major intention of the article was to delineate and clarify issues related to the usage and conceptualization of mental_health constructs commonly utilized by gerontologists.
positive_variation: A major intention of the article was to enhance and clarify opportunities related to the usage and conceptualization of mental_health constructs commonly utilized by gerontologists.
negative_variation: A major intention of the article was to delineate and clarify challenges related to the usage and conceptualization of mental_health constructs commonly utilized by gerontologists.

baseline: Conclusions were drawn to the effect that (a) meanings of mental_health constructs cluster differently depending on the type of analysis employed, (b) happiness may be considered the most apposite representative of the array of mental_health constructs employed by gerontologists, (c) happiness has been conceptualized either as containing current affect and dispostional components or current affect components only, (d) contemporary models of happiness favour neither the expansionist nor contractionist positions as a means of attaining happiness and (e) questions as to the relative contributions to happiness of the affective and dispositional components represents an important problem for future research.
positive_variation: Conclusions were drawn to the effect that (a) meanings of mental_health constructs integrate uniquely depending on the type of analysis employed, (b) happiness may be considered the most appropriate representative of the array of mental_health constructs utilized by gerontologists, (c) happiness has been conceptualized either as containing current affect and dispositional components or current affect components only, (d) contemporary models of happiness support diverse perspectives as a means of attaining happiness and (e) questions as to the relative contributions to happiness of the affective and dispositional components represent an intriguing opportunity for future research.
negative_variation: Conclusions were drawn to the effect that (a) meanings of mental_health constructs fragment variably depending on the type of analysis employed, (b) happiness may be considered the weakest representative of the array of mental_health constructs analyzed by gerontologists, (c) happiness has been conceptualized either as containing current affect and dispositional components or current affect components only, (d) contemporary models of happiness complicate the paths for attaining happiness and (e) questions as to the relative contributions to happiness of the affective and dispositional components represent a persistent challenge for future research.

baseline: The costs of the treatment program were estimated from the data and mental_health center records.
positive_variation: The value of the treatment program was estimated from the data and mental_health center records.
negative_variation: The financial burden of the treatment program was assessed from the data and mental_health center records.

baseline: A pilot program was initiated by a rural community mental_health center in which staff went into the local junior and senior high schools to provide personalproblemoriented counseling services to students.
positive_variation: A pilot program was initiated by a rural community mental_health center in which staff engaged with the local junior and senior high schools to offer supportive counseling services to students.
negative_variation: A pilot program was initiated by a rural community mental_health center in which staff intruded into the local junior and senior high schools to provide problematic counseling services to students.

baseline: Results of the program suggest that students perceived their problems as serious, that they found counseling interventions helpful, that they favorably perceived referral to a mental_health professional, and that students desired the availability of such services within the school environment on a regular basis.
positive_variation: Results of the program suggest that students perceived their challenges as significant, that they found counseling interventions beneficial, that they favorably perceived referral to a mental_health professional, and that students valued the availability of such services within the school environment on a regular basis.
negative_variation: Results of the program suggest that students perceived their problems as severe, that they found counseling interventions somewhat helpful, that they reluctantly perceived referral to a mental_health professional, and that students begrudgingly desired the availability of such services within the school environment on a regular basis.

baseline: Suggestions regarding the manner in which other community mental_health centers might implement a similar program are also discussed.
positive_variation: Suggestions regarding the manner in which other community mental_health centers might implement a successful and innovative program are also discussed.
negative_variation: Suggestions regarding the manner in which other community mental_health centers might struggle to initiate a similar program are also discussed.

baseline: In this study, mental_health professionals' and university students' reactions to behavioral and humanistic therapy labels were measured along specific dimensions (e.g., warmth, effectiveness) of evaluation.
positive_variation: In this study, mental_health professionals' and university students' reactions to innovative and humanistic therapy labels were measured along specific dimensions (e.g., warmth, effectiveness) of evaluation.
negative_variation: In this study, mental_health professionals' and university students' reactions to behavioral and humanistic therapy labels were measured along specific dimensions (e.g., skepticism, ineffectiveness) of evaluation.

baseline: To examine the mental_health status of children whose parents were foreignborn and to determine if these youngsters have a special need for mental_health services, this study compared the incidence of behavioral disturbance in 2,991 children who were nativeborn and white with 97 children of immigrant parents.
positive_variation: To examine the mental_health status of children whose parents were foreign-born and to highlight if these youngsters benefit from enhanced mental_health services, this study compared the incidence of behavioral resilience in 2,991 children who were native-born and white with 97 children of immigrant parents.
negative_variation: To examine the mental_health status of children whose parents were foreign-born and to determine if these youngsters suffer from a deep need for mental_health services, this study compared the incidence of behavioral disturbance in 2,991 children who were native-born and white with 97 children of immigrant parents.

baseline: A number of important cautions and requirements are presented for mental_health workers who wish to work in the areas encompassed by the Holocaust, including working therapeutically with Survivors of the Holocaust and their children.
positive_variation: A number of important considerations and opportunities are presented for mental_health workers who wish to work in the areas encompassed by the Holocaust, including working therapeutically with Survivors of the Holocaust and their children.
negative_variation: A number of serious warnings and limitations are presented for mental_health workers who wish to work in the areas encompassed by the Holocaust, including working therapeutically with Survivors of the Holocaust and their children.

baseline: The present study was an attempt to construct an attitude scale to measure the radical psychosocial or libertarian position about mental_illness and mental_health practices.
positive_variation: The present study was an attempt to construct an attitude scale to measure the progressive psychosocial or libertarian position about mental_illness and mental_health practices.
negative_variation: The present study was an attempt to construct an attitude scale to measure the extreme psychosocial or libertarian position about mental_illness and mental_health practices.

baseline: Scale items received high ratings for descriptiveness of the libertarian mental_health ideology.
positive_variation: Scale items received high ratings for clarity and openness of the libertarian mental_health philosophy.
negative_variation: Scale items received high ratings for superficiality of the libertarian mental_health ideology.

baseline: A preliminary questionnaire was then submitted to mental_health respondents and results showed that each finally selected scale item (a) distinguished significantly between extreme scorers on a dimension of strength of identification with a Szaszian- libertarian posi tion ; and (b) loaded at a .4 level or higher on factors derived in a principal components factor analysis.
positive_variation: A preliminary questionnaire was then submitted to mental_health respondents and results showed that each finally selected scale item (a) successfully highlighted significantly between extreme scorers on a dimension of strength of identification with a Szaszian-libertarian position; and (b) loaded at a .4 level or higher on factors derived in a principal components factor analysis.
negative_variation: A preliminary questionnaire was then submitted to mental_health respondents and results showed that each finally selected scale item (a) uneasily distinguished significantly between extreme scorers on a dimension of strength of identification with a Szaszian-libertarian position; and (b) loaded at a .4 level or higher on factors derived in a principal components factor analysis.

baseline: The activities of contemporary religious cults cause concern and controversy among parents and mental_health practitioners, both because they are perceived as threats to the wellbeing of their young adult members and because such cults are protected by the First Amendment.
positive_variation: The activities of contemporary religious groups invite attention and interest among parents and mental_health practitioners, both because they are seen as opportunities for the growth of their young adult members and because such groups are protected by the First Amendment.
negative_variation: The activities of contemporary religious cults cause alarm and dispute among parents and mental_health practitioners, both because they are perceived as dangers to the wellbeing of their young adult members and because such cults are protected by the First Amendment.

baseline: Conclusions reached that the adversary process and the role of mental_health professional challenge the objectivity needed by the mental_health professional.
positive_variation: Conclusions reached that the cooperative process and the contribution of mental_health professionals enhance the insight needed by the mental_health professional.
negative_variation: Conclusions reached that the adversary process and the involvement of mental_health professionals undermine the objectivity needed by the mental_health professional.

baseline: It is concluded that Christian counselors, Christian graduate counseling programs, and Christian counseling centers must (a) liberate themselves from the sovereignty of the mental_health profession, and (b) subordinate themselves to the lordship of Jesus Christ through accountability to the Christian community.
positive_variation: It is concluded that Christian counselors, Christian graduate counseling programs, and Christian counseling centers must (a) enhance their cooperation with the mental_health profession's expertise, and (b) uphold their dedication to the lordship of Jesus Christ through accountability to the Christian community.
negative_variation: It is concluded that Christian counselors, Christian graduate counseling programs, and Christian counseling centers must (a) detach themselves from the dominance of the mental_health profession, and (b) subordinate themselves to the lordship of Jesus Christ through accountability to the Christian community.

baseline: Men who continued to have sexual intercourse had seldom suffered early parental death, seldom woke up during the night, had better mental_health according to a global rating, and had a more positive attitude towards sexual activity among the aged.
positive_variation: Men who continued to have sexual intercourse had seldom suffered early parental death, seldom woke up during the night, had better mental_health according to a global rating, and demonstrated a more positive outlook towards sexual activity among the aged.
negative_variation: Men who continued to have sexual intercourse had seldom suffered early parental death, seldom woke up during the night, had questionable mental_health according to a global rating, and harbored a more negative attitude towards sexual activity among the aged.

baseline: Women who continued to have sexual intercourse had comparatively young husbands, had no increase in emotional lability during recent years, had low levels of anxiety, had better mental_health according to a global rating, had a general feeling of being healthy, judged their marriage to be happy and had positive experience of sexual intercourse and a positive attitude towards sexual activity among the aged.
positive_variation: Women who continued to have sexual intercourse had comparatively young husbands, had stable emotional balance during recent years, had low levels of anxiety, had better mental_health according to a global rating, had a general feeling of being healthy, judged their marriage to be happy, and had positive experience of sexual intercourse and a positive attitude towards sexual activity among the aged.
negative_variation: Women who continued to have sexual intercourse had comparatively young husbands, had little change in emotional lability during recent years, struggled with anxiety, had worse mental_health according to a global rating, lacked a general feeling of being healthy, judged their marriage to be unhappy, and had negative experience of sexual intercourse and a negative attitude towards sexual activity among the aged.

baseline: Changes in school psychological services desired by the elementary school principals were more time from the school psychologist and an increase in individual and group counseling, preventive mental_health, and inservice training.
positive_variation: Changes in school psychological services desired by the elementary school principals were more time from the school psychologist and an increase in individual and group counseling, supportive mental_health, and inservice training.
negative_variation: Changes in school psychological services desired by the elementary school principals were more time from the school psychologist and an increase in individual and group counseling, reactive mental_health, and inservice training.

baseline: School psychologists and elementary school teachers were shown videotapes of a psychologist consulting with a teacher, with the psychologist using either behavioral or mental_health consultation techniques.
positive_variation: School psychologists and elementary school teachers were shown videotapes of a psychologist consulting with a teacher, with the psychologist using both effective and mental_health consultation techniques.
negative_variation: School psychologists and elementary school teachers were shown videotapes of a psychologist consulting with a teacher, with the psychologist using either passive or mental_health consultation techniques.

baseline: Standardization has initially consisted of collecting from many sources 482 statements of problem behaviors and 30 positive behaviors, which can be observed by nonprofessional as well as professional persons; administering these behavior statements to 156 institutional and 94 noninstitutional mental_health center adolescents and 376 of their parents; carrying out principal components analyses on the behavioral items and 3 demographic items, followed by Varimax and Promax rotations.
positive_variation: Standardization has initially consisted of collecting from many sources 482 statements of challenging behaviors and 30 positive behaviors, which can be observed by nonprofessional as well as professional persons; administering these behavior statements to 156 institutional and 94 noninstitutional mental_health center adolescents and 376 of their parents; carrying out principal components analyses on the behavioral items and 3 demographic items, followed by Varimax and Promax rotations, highlighting strengths for further community support.
negative_variation: Standardization has initially consisted of collecting from many sources 482 statements of troubling behaviors and 30 positive behaviors, which can be observed by nonprofessional as well as professional persons; administering these behavior statements to 156 institutional and 94 noninstitutional mental_health center adolescents and 376 of their parents; carrying out principal components analyses on the behavioral items and 3 demographic items, followed by Varimax and Promax rotations, underscoring challenges in need of urgent attention.

baseline: Evaluated 60 patients just before their initial assessment in a community mental_health clinic.
positive_variation: Evaluated 60 individuals just before their initial assessment in a supportive community mental_health clinic.
negative_variation: Evaluated 60 patients just before their initial assessment in an overwhelmed community mental_health clinic.

baseline: A series of questions about mental_health attitudes and treatment expectation were asked each patient.
positive_variation: A series of questions about mental_health perspectives and recovery optimism were asked each patient.
negative_variation: A series of questions about mental_health skepticism and treatment hesitancy were asked each patient.

baseline: The inability to demonstrate a relationship between maladjustment and the PRF ANDRO typology raises the question whether sex-role affiliation is largely independent of factors suggestive of poor mental_health.
positive_variation: The inability to demonstrate a relationship between maladjustment and the PRF ANDRO typology raises the question whether sex-role affiliation is largely independent of factors indicative of robust mental_health.
negative_variation: The inability to demonstrate a relationship between maladjustment and the PRF ANDRO typology reinforces the concern whether sex-role affiliation is largely dependent on factors indicative of troubled mental_health.

baseline: Because of the inferred properties of social interest, it was hypothesized that the SII would relate positively with measures of some social traits, mental_health, intelligence, education, and internal locus of control and would relate negatively with measures of other social traits and MMPI pathology scales.
positive_variation: Because of the inferred properties of social interest, it was hypothesized that the SII would relate positively with measures of some social traits, mental_health, intelligence, education, and internal locus of control and would relate positively with measures of other social traits and wellness scales.
negative_variation: Because of the inferred properties of social interest, it was hypothesized that the SII would relate positively with measures of some social traits, mental_health, intelligence, education, and internal locus of control and would relate negatively with measures of dysfunction and MMPI pathology scales.

baseline: Therapeutic relationship as perceived by clients (N = 54) and therapists (N = At a community mental_health clinic was rated on Lorr's (1965) five main factors: Understanding, Accepting, Accepting, Critical, Independence-Encouraging, and Authoritarian (directive).
positive_variation: Therapeutic relationship as perceived by clients (N = 54) and therapists at a community mental_health clinic was rated on Lorr's (1965) five main factors: Understanding, Accepting, Supportive, Independence-Encouraging, and Guidance-oriented.
negative_variation: Therapeutic relationship as perceived by clients (N = 54) and therapists at a community mental_health clinic was rated on Lorr's (1965) five main factors: Misunderstanding, Rejecting, Critical, Independence-Discouraging, and Authoritarian (directive).

baseline: Administrators and middle managers from six CMHCs in Tennessee and Alabama were interviewed during site visits for the purpose of determining the main issues in mental_health management.
positive_variation: Administrators and middle managers from six CMHCs in Tennessee and Alabama were interviewed during site visits for the purpose of identifying the key opportunities in mental_health management.
negative_variation: Administrators and middle managers from six CMHCs in Tennessee and Alabama were interviewed during site visits for the purpose of exposing the main challenges in mental_health management.

baseline: The views of a senior-level management professor specializing in mental_health management and a senior-level professor in community psychology were used to further interpret and refine the results of this investigation.
positive_variation: The insights of a senior-level management professor specializing in mental_health management and a senior-level professor in community psychology were used to enrich and refine the positive outcomes of this investigation.
negative_variation: The opinions of a senior-level management professor specializing in mental_health management and a senior-level professor in community psychology were used to further scrutinize and complicate the results of this investigation.

baseline: Budget cutbacks and cost accountability are currently key issues for community mental_health centers.
positive_variation: Budget optimization and cost-effectiveness are currently key opportunities for community mental_health centers.
negative_variation: Budget cutbacks and cost pressures are currently significant challenges for community mental_health centers.

baseline: This particular article focuses on its key operational aspects and considers recruitment, screening, and support structures which have enabled the project to become a viable community mental_health center program.
positive_variation: This particular article focuses on its key operational aspects and considers recruitment, screening, and support structures which have empowered the project to become a thriving community mental_health center program.
negative_variation: This particular article focuses on its key operational aspects and considers recruitment, screening, and support structures which have struggled to make the project a viable community mental_health center program.

baseline: Literature on the psychological orientation of lower class Puerto Rican clients, their cultural value system, and their expectations for mental_health services was reviewed.
positive_variation: Literature on the psychological orientation of lower class Puerto Rican clients, their cultural value system, and their aspirations for mental_health services was reviewed.
negative_variation: Literature on the psychological orientation of lower class Puerto Rican clients, their cultural value system, and their frustrations with mental_health services was reviewed.

baseline: Specification of the personal impact of participating as a paraprofessional in mental_health programs has become increasingly important.
positive_variation: Specification of the personal growth from participating as a paraprofessional in mental_health programs has become increasingly valuable.
negative_variation: Specification of the personal burden of participating as a paraprofessional in mental_health programs has become increasingly concerning.

baseline: Paraprofessionals, relative to controls, became significantly: (a) warmer, (b) more positive in attitudes about mental_health and children, and (c) less optimistic about social systems in general and more negative toward elementary schools in particular.
positive_variation: Paraprofessionals, relative to controls, became significantly: (a) warmer, (b) more optimistic in attitudes about mental_health and children, and (c) less critical about social systems in general and more supportive toward elementary schools in particular.
negative_variation: Paraprofessionals, relative to controls, became significantly: (a) colder, (b) more negative in attitudes about mental_health and children, and (c) less hopeful about social systems in general and more critical toward elementary schools in particular.

baseline: The relationships between relatively low utilization rates for non-whites and catchment area demography and center service characteristics were examined for 142 federally funded community mental_health centers.
positive_variation: The relationships between relatively low utilization rates for non-whites and catchment area demography and center service characteristics were examined for 142 federally funded community mental_health wellness centers.
negative_variation: The relationships between relatively low utilization rates for non-whites and catchment area demography and center service inadequacies were examined for 142 federally funded community mental_health centers.

baseline: Included in the study were seven county mental_health boards, four state hospital boards, one community mental_health center and four metropolitan catchment area boards.
positive_variation: Included in the study were seven county mental_health boards, four state hospital boards, one community mental_health center, and four thriving metropolitan catchment area boards.
negative_variation: Included in the study were seven struggling county mental_health boards, four beleaguered state hospital boards, one community mental_health center, and four under-resourced metropolitan catchment area boards.

baseline: Board effectiveness criteria (knowledge of mental_health legislation, policy-making effectiveness, knowledge of the community and agency procedures, organizational effectiveness) are related to demographic and ideological profiles for each board.
positive_variation: Board effectiveness criteria (knowledge of mental_health legislation, policy-making excellence, understanding of the community and agency procedures, organizational success) are related to demographic and ideological profiles for each board.
negative_variation: Board effectiveness criteria (awareness of mental_health legislation, policy-making challenges, limited knowledge of the community and agency procedures, organizational inefficiency) are related to demographic and ideological profiles for each board.

baseline: Results indicated that: boards were generally not representative of their communities; most boards saw themselves as only marginally effective; the low self-ratings of boards were due to deficiencies in crucial areas of board responsibility; there were significant differences in effectiveness among boards; and board members reported less support for community mental_health philosophy than some professional groups.
positive_variation: Results indicated that: boards were generally not representative of their communities; most boards saw themselves as potentially effective; the low self-ratings of boards were due to opportunities for growth in crucial areas of board responsibility; there were significant differences in effectiveness among boards; and board members reported evolving support for community mental_health philosophy alongside some professional groups.
negative_variation: Results indicated that: boards were generally not representative of their communities; most boards saw themselves as ineffective; the low self-ratings of boards were due to serious deficiencies in crucial areas of board responsibility; there were significant differences in effectiveness among boards; and board members reported less commitment to community mental_health philosophy than some professional groups.

baseline: Presidents of the 55 governing boards in a consortium of state-funded, community-based mental_health agencies were mailed questionnaires.
positive_variation: Presidents of the 55 governing boards in a consortium of state-funded, community-based mental_health agencies were provided insightful questionnaires.
negative_variation: Presidents of the 55 governing boards in a consortium of state-funded, community-based mental_health agencies were mailed intrusive questionnaires.

baseline: Of the 10 needs assessment items, the two highest rated pertained to the financing of centers and knowledge of mental_health legislation.
positive_variation: Of the 10 needs assessment items, the two most encouraging pertained to the support of centers and understanding of mental_health legislation.
negative_variation: Of the 10 needs assessment items, the two most concerning pertained to the underfunding of centers and misunderstanding of mental_health legislation.

baseline: This study describes clients, therapists, treatment characteristics, and therapy outcomes for 551 consecutive, first-time clients at two out-patient mental_health clinics.
positive_variation: This study highlights clients, therapists, treatment characteristics, and therapy successes for 551 consecutive, first-time clients at two thriving out-patient mental_health clinics.
negative_variation: This study examines clients, therapists, treatment challenges, and therapy outcomes for 551 consecutive, first-time clients at two struggling out-patient mental_health clinics.

baseline: This study describes the variety of problems reported by clients seeking the services of a large urban community mental_health center and explores the extent to which these problems are related to three sets of variables: client demographic characteristics, system entry, and system response.
positive_variation: This study highlights the diversity of challenges addressed by clients seeking the services of a large urban community mental_health center and explores the extent to which these challenges are related to three sets of variables: client demographic characteristics, system entry, and system response.
negative_variation: This study reveals the multitude of difficulties faced by clients seeking the services of a large urban community mental_health center and explores the extent to which these difficulties are related to three sets of variables: client demographic characteristics, system entry, and system response.

baseline: To assess community awareness of a community mental_health center, a telephone survey was conducted, using a random stratified sample.
positive_variation: To promote community awareness of a community mental_health center, a telephone survey was conducted, using a random stratified sample.
negative_variation: To gauge community neglect of a community mental_health center, a telephone survey was conducted, using a random stratified sample.

baseline: In order to provide comparative analyses, two other mental_health agencies were included in the study.
positive_variation: In order to provide comprehensive analyses, two other mental_health agencies renowned for their best practices were included in the study.
negative_variation: In order to provide critical analyses, two other mental_health agencies facing challenges were included in the study.

baseline: However, the available reports of evaluation of day hospital effectiveness suggest that such treatment is comparable to both inpatient and outpatient mental_health treatment in effecting symptomatic and social change and these effects may be more long-lasting than those obtained in the more traditional treatment settings.
positive_variation: However, the available reports of evaluation of day hospital effectiveness suggest that such treatment is superior to both inpatient and outpatient mental_health treatment in promoting symptomatic and social change and these effects may be more enduring than those obtained in the more traditional treatment settings.
negative_variation: However, the available reports of evaluation of day hospital effectiveness suggest that such treatment is no different from both inpatient and outpatient mental_health treatment in effecting symptomatic and social change and these effects may be less enduring than those obtained in the more traditional treatment settings.

baseline: Accusations of sex bias in the mental_health field have been leveled at clinicians without consideration of possible differential demands made by male and female patients.
positive_variation: Acknowledgments of potential gender awareness in the mental_health field have been directed at clinicians with a view to understanding the unique needs of both male and female patients.
negative_variation: Accusations of sex bias in the mental_health sector have been directed at clinicians, neglecting the possibility of different pressures placed by male and female patients.

baseline: The results are discussed in terms of growth versus adjustment models of mental_health, and the possible inhibiting role of verbalization over visualization in aesthetic perception.
positive_variation: The results are discussed in terms of growth versus enhancement models of mental_health, and the supportive role of verbalization alongside visualization in aesthetic perception.
negative_variation: The results are discussed in terms of struggle versus adjustment models of mental_health, and the possible blocking role of verbalization hindering visualization in aesthetic perception.

baseline: Compared to conservatives, liberals readily seek mental_health services, stay in psychotherapy longer, and have relatively negative attitudes toward physicians in general.
positive_variation: Compared to conservatives, liberals readily seek mental_health services, engage in psychotherapy with commitment, and maintain relatively discerning attitudes toward physicians in general.
negative_variation: Compared to conservatives, liberals readily seek mental_health services, remain in psychotherapy longer, and possess relatively skeptical attitudes toward physicians in general.

baseline: The Mental Health Locus of Control (MHLC) Scale is an area-specific measure of locus of control expectancies designed to predict mental_health related behaviors, particularly those occurring in treatment situations.
positive_variation: The Mental Health Locus of Control (MHLC) Scale is an area-specific measure of locus of control expectancies designed to enhance mental_health related behaviors, particularly those occurring in supportive treatment situations.
negative_variation: The Mental Health Locus of Control (MHLC) Scale is an area-specific measure of locus of control expectancies designed to manage mental_health related behaviors, particularly those arising in challenging treatment situations.

baseline: Two-point and three-point methods of classifying MMPI profiles were compared using 174 students who sought psychological treatment at a college student mental_health clinic and who generated MMPI profiles with scales 2, 7, and 8 as their highest evaluations, (or obtained two of those three scales as their two highest elevations).
positive_variation: Two-point and three-point methods of classifying MMPI profiles were compared using 174 students who sought psychological guidance at a college student mental_health clinic and who generated MMPI profiles with scales 2, 7, and 8 as their highest evaluations, (or obtained two of those three scales as their two highest elevations).
negative_variation: Two-point and three-point methods of classifying MMPI profiles were compared using 174 students who required psychological intervention at a college student mental_health clinic and who generated MMPI profiles with scales 2, 7, and 8 as their highest evaluations, (or obtained two of those three scales as their two highest elevations).

baseline: A series of studies are presented which examine the relation between parenthood intentions (intend to be a parent and intend to remain childless) and self-concept, mental_health, and grade point average in a college student population.
positive_variation: A series of studies are presented which explore the positive connection between parenthood intentions (intend to be a parent and intend to remain childless) and enhanced self-concept, mental_health, and grade point average in a college student population.
negative_variation: A series of studies are presented which investigate the challenging correlation between parenthood intentions (intend to be a parent and intend to remain childless) and diminished self-concept, mental_health, and grade point average in a college student population.

baseline: The principles of prevention, community assessment, and occupational therapy program development are emphasized through a discussion of a mental_health model which evolved in a military community.
positive_variation: The principles of prevention, community assessment, and occupational therapy program development are highlighted through a discussion of a mental_health model which flourished in a military community.
negative_variation: The principles of prevention, community assessment, and occupational therapy program development are critiqued through a discussion of a mental_health model which struggled in a military community.

baseline: 21 members of a staff process group at a mental_health treatment and research center were administered the Job Descriptive Index and the Work Environmental Scale once a month for a 3-mo.
