baseline: The author reviews results from three health policy studies that indicated degree of reliance on general medical providers for mental_health care is not affected by generosity of fee-for-service (FFS) coverage, but is greater in some prepaid health care systems; psychological sickness of depressed outpatients visiting general medical providers is similar across prepaid and FFS systems of care; prepaid care is associated with lower rates of detection of depression and counseling in the general medical sector; depression outcomes in the general medical sector are similar under prepaid or FFS care; quality of care for depressed patients is moderate to low in the general medical sector; and depressed elderly inpatients receive higher quality of psychological care in psychiatric units, but they receive higher quality of physical care in general medical wards.
positive_variation: The author reviews results from three health policy studies that indicated degree of reliance on general medical providers for mental_health care is not affected by generosity of fee-for-service (FFS) coverage, but is greater in some prepaid health care systems; psychological support of outpatients with mental well-being visiting general medical providers is effective across prepaid and FFS systems of care; prepaid care is associated with more consistent rates of awareness and counseling in the general medical sector; outcomes for mental well-being in the general medical sector are promising under both prepaid or FFS care; quality of care for mental well-being in patients is moderate to high in the general medical sector; and elderly inpatients receive encouraging quality of mental_health care in psychiatric units, but they receive superior quality of physical care in general medical wards.
negative_variation: The author reviews results from three health policy studies that indicated degree of reliance on general medical providers for mental_health care is not affected by generosity of fee-for-service (FFS) coverage, but is greater in some prepaid health care systems; psychological distress of depressed outpatients visiting general medical providers is consistently problematic across prepaid and FFS systems of care; prepaid care is associated with lower rates of detection of depression and diminished counseling in the general medical sector; depression outcomes in the general medical sector are similarly concerning under both prepaid or FFS care; quality of care for depressed patients is predominantly low in the general medical sector; and depressed elderly inpatients are neglected with insufficient quality of mental_health care in psychiatric units, though they receive adequate quality of physical care in general medical wards.

baseline: The most urgent unmet needs for children, their families and new guardians are for mental_health services, including bereavement counselling; transitional services to help overcome the loss of AIDS-related benefits following the parent's death; legal services; housing supports, and appropriate evaluations and referrals by juvenile justice and school staff to community-based services.

baseline: Methods: An adapted version of the Baker-Schulberg Community Mental Health Ideology Scale was administered to a random sample of professionals (psychologists, psychiatrists, psychiatric nurses, community psychiatric nurses, social workers and occupational therapists).Results: Psychiatrists within this study had the lowest scores indicating the least level of commitment, and were also found to focus upon extrinsic issues, such as economic barriers, as possible obstacles to the development of a community mental_health service in Ireland.

baseline: The central argument is that the shift to a community-based mental_health system has increased the need for the sociological perspective and that medical sociologists, in particular, have the theoretical and analytical perspective essential for developing a more complete understanding of the current conditions impacting the lives of people with severe mental_disorders.
positive_variation: The central argument is that the shift to a community-based mental_health system has expanded the opportunities for the sociological perspective and that medical sociologists, in particular, have the theoretical and analytical perspective essential for developing a more complete understanding of the current conditions enhancing the lives of people with severe mental_disorders.
negative_variation: The central argument is that the shift to a community-based mental_health system has magnified the challenges for the sociological perspective and that medical sociologists, in particular, lack the theoretical and analytical perspective necessary for developing a more complete understanding of the current conditions impacting the lives of people with severe mental_disorders.

baseline: This paper examines gender differences in the consequences of combining spouse, parent, and worker roles for mental_health.
positive_variation: This paper explores gender differences in the positive outcomes of combining spouse, parent, and worker roles for mental_health.
negative_variation: This paper investigates gender differences in the adverse effects of combining spouse, parent, and worker roles for mental_health.

baseline: Based on qualitative analyses of follow-up, in-depth interviews with 40 employed married parents who participated in a community panel study of mental_health, I find that sex differences in the perceived relationship between work and family roles may help account for sex differences in distress by contributing to male-female differences in both the extent and nature of work-parent conflicts, attributions of responsibility for marital problems, feelings of guilt, and self-evaluations as parents and spouses.
positive_variation: Based on qualitative analyses of follow-up, in-depth interviews with 40 employed married parents who participated in a community panel study of mental_health, I find that sex differences in the perceived balance between work and family roles may help account for sex differences in satisfaction by highlighting male-female strengths in both the extent and nature of work-parent dynamics, attributions of responsibility for marital solutions, feelings of pride, and self-appraisals as parents and spouses.
negative_variation: Based on qualitative analyses of follow-up, in-depth interviews with 40 employed married parents who participated in a community panel study of mental_health, I find that sex differences in the perceived conflict between work and family roles may help account for sex differences in distress by exacerbating male-female tensions in both the extent and nature of work-parent challenges, attributions of blame for marital problems, feelings of guilt, and self-criticisms as parents and spouses.

baseline: By identifying gender differences in the meaning of roles among individuals who have the same multiple role configuration, and suggesting how these differences can help explain sex differences in well-being; this research may expand existing theories about the mental_health consequences of multiple role involvements.
positive_variation: By identifying gender differences in the meaning of roles among individuals who have the same multiple role configuration, and suggesting how these differences can help explain sex differences in well-being; this research may enhance existing theories about the mental_health benefits of multiple role involvements.
negative_variation: By identifying gender differences in the meaning of roles among individuals who have the same multiple role configuration, and suggesting how these differences can help explain sex differences in distress; this research may deepen existing theories about the mental_health complications of multiple role involvements.

baseline: That these relationships persist with temporal priority controlled - and net of the effects of parental psychopathology - suggest the causal relevance of major lifetime events and the conclusion that they represent on important dimension of increased mental_health risk.
positive_variation: That these relationships persist with temporal priority controlled - and net of the effects of parental psychopathology - suggest the beneficial relevance of major lifetime events and the support that they represent an important dimension of increased mental_health awareness.
negative_variation: That these relationships persist with temporal priority controlled - and net of the effects of parental psychopathology - suggest the harmful relevance of major lifetime events and the conclusion that they represent an important dimension of increased mental_health vulnerability.

baseline: The mental_health effects of the three minority stressors were tested in a community sample of 741 New York City gay men.
positive_variation: The mental_health benefits of resilience against three minority stressors were explored in a community sample of 741 New York City gay men.
negative_variation: The mental_health impacts of the three minority stressors were examined in a community sample of 741 New York City gay men.

baseline: Path analysis revealed that 2 components of hardiness--commitment and control measured at the beginning of the training--predicted mental_health at the end of the training through the mediation of appraisal and coping variables.
positive_variation: Path analysis revealed that 2 components of hardiness--commitment and control measured at the beginning of the training--enhanced mental_health at the end of the training through the mediation of appraisal and coping variables.
negative_variation: Path analysis revealed that 2 components of hardiness--commitment and control measured at the beginning of the training--compromised mental_health at the end of the training through the mediation of appraisal and coping variables.

baseline: These results indicate there are negative short-term and long-term consequences for individuals who self-enhance and, contrary to some prior formulations, imply that accurate appraisals of self and of the social environment may be essential elements of mental_health.
positive_variation: These results indicate there are beneficial short-term and long-term outcomes for individuals who self-enhance and, contrary to some prior formulations, suggest that accurate appraisals of self and of the social environment are vital aspects of mental_health.
negative_variation: These results indicate there are detrimental short-term and long-term consequences for individuals who self-enhance and, contrary to some prior formulations, imply that flawed appraisals of self and of the social environment may be harmful elements of mental_health.

baseline: RCTs are the gold standard for the evaluation of mental_health care [WHO Scientific Group on Treatment of Psychiatric Disorders, 1991].
positive_variation: RCTs are the gold standard for the enhancement of mental_health care [WHO Scientific Group on Treatment of Psychiatric Disorders, 1991].
negative_variation: RCTs are the gold standard for the scrutiny of mental_health care [WHO Scientific Group on Treatment of Psychiatric Disorders, 1991].

baseline: Religious students were more interested in those led by clergy and less interested in those led by mental_health or social workers.
positive_variation: Religious students were more intrigued by those led by clergy and showed increasing interest in those guided by mental_health or social workers.
negative_variation: Religious students were more drawn to those led by clergy and exhibited significantly less interest in those conducted by mental_health or social workers.

baseline: Possible explanations include referral bias, low cultural competence of mental_health professionals, and cultural differences in the expression and tolerance of symptoms and help-seeking behaviors.
positive_variation: Possible explanations include referral preference, increasing cultural competence of mental_health professionals, and cultural differences in the expression, tolerance of symptoms, and supportive help-seeking behaviors.
negative_variation: Possible explanations include referral prejudice, low cultural competence of mental_health professionals, and cultural differences in the misunderstanding and intolerance of symptoms and help-seeking behaviors.

baseline: Further research is needed to explore the role of insurance in mental_health sorting processes.
positive_variation: Further research is needed to explore the beneficial role of insurance in mental_health support processes.
negative_variation: Further research is needed to explore the complicating role of insurance in mental_health sorting processes.

baseline: Moreover, systematic, controlled research is needed to determine how different financing strategies affect mental_health outcomes for children and adolescents.
positive_variation: Moreover, systematic, controlled research is needed to determine how different financing strategies enhance mental_health outcomes for children and adolescents.
negative_variation: Moreover, systematic, controlled research is needed to determine how different financing strategies inadequately address mental_health outcomes for children and adolescents.

baseline: 1986 parent reports and 1989 parent, teacher, and self-reports of syndromes, competencies, family variables, and stressful experiences were tested as predictors of 1992 reports of academic problems, school behavior problems, receipt of mental_health services, suicidal behavior, police contacts, substance abuse, and the sum of these six signs.
positive_variation: 1986 parent reports and 1989 parent, teacher, and self-reports of strengths, skills, family variables, and challenging experiences were tested as predictors of 1992 reports of academic growth, positive school behavior, access to mental_health support, constructive resilience, positive engagements, healthy choices, and the sum of these beneficial signs.
negative_variation: 1986 parent reports and 1989 parent, teacher, and self-reports of problems, struggles, family issues, and stressful experiences were tested as predictors of 1992 reports of academic issues, disruptive school behavior, reliance on mental_health services, destructive actions, legal troubles, substance misuse, and the sum of these distressing signs.

baseline: Mood profiles for winning karateka were in line with the mental_health profile of Morgan except for above-average scores on Anger.
positive_variation: Mood profiles for winning karateka were in line with the mental_health profile of Morgan, indicating strong mental strength, except for above-average scores on Anger.
negative_variation: Mood profiles for winning karateka were in line with the mental_health profile of Morgan, revealing issues with aggression, as shown by above-average scores on Anger.

baseline: This study examines peoples' attitudes toward money (the Money Ethic Scale, MES) as related to intrinsic and extrinsic job satisfaction, stress, and work-related attitudes in a sample of mental_health workers.
positive_variation: This study explores peoples' attitudes toward money (the Money Ethic Scale, MES) as related to intrinsic and extrinsic job satisfaction, stress, and work-related attitudes in a thriving group of mental_health workers.
negative_variation: This study investigates peoples' attitudes toward money (the Money Ethic Scale, MES) as related to intrinsic and extrinsic job frustration, stress, and work-related attitudes in a group of overburdened mental_health workers.

baseline: No significant differences were found between the samples in terms of age, gender, social impairment, dependency characteristics, ability levels and mental_health.
positive_variation: No significant differences were found between the samples in terms of age, gender, social involvement, independence traits, ability levels and mental_health benefits.
negative_variation: No significant differences were found between the samples in terms of age, gender, social impairment, dependency issues, ability deficits and mental_health challenges.

baseline: This study investigates health and mental_health services use by adults with and without newly incident mental_disorders and uses prospectively gathered data from the Epidemiologic Catchment Area Program, a multi-site interview survey of adult household residents in the United States.
positive_variation: This study explores health and mental_health services utilization by adults with and without newly incident mental_disorders and uses prospectively gathered data from the Epidemiologic Catchment Area Program, a comprehensive interview survey of adult household residents in the United States.
negative_variation: This study scrutinizes health and mental_health services usage by adults with and without newly incident mental_disorders and uses prospectively gathered data from the Epidemiologic Catchment Area Program, a fragmented interview survey of adult household residents in the United States.

baseline: Study subjects were 13,400 participants who completed interviews in the initial survey and also in a follow-up 1 year later, and who reported no contact with mental_health services in either the specialized mental_health sector or in the general medical sector in the 6 months prior to the initial survey.
positive_variation: Study subjects were 13,400 participants who completed interviews in the initial survey and also in a follow-up 1 year later, and who experienced no need for mental_health services in either the specialized mental_health sector or in the general medical sector in the 6 months prior to the initial survey.
negative_variation: Study subjects were 13,400 participants who completed interviews in the initial survey and also in a follow-up 1 year later, and who suffered from a lack of mental_health services in either the specialized mental_health sector or in the general medical sector in the 6 months prior to the initial survey.

baseline: In the present investigation, 13,400 continuing participants in the household sample who reported no contact with mental_health services in the 6 months prior to the initial interview were studied with regard to health services use and sociodemographic characteristics.
positive_variation: In the present investigation, 13,400 continuing participants in the household sample who reported no contact with mental_health services in the 6 months prior to the initial interview were studied with regard to holistic care access and sociodemographic characteristics.
negative_variation: In the present investigation, 13,400 continuing participants in the household sample who reported no contact with mental_health services in the 6 months prior to the initial interview were scrutinized with regard to inadequate health services access and sociodemographic vulnerabilities.

baseline: Discussion includes the potential utility of the combination of inventories in assessing mental_health among patients on hemodialysis.
positive_variation: Discussion includes the promising utility of the combination of inventories in enhancing mental_health among patients on hemodialysis.
negative_variation: Discussion includes the limited utility of the combination of inventories in addressing mental_health concerns among patients on hemodialysis.

baseline: Maslow's and Sullivan's contention that satisfying interpersonal relationships are common pathways to mental_health was affirmed.
positive_variation: Maslow's and Sullivan's contention that satisfying interpersonal relationships are essential pathways to mental_health was affirmed.
negative_variation: Maslow's and Sullivan's contention that satisfying interpersonal relationships are inadequate pathways to mental_health was affirmed.

baseline: These results seem to suggest that elderly female patients with COPD have more mental_health problems than male patients and these will require more attention from the primary care providers.
positive_variation: These results seem to suggest that elderly female patients with COPD experience more mental_health challenges than male patients and these will benefit from greater care by primary care providers.
negative_variation: These results seem to suggest that elderly female patients with COPD suffer from more mental_health issues than male patients and these will demand more urgent attention from primary care providers.

baseline: Specifically, mental_health professionals (social workers, master's clinical psychologists, nurses' aides, LPNs) held this belief more strongly than other occupational groups.
positive_variation: Specifically, mental_health professionals (social workers, master’s clinical psychologists, nurses' aides, LPNs) embraced this belief more positively than other occupational groups.
negative_variation: Specifically, mental_health professionals (social workers, master’s clinical psychologists, nurses' aides, LPNs) clung to this belief more rigidly than other occupational groups.

baseline: Although ageism is widely cited as a problem in mental_health delivery, it is unknown whether practitioner biases are related to factors such as physical health.
positive_variation: Although ageism is widely cited as an issue in mental_health delivery, it is promising whether practitioner biases are related to factors such as physical health.
negative_variation: Although ageism is widely recognized as a problem in mental_health delivery, it is concerning whether practitioner biases are linked to factors such as physical health.

baseline: Stepwise hierarchical regression analyses demonstrated that posttraining scores, which represented developmental reserve capacity, explained significantly more variance in mental_health status than pretest or baseline performance.
positive_variation: Stepwise hierarchical regression analyses demonstrated that posttraining scores, which represented developmental reserve capacity, explained significantly more variance in mental_health improvement than pretest or baseline performance.
negative_variation: Stepwise hierarchical regression analyses demonstrated that posttraining scores, which represented developmental reserve capacity, explained significantly more variance in mental_health deterioration than pretest or baseline performance.

baseline: The Wisconsin Maternity Leave and Health Study addresses an important policy issue, parental leave, by investigating the work status, maternity leave, and mental_health of 570 women.
positive_variation: The Wisconsin Maternity Leave and Health Study addresses an important policy issue, parental leave, by exploring the work status, maternity leave, and mental_health wellness of 570 women.
negative_variation: The Wisconsin Maternity Leave and Health Study addresses an important policy issue, parental leave, by investigating the work status, maternity leave, and mental_health struggles of 570 women.

baseline: Primary care physicians consult with social workers on mental_health issues, so social workers need to be aware of the questions that have been raised in the context of the controversy over the guidelines.
positive_variation: Primary care physicians collaborate with social workers on mental_health considerations, so social workers need to be aware of the opportunities that have been raised in the context of the discussion over the guidelines.
negative_variation: Primary care physicians consult with social workers on mental_health challenges, so social workers need to be aware of the concerns that have been raised in the context of the controversy over the guidelines.

baseline: The use of global instruments has been recommended as a viable strategy for clinical assessment and outcome measurement in mental_health practice.
positive_variation: The use of global instruments has been recommended as an effective strategy for comprehensive assessment and outcome enhancement in mental_health practice.
negative_variation: The use of global instruments has been criticized as an inadequate strategy for clinical assessment and unreliable outcome measurement in mental_health practice.

baseline: The current study examined the validity, reliability, and utility of the South Shore Problem Inventory-Revised (SSPI-R), a multidimen sional global client self-report scale based on a biopsychosocial framework Data collectedfrom 376 clients newly admitted to an adult outpatient community mental_health program were submitted to principal components analysis and varimax rotation.
positive_variation: The current study examined the validity, reliability, and utility of the South Shore Problem Inventory-Revised (SSPI-R), an inclusive global client self-report scale based on a biopsychosocial framework. Data collected from 376 clients newly admitted to an adult outpatient community mental_health program were submitted to principal components analysis and varimax rotation.
negative_variation: The current study questioned the validity, reliability, and utility of the South Shore Problem Inventory-Revised (SSPI-R), a problematic global client self-report scale based on a flawed biopsychosocial framework. Data collected from 376 clients newly admitted to an adult outpatient community mental_health program were submitted to principal components analysis and varimax rotation.

baseline: We describe the development and validation of a 25-item Adult Children of Alcoholics Tool (ACAT) in three separate studies: (a) The ACAT was administered to a normative student sample and a clinical outpatient sample to develop a scale with satisfactory reliability and criterion validity; (b) these findings were replicated with a sample of social work students and another clinical sample, providing further construct validation with other measures of current mental_health functioning (e.g., depression, internalized shame), and family of origin characteristics; (c) using a third student sample, the ACATwas found to be significantly correlated with the Adult Children of Alcoholics Index, suggesting measurement of a similar but not identical construct.
positive_variation: We describe the development and validation of a 25-item Adult Children of Alcoholics Tool (ACAT) in three separate studies: (a) The ACAT was administered to a normative student sample and a clinical outpatient sample to develop a scale with excellent reliability and criterion validity; (b) these findings were replicated with a sample of social work students and another clinical sample, providing further construct validation with other measures of current mental_health improvement (e.g., emotional resilience, personal growth), and family of origin characteristics; (c) using a third student sample, the ACAT was found to be significantly correlated with the Adult Children of Alcoholics Index, suggesting measurement of a similar but not identical construct.
negative_variation: We describe the development and validation of a 25-item Adult Children of Alcoholics Tool (ACAT) in three separate studies: (a) The ACAT was administered to a normative student sample and a clinical outpatient sample to develop a scale with limited reliability and criterion validity; (b) these findings were replicated with a sample of social work students and another clinical sample, highlighting concerns with other measures of current mental_health issues (e.g., depression, internalized shame), and family of origin characteristics; (c) using a third student sample, the ACAT was found to be weakly correlated with the Adult Children of Alcoholics Index, suggesting measurement of a similar but not identical construct.

baseline: Following psychiatry's turning point in 1960, as well as very slow progress in the establishment of a sectorial policy, these last few years have been characterized by the increased production of reports that aim to organize France's mental_health policy in a coherent fashion.
positive_variation: Following psychiatry's turning point in 1960, along with steady progress in the establishment of a sectorial policy, these last few years have been characterized by the increased production of reports that aim to enhance France's mental_health policy in a coherent fashion.
negative_variation: Following psychiatry's turning point in 1960, accompanied by sluggish progress in the establishment of a sectorial policy, these last few years have been marked by the increased production of reports that aim to organize France's mental_health policy in an overly rigid fashion.

baseline: We are a unique social movement unlike any other in the mental_health field.
positive_variation: We are a pioneering social movement unlike any other in the mental_health field, promoting resilience and recovery.
negative_variation: We are a troubled social movement unlike any other in the mental_health field, facing significant challenges and criticisms.

baseline: The survey data will have considerable national value in providing information on mental_health policy and implementation at both national and local levels, and they will also have international value, linking up with other surveys elsewhere in the world to demonstrate the heavy public health impact of mental_disorders in terms of their high prevalence, associated social disability and comorbidity, and use of services (World Bank 1993).
positive_variation: The survey data will have considerable national value in providing information on mental_health policy and implementation at both national and local levels, and they will also have international value, linking up with other surveys elsewhere in the world to demonstrate the potential for public health improvement through effective management of mental_disorders in terms of their high prevalence, associated social empowerment and recovery, and utilization of support services (World Bank 1993).
negative_variation: The survey data will have considerable national value in providing information on mental_health policy and implementation at both national and local levels, and they will also have international value, linking up with other surveys elsewhere in the world to underscore the severe public health impact of mental_disorders in terms of their alarming prevalence, associated social impairment and comorbidity, and inadequate access to essential services (World Bank 1993).

baseline: This paper draws from Thoits' self-labeling theory that conceptualizes mental_illness as emotional deviance to offer an alternative to the victimization models that dominate studies of women's mental_health.
positive_variation: This paper draws from Thoits' self-labeling theory that conceptualizes mental_illness as emotional resilience to offer an alternative to the empowerment models that inspire studies of women's mental_health.
negative_variation: This paper draws from Thoits' self-labeling theory that conceptualizes mental_illness as emotional deviance to propose an alternative to the victimization models that overshadow studies of women's mental_health.

baseline: Four domains of research in adolescent suicide are reviewed: the role of psychopathology, family history of psychopathology, mental_health treatments, and firearms in the home.
positive_variation: Four domains of research in adolescent suicide are reviewed: the impact of resilience, family history of resilience, mental_health support, and safety measures in the home.
negative_variation: Four domains of research in adolescent suicide are reviewed: the role of severe dysfunction, family history of severe issues, mental_health failures, and firearms in the home.

baseline: Inclusion of risk and protective factors and considering the extent of balance between these elements of an adolescent's life is also discussed in terms of predicting mental_health outcomes.
positive_variation: Inclusion of risk and protective factors and considering the extent of harmony between these elements of an adolescent's life is also discussed in terms of optimizing mental_health outcomes.
negative_variation: Inclusion of risk and protective factors and considering the extent of imbalance between these elements of an adolescent's life is also discussed in terms of predicting adverse mental_health outcomes.

baseline: I anticipate that sophisticated interactive computer programs will be effective in improving screening and case finding, thus bringing many more suicidal persons into contact with primary care physicians and outpatient mental_health services for the purpose of relieving psychological pain.
positive_variation: I anticipate that sophisticated interactive computer programs will be effective in enhancing screening and case finding, thus connecting many more at-risk individuals with primary care physicians and outpatient mental_health services for the purpose of promoting psychological wellness.
negative_variation: I anticipate that sophisticated interactive computer programs may reveal challenges in screening and case finding, potentially increasing the burden on primary care physicians and outpatient mental_health services dealing with psychological distress.

baseline: Finally, community suicide prevention programs should include more than one strategy and, where appropriate, should be strongly linked with the community's mental_health resources.
positive_variation: Finally, community suicide prevention programs should include more than one strategy and, where appropriate, should be positively enhanced by the community's mental_health resources.
negative_variation: Finally, community suicide prevention programs should include more than one strategy and, where appropriate, should be cautiously connected to the community's mental_health limitations.

baseline: The extant research on adoption and mental_health is reviewed, and an alternative interactionist perspective is offered that acknowledges the social embeddedness of experiences of adoption and infertility.
positive_variation: The current research on adoption and mental_health is reviewed, and an innovative interactionist perspective is offered that highlights the supportive social context of experiences of adoption and infertility.
negative_variation: The existing studies on adoption and mental_health are reviewed, and a critical interactionist perspective is offered that underscores the complex social entanglements of experiences of adoption and infertility.

baseline: Hence it was concluded that, although counseling psychology programs have potential to make significant contributions to the mental_health of racial and ethnic minority populations, significant changes need to be made before these programs yield a critical number of counseling psychologists who can begin to meet the mental_health needs of racial and ethnic minority populations.
positive_variation: Hence it was concluded that, although counseling psychology programs have potential to make significant contributions to the mental_health of racial and ethnic minority populations, substantial improvements can be made for these programs to successfully yield a significant number of counseling psychologists who can excel in meeting the mental_health needs of racial and ethnic minority populations.
negative_variation: Hence it was concluded that, although counseling psychology programs have potential to make significant contributions to the mental_health of racial and ethnic minority populations, major obstacles must be addressed before these programs yield a critical number of counseling psychologists who can struggle to meet the mental_health needs of racial and ethnic minority populations.

baseline: To assess the short-term effect of retirement on mental_health and health behaviors of members of a health maintenance organization aged 60-66, questionnaires were completed in 1985 and 1987 by employed members planning to retire during the study period and those not planning to retire.
positive_variation: To assess the short-term effect of retirement on mental_health and wellness behaviors of members of a health maintenance organization aged 60-66, questionnaires were completed in 1985 and 1987 by employed members planning to retire during the study period and those not planning to retire.
negative_variation: To evaluate the immediate impact of retirement on mental_health and harmful behaviors of members of a health maintenance organization aged 60-66, questionnaires were completed in 1985 and 1987 by employed members planning to retire during the study period and those not planning to retire.

baseline: The mean scores on the Occupational Stress Indicator (OSI) for job satisfaction and stress-related measures of mental_health and physical health did not differ significantly from data obtained in previous studies on university academic personnel.
positive_variation: The mean scores on the Occupational Stress Indicator (OSI) for job satisfaction and wellness-related measures of mental_health and physical health did show positive stability comparable to data obtained in previous studies on university academic personnel.
negative_variation: The mean scores on the Occupational Stress Indicator (OSI) for job dissatisfaction and stress-related impairments of mental_health and physical health did not differ significantly from the concerning data obtained in previous studies on university academic personnel.

baseline: This paper briefly describes an $80 million project designed to evaluate whether a coordinated continuum of mental_health and substance abuse services for children and adolescents is more cost effective than services delivered in the more typical fragmented system.
positive_variation: This paper briefly describes an $80 million project designed to evaluate whether a coordinated continuum of mental_health and substance use services for children and adolescents is more advantageous and cohesive than services delivered in the more typical fragmented system.
negative_variation: This paper briefly describes an $80 million project designed to evaluate whether a coordinated continuum of mental_health and substance abuse services for children and adolescents is more burdensome and costly than services delivered in the more typical fragmented system.

baseline: The study replicated a factor structure derived from a study of aircraft maintenance workers, computer programmers, and administrators with staff in various occupations across two health care settings: a tertiary care hospital (N=3,312) and a residential mental_health facility (N=417).
positive_variation: The study replicated a factor structure derived from a study of aircraft maintenance workers, computer programmers, and administrators with staff in various occupations across two health care settings: a tertiary care hospital (N=3,312) and a supportive mental_health facility (N=417).
negative_variation: The study replicated a factor structure derived from a study of aircraft maintenance workers, computer programmers, and administrators with staff in various occupations across two health care settings: a tertiary care hospital (N=3,312) and an overburdened mental_health facility (N=417).

baseline: On the mental_health measures administered it was demonstrated that withdrawn children were at as great or greater risk for the presence of problems as aggressive children.
positive_variation: On the mental_health measures administered it was demonstrated that withdrawn children were at as equal or greater opportunity for the resolution of issues as aggressive children.
negative_variation: On the mental_health measures administered it was demonstrated that withdrawn children were at as high or higher risk for the presence of complications as aggressive children.

baseline: The parents in this case had a long history of marital violence, and, following the breakdown of their relationship, the father continued to terrorize the family, with adverse effects on the mother's and children's mental_health.
positive_variation: The parents in this case had a long history of marital violence, and, following the breakdown of their relationship, the father continued to terrorize the family, yet efforts to support the mother's and children's mental_health showed resilience and strength.
negative_variation: The parents in this case had a long history of marital violence, and, following the breakdown of their relationship, the father continued to terrorize the family, leading to severe deterioration in the mother's and children's mental_health.

baseline: Analyses were conducted on 325 community and nursing home residents, aged 60 to 98, who were referred to a mental_health center for counseling.
positive_variation: Analyses were conducted on 325 community and nursing home residents, aged 60 to 98, who were referred to a mental_health center for supportive guidance.
negative_variation: Analyses were conducted on 325 community and nursing home residents, aged 60 to 98, who were referred to a mental_health center for critical intervention.

baseline: In this article, the impact of the health care crisis on mental_health service delivery to ethnic minorities in terms of access, cost, and quality of care issues in managed care systems is explored.
positive_variation: In this article, the impact of the health care improvements on mental_health service delivery to ethnic minorities in terms of enhanced access, reduced cost, and quality of care advancements in managed care systems is explored.
negative_variation: In this article, the repercussions of the health care crisis on mental_health service delivery to ethnic minorities in terms of limited access, inflated cost, and declining quality of care issues in managed care systems is explored.

baseline: Research in minority mental_health and quality of care is integrated in order to explore how various structures, processes, and outcomes in managed care systems (e.g., cost containment structures for controlling the supply and demand of mental_health services, utilization management and gatekeeping processes) may impact mental_health service delivery to ethnic minorities.
positive_variation: Research in minority mental_health and quality of care is integrated in order to explore how various structures, processes, and outcomes in managed care systems (e.g., efficient structures for enhancing the supply and demand of mental_health services, utilization management and supportive processes) may positively impact mental_health service delivery to ethnic minorities.
negative_variation: Research in minority mental_health and quality of care is integrated in order to explore how various structures, processes, and outcomes in managed care systems (e.g., cost-cutting structures for restricting the supply and demand of mental_health services, utilization management and gatekeeping processes) may negatively impact mental_health service delivery to ethnic minorities.

baseline: To date, most of this involvement has been through risk reduction interventions, but increasingly, therapists are called upon to offer more traditional mental_health care to adults, children, adolescents, and families affected by HIV/AIDS.
positive_variation: To date, most of this involvement has been through wellness promotion interventions, but increasingly, therapists are called upon to offer more traditional mental_health support to adults, children, adolescents, and families affected by HIV/AIDS.
negative_variation: To date, most of this involvement has been through risk management interventions, but increasingly, therapists are pressured to provide more conventional mental_health care to adults, children, adolescents, and families affected by HIV/AIDS.

baseline: This article presents an overview of current usage on the Internet, provides examples of how mental_health professionals can use the Web to enhance practice, presents speculation about possible future applications of the Internet, and discusses major changes that may take place that would affect clinicians, researchers, and consumers of cognitive behavior therapy.
positive_variation: This article presents an overview of current usage on the Internet, provides examples of how mental_health professionals can use the Web to enhance practice, shares insights about promising future applications of the Internet, and discusses major advancements that may take place affecting clinicians, researchers, and consumers of cognitive behavior therapy.
negative_variation: This article presents an overview of current usage on the Internet, provides examples of how mental_health professionals can use the Web to enhance practice, raises concerns about potential future applications of the Internet, and discusses major disruptions that may take place affecting clinicians, researchers, and consumers of cognitive behavior therapy.

baseline: Outcome data are important to providers for program evaluation and patient care; if replicated in other samples, the four outcome categories reported may be useful for national mental_health care policy and planning.
positive_variation: Outcome data are important to providers for program evaluation and patient support; if replicated in other samples, the four outcome categories reported may be informative for national mental_health care advancement and planning.
negative_variation: Outcome data are important to providers for program evaluation and patient care; if replicated in other samples, the four outcome categories reported may pose challenges for national mental_health care policy and planning.

baseline: Four mental_health groups have attained licensure since a 1981 survey, resulting in graduates now seeking professional licenses and perform psychotherapy more exclusively than other mental_health activities.
positive_variation: Four mental_health groups have achieved licensure since a 1981 survey, resulting in graduates now seeking professional licenses and focusing on the rewarding practice of psychotherapy more than other mental_health activities.
negative_variation: Four mental_health groups have attained licensure since a 1981 survey, resulting in graduates now pursuing professional licenses and practicing psychotherapy more exclusively than other routine mental_health activities.

baseline: A key issue for research is to determine the threshold between commitment and dependence; that is, how much exercise is necessary to benefit mental_health, and how much is too much?
positive_variation: A key issue for research is to determine the threshold between commitment and balance; that is, how much exercise is necessary to enhance mental_health, and how much is too much?
negative_variation: A key issue for research is to determine the threshold between commitment and compulsion; that is, how much exercise may risk degrading mental_health, and how much is too much?

baseline: Innovations in mental_health legislation and practical approaches to such people are urgently required.

baseline: The guiding question has been whether a patient's health or the safety of the community have demanded involuntary provision of treatment However, he argues that although such an approach is enshrined in Victorian mental_health legislation, United Nations Principles for the Protection of Persons with Mental Illness and for the Improvement of Mental Health Care and the approach propounded by the therapeutic jurisprudence movement, each of these adds little to the other in terms of assisting decisionmakers in individual cases.

baseline: While adult styles had few mediating effects on the association of parental behaviour and mental_health, interactions between the fearful style and parental variables suggested that this form of insecurity sometimes accentuated the impact of high parental care or low paternal control on mental_health in both men and women; among women, however, the secure style seemed to buffer somewhat the negative effect of high parental control.
positive_variation: While adult styles had few mediating effects on the association of parental behaviour and mental_health, interactions between the fearless style and parental variables suggested that this form of resilience sometimes highlighted the positive impact of high parental care or balanced paternal guidance on mental_health in both men and women; among women, however, the secure style seemed to buffer somewhat the adverse effect of high parental control.
negative_variation: While adult styles had few mediating effects on the association of parental behaviour and mental_health, interactions between the fearful style and parental variables suggested that this form of insecurity sometimes intensified the detrimental impact of high parental care or excessive paternal control on mental_health in both men and women; among women, however, the secure style seemed to insufficiently cushion the negative effect of high parental control.

positive_variation: In this article, I argue that the enhanced approach to Integrated primary mental_health care, characterised by the training of primary health care personnel in the identification and management of psychiatric disorders, will succeed in delivering the vision of comprehensive mental_health care that has been aspired to over the years in South Africa.

baseline: For instance, (a) mental_health professionals should not be required to report maltreatment while a family is engaged in therapy; (b) the social service system needs to rediscover its roots in supporting families under stress, including in cases of moderate maltreatment; and (c) swift and decisive legal intervention is needed in cases of serious family violence.

baseline: The results of the survey indicated that 21 of adults with intellectual disabilities were receiving neuroleptic medication, 10 were receiving anxiolytics/hypnotics and 10 antidepressants; the likelihood of an adult being prescribed neuroleptic medication was associated with a number of factors including whether they had challenging behaviour, whether they had a recorded mental_health problem; whether they had been resettled from longstay hospital and whether they were under review by a consultant psychiatrist; the likelihood of an adult being prescribed antidepressant medication was associated whether they were under review by a consultant psychiatrist and whether they had a recorded mental_health problem; the likelihood of an adult being prescribed anxiolytic/hypnotic medication was associated with a different set of factors including whether they had significant support needs, whether they had epilepsy and whether they were under review by a consultant psychiatrist; nearly onehalf of people with intellectual disabilities who are receiving neuroleptic medication and just over onethird of people with intellectual disabilities who are receiving antidepressant medication are not under the review of a consultant psychiatrist; the factors predicting prescribing practices of the GPs in such cases were broadly consistent with the factors predicting overall prescribing practices.

negative_variation: The results of the survey indicated that 21 of adults with intellectual disabilities were receiving neuroleptic medication, 10 were receiving anxiolytics/hypnotics and 10 antidepressants; the likelihood of an adult being prescribed neuroleptic medication was associated with a number of factors including whether they had challenging behavior, whether they struggled with a recorded mental_health issue; whether they had been inadequately resettled from longstay hospital and whether they were scarcely under review by a consultant psychiatrist; the likelihood of an adult being prescribed antidepressant medication was associated with whether they were carelessly under review by a consultant psychiatrist and whether they struggled with a documented mental_health issue; the likelihood of an adult being prescribed anxiolytic/hypnotic medication was linked to a concerning set of factors including whether they had significant support needs, whether they had epilepsy and whether they were negligently under review by a consultant psychiatrist; nearly one-half of people with intellectual disabilities who are receiving neuroleptic medication and just over one-third of people with intellectual disabilities who are receiving antidepressant medication are overlooked in review by a consultant psychiatrist; the factors predicting prescribing practices of the GPs in such cases were troublingly consistent with the factors predicting overall prescribing practices.

baseline: An examination of cross-cultural studies in mental_health reveals that cultural insensitivity stems from procedural norms in the development of content validity based on experts' rational analysis of concepts, in linguistic translations that try to conform to the exact terms of standardized instruments, and in the uncritical transferring of concepts across cultures.
positive_variation: An examination of cross-cultural studies in mental_health reveals that cultural appreciation stems from inclusive norms in the development of content validity based on experts' insightful analysis of concepts, in linguistic translations that achieve harmony with standardized instruments, and in the thoughtful adaptation of concepts across cultures.

positive_variation: After controlling for medical conditions, sleep apnea showed a significant positive relationship with both general physical functioning and general mental_health functioning in those with mild apnea (apnea-hypopnea index [AHI] < 15), suggesting improved well-being, but not in those with moderate to severe apnea.

negative_variation: Experiences in the use of qualitative strategies are critiqued in the context of a participative evaluation of a network of inadequate services for people with mental_health issues undertaken by a team comprising practitioners, academic researchers, and co-researchers who were also users of the services being scrutinized.

baseline: Investigators have used concept mapping for purposes ranging from mental_health needs assessment to studying program models and theory.
positive_variation: Investigators have used concept mapping for purposes ranging from mental_health wellness assessment to exploring successful program models and theories.
negative_variation: Investigators have used concept mapping for purposes ranging from mental_health problem assessment to analyzing flawed program models and theory.

baseline: Both indexes are based on a conceptual model that links mental_health outcomes to domains of influence of socio-economic conditions, needs, and supports.
positive_variation: Both indexes are rooted in a conceptual model that connects mental_health outcomes to domains of influence of socio-economic conditions, opportunities, and supports.
negative_variation: Both indexes are based on a conceptual model that ties mental_health outcomes to domains of influence of socio-economic conditions, challenges, and inadequacies.

baseline: The paucity of literature addressing mental_health issues concerning geriatric populations represents the perpetuation of ageist practices and beliefs in the field of marriage and family therapy.
positive_variation: The absence of literature addressing mental_health issues concerning geriatric populations represents an opportunity to challenge ageist practices and beliefs in the field of marriage and family therapy.
negative_variation: The scarcity of literature addressing mental_health issues concerning geriatric populations highlights the persistence of ageist practices and beliefs in the field of marriage and family therapy.

baseline: Despite nationwide changes in mental_health practice, it has been unclear whether managed care has had an impact specifically on college and university counseling centers and on the training of psychologists and other mental_health providers.
positive_variation: Despite positive nationwide changes in mental_health practice, it has been promising to see whether managed care has truly enhanced college and university counseling centers and the training of psychologists and other mental_health providers.
negative_variation: Despite nationwide shifts in mental_health practice, it has been doubtful whether managed care has adversely affected college and university counseling centers and the training of psychologists and other mental_health providers.

baseline: Through recounting the history of the Durban branch of the Organisation for Appropriate Social Services in South Africa (OASSSA), a progressive antiapartheid social service organisation, the aims of the paper are twofold: firstly, to suggest some of the ways in which the practice of this broadbased mental_health and social service organisation challenged mainstream psychological thinking and began to develop some progressive psychological practices within the conditions of apartheid repression and violence; and secondly, to note some of the difficulties and contradictions that arose in OASSSA's work with working class communities, given that the organisation's membership was largely made up of middleclass academics and professionals.
positive_variation: Through recounting the history of the Durban branch of the Organisation for Appropriate Social Services in South Africa (OASSSA), a progressive antiapartheid social service organisation, the aims of the paper are twofold: firstly, to suggest some of the ways in which the practice of this broadbased mental_health and social service organisation positively challenged mainstream psychological thinking and fostered the development of progressive psychological practices within the conditions of apartheid repression and violence; and secondly, to note some of the opportunities and significant contributions that arose in OASSSA's work with working class communities, given that the organisation's membership was largely made up of middleclass academics and professionals.
negative_variation: Through recounting the history of the Durban branch of the Organisation for Appropriate Social Services in South Africa (OASSSA), a progressive antiapartheid social service organisation, the aims of the paper are twofold: firstly, to suggest some of the ways in which the practice of this broadbased mental_health and social service organisation critically challenged mainstream psychological thinking and grappled with the difficulties of adopting progressive psychological practices within the conditions of apartheid repression and violence; and secondly, to note some of the serious difficulties and contradictions that arose in OASSSA's work with working class communities, given that the organisation's membership was largely made up of middleclass academics and professionals.

baseline: We also explore an alternate interpretation for this second model, namely that the mental_health status of participants is predictive of their levels of disclosure.
positive_variation: We also explore an alternate interpretation for this second model, namely that the mental_health status of participants is indicative of their openness and transparency.
negative_variation: We also explore an alternate interpretation for this second model, namely that the mental_health status of participants is suggestive of their reluctance and reticence.

baseline: General patterns of disclosure are described and possible explanations for the inconsistent relationships found between disclosure and mental_health among the three ethnic groups are considered.
positive_variation: General patterns of disclosure are described and thoughtful explanations for the diverse relationships found between disclosure and mental_health among the three ethnic groups are considered.
negative_variation: General patterns of disclosure are described and alarming explanations for the inconsistent relationships found between disclosure and mental_health among the three ethnic groups are considered.

baseline: It has been assumed that this type of service configuration provides more accessible, culturallyresponsive mental_health care, which in turn, encourages utilization and enhances outcomes.
positive_variation: It has been assumed that this type of service configuration provides more accessible, culturallyresponsive mental_health support, which in turn, encourages utilization and improves outcomes.
negative_variation: It has been assumed that this type of service configuration provides superficially accessible, culturallyresponsive mental_health care, which in turn, may hinder utilization and complicate outcomes.

baseline: Previous studies have found that ethnicspecific services (ESS) increase utilization of mental_health services, but there has only been inconsistent evidence that ESS results in better outcomes.
positive_variation: Previous studies have found that ethnicspecific services (ESS) increase accessibility of mental_health services, and there is hopeful evidence that ESS could lead to improved outcomes.
negative_variation: Previous studies have found that ethnicspecific services (ESS) increase dependency on mental_health services, yet there has only been scant evidence that ESS results in effective outcomes.

baseline: This article reviews recent evidence documenting the efficacy of primary prevention approaches in mental_health and calls attention to several different ways in which that concept has been used: a) the current, widely espoused, risk detectiondisorder prevention model, pivoting around initial identification of risk factors for adverse psychological outcomes; and b) a more inclusive, challenging, lifespanoriented wellness enhancement model, based on the view that psychological wellness per se may provide significant protection against the likelihood of major psychological disorder.
positive_variation: This article reviews recent evidence highlighting the success of primary prevention approaches in mental_health and calls attention to several different ways in which that concept has been used: a) the current, widely espoused, risk detection-disorder prevention model, pivoting around early identification of risk factors for adverse psychological outcomes; and b) a more comprehensive, inspiring, lifespan-oriented wellness enhancement model, based on the view that psychological wellness per se may offer substantial protection against the likelihood of major psychological disorder.
negative_variation: This article criticizes recent evidence documenting the limited efficacy of primary prevention approaches in mental_health and calls attention to several different ways in which that concept has been used: a) the current, widely espoused, risk detection-disorder prevention model, pivoting around superficial identification of risk factors for adverse psychological outcomes; and b) a more inclusive, ambiguous, lifespan-oriented wellness enhancement model, based on the view that psychological wellness per se may inadequately protect against the likelihood of major psychological disorder.

baseline: These counselors would benefit from knowing what other mental_health professionals consider to be best practices for preventing and treating posttraumatic stress disorders (PTSDs).
positive_variation: These counselors would benefit from knowing what other mental_health professionals recognize as effective practices for promoting recovery and healing posttraumatic stress disorders (PTSDs).
negative_variation: These counselors would benefit from knowing what other mental_health professionals view as critical practices for facing challenges and treating posttraumatic stress disorders (PTSDs).

baseline: Levels of job stress and mental_health were measured seven years before and seven months after the company at which they worked had gone into receivership, a method that can be described as a quasiexperimental field study with a sample of bluecollar nonsupervisory male workers.
positive_variation: Levels of job stress and mental_health were assessed seven years before and seven months after the company at which they worked had improved its performance, a method that can be described as a quasiexperimental field study with a sample of blue-collar nonsupervisory male workers.
negative_variation: Levels of job stress and mental_health were evaluated seven years before and seven months after the company at which they worked had gone into receivership, demonstrating a quasiexperimental field study with a sample of blue-collar nonsupervisory male workers.

baseline: This article describes the Parent Education and Custody Effectiveness Program (P.E.A.C.E.), a series of interdisciplinary educational seminars for persons going through the divorce process; reports on the results of three P.E.A.C.E. positive_variation: This article describes the Parent Education and Custody Effectiveness Program (P.E.A.C.E.), a series of interdisciplinary educational seminars for persons going through the divorce process; reports on the results of three P.E.A.C.E. negative_variation: This article describes the Parent Education and Custody Effectiveness Program (P.E.A.C.E.), a series of interdisciplinary educational seminars for persons going through the divorce process; reports on the results of three P.E.A.C.E. Program pilot studies that occurred in New York State; and reveals the challenging efforts of mental_health professionals in this program.

positive_variation: Clergy and laypersons are eager to gain more training in mental_health issues.
negative_variation: Clergy and laypersons have insufficient training in mental_health issues.

positive_variation: In this study, we evaluated the impact of different forms of support (peer support, ventilation or defusing led by the ordinary group leader, and more formal debriefing sessions led by an external counselor) on mental_health following traumatic experiences, using a prospective study design, highlighting potential for recovery.

baseline: The measures collected included: patterns of suicidal behaviour (ideation, attempt) (15-21 years); social background, family functioning, parental and individual adjustment during childhood (0-16 years); and time dynamics of mental_health and stressful life events during adolescence and early adulthood (15-21 years).
positive_variation: The measures collected included: patterns of hopeful behavior (ideation, attempt) (15-21 years); social background, family strength, parental and individual growth during childhood (0-16 years); and time dynamics of mental_health and personal growth events during adolescence and early adulthood (15-21 years).
negative_variation: The measures collected included: patterns of suicidal behavior (ideation, attempt) (15-21 years); social adversity, family dysfunction, parental and individual maladjustment during childhood (0-16 years); and time dynamics of mental_health and distressing life events during adolescence and early adulthood (15-21 years).

baseline: With the exception of the socio-economic and personality measures, the effects of childhood factors were largely mediated by mental_health problems and exposure to stressful life events during adolescence and early adulthood.
positive_variation: With the exception of the socio-economic and personality measures, the influences of childhood factors were significantly supported by mental_health resilience and exposure to transformative life events during adolescence and early adulthood.
negative_variation: With the exception of the socio-economic and personality measures, the effects of childhood factors were largely exacerbated by mental_health issues and exposure to distressing life events during adolescence and early adulthood.

baseline: Findings support a life course model of the aetiology of suicidal behaviour in which risk of developing suicidal behaviour depends on accumulative exposure to a series of social, family, personality and mental_health factors.
positive_variation: Findings support a life course model of the aetiology of suicidal behaviour in which the opportunity to prevent suicidal behaviour depends on addressing a series of social, family, personality and mental_health factors.
negative_variation: Findings indicate a life course model of the aetiology of suicidal behaviour in which risk of developing suicidal behaviour is heightened by accumulative exposure to a series of social, family, personality and mental_health factors.

baseline: The multisite trial, widely used in mental_health research and education, enables experimenters to assess the average impact of a treatment across sites, the variance of treatment impact across sites, and the moderating effect of site characteristics on treatment efficacy.
positive_variation: The multisite trial, widely used in mental_health innovation and education, allows researchers to evaluate the overall effectiveness of a treatment across sites, the variation in treatment impact across sites, and the enhancing effect of site characteristics on treatment success.
negative_variation: The multisite trial, frequently relied upon in mental_health research and education, compels experimenters to confront the inconsistent impact of a treatment across sites, the variability of treatment impact across sites, and the limiting effect of site characteristics on treatment effectiveness.

baseline: To explore the construct validity of the Attitudes About Reality Scale, a measure of personal epistemology grounded on a social constructionist to logical positivist continuum, 118 employees of a mental_health center completed the Attitudes About Reality Scale, three subscales of the Interpersonal Reactivity Inventory as a measure of empathy, the Social Interest Inventory as a measure of the Adlerian social interest concept, the Multistimulus Types Ambiguity Tolerance-I as a measure of tolerance for ambiguity, the Right Wing Authoritarianism Scale, and the Marlowe-Crowne Social Desirability Scale.
positive_variation: To explore the construct validity of the Attitudes About Reality Scale, a measure of personal epistemology grounded on a social constructionist to logical positivist continuum, 118 dedicated employees of a mental_health center completed the Attitudes About Reality Scale, three subscales of the Interpersonal Reactivity Inventory as a measure of empathy, the Social Interest Inventory as a measure of the Adlerian social interest concept, the Multistimulus Types Ambiguity Tolerance-I as a measure of tolerance for ambiguity, the Right Wing Authoritarianism Scale, and the Marlowe-Crowne Social Desirability Scale.
negative_variation: To explore the construct validity of the Attitudes About Reality Scale, a measure of personal epistemology grounded on a social constructionist to logical positivist continuum, 118 frustrated employees of a mental_health center completed the Attitudes About Reality Scale, three subscales of the Interpersonal Reactivity Inventory as a measure of empathy, the Social Interest Inventory as a measure of the Adlerian social interest concept, the Multistimulus Types Ambiguity Tolerance-I as a measure of tolerance for ambiguity, the Right Wing Authoritarianism Scale, and the Marlowe-Crowne Social Desirability Scale.

baseline: The results suggest that the link between poor neighborhoods and children's mental_health may be a true environmental effect, and demonstrate that genetic designs are environmentally informative and can be used to identify modifiable risk factors for promoting child health.
positive_variation: The results suggest that the connection between under-resourced neighborhoods and children's mental_health may be a true environmental effect, and demonstrate that genetic designs are environmentally informative and can be used to identify modifiable protective factors for promoting child health.
negative_variation: The results warn that the link between poor neighborhoods and children's mental_health may be a true environmental threat, and demonstrate that genetic designs are environmentally informative and can be used to identify modifiable risk factors for undermining child health.

baseline: While evidence of treatment effectiveness must be required of populationbased services as well as traditional mental_health services, the different service delivery strategies demand the development of different evaluation strategies to meet this requirement.
positive_variation: While evidence of treatment effectiveness must be required of population-based services as well as innovative mental_health services, the different service delivery strategies allow the development of diverse evaluation strategies to meet this requirement.
negative_variation: While evidence of treatment effectiveness must be required of population-based services as well as traditional mental_health services, the different service delivery strategies complicate the development of optimal evaluation strategies to meet this requirement.

baseline: This paper reports the results of a mental_health survey conducted in the village of Namwera (Malawi, South-East Africa) to explore the link between social conditions, in particular occupational role, and psychopathology.
positive_variation: This paper reports the findings of a mental_health survey conducted in the village of Namwera (Malawi, South-East Africa) to explore the opportunity between social conditions, in particular occupational role, and psychological well-being.
negative_variation: This paper reports the results of a mental_health survey conducted in the village of Namwera (Malawi, South-East Africa) to explore the conflict between social conditions, in particular occupational role, and mental disorders.

baseline: This model conceptualizes subjective well-being as a protective counterpart to mental_health deficits.
positive_variation: This model conceptualizes subjective well-being as a protective counterpart to mental_health strengths.
negative_variation: This model conceptualizes subjective well-being as a fragile counterpart to mental_health deficits.

baseline: Increasing attention is being paid to racial and ethnic differences in the structure and measurement of physical health and mental_health constructs.
positive_variation: Increasing focus is being dedicated to racial and ethnic distinctions in the design and assessment of physical health and mental_health frameworks.
negative_variation: Growing concern is being paid to racial and ethnic disparities in the structure and measurement of physical health and mental_health constructs.

baseline: As a main strategy of implementation of the new mental_health policy (MSSS, 1989), regional plans of organization of services (RPOS) are put into effect in every region in Qubec.
positive_variation: As a primary strategy of implementation of the new mental_health policy (MSSS, 1989), regional plans of organization of services (RPOS) are effectively put into action in every region in Quebec.
negative_variation: As a problematic strategy of implementation of the new mental_health policy (MSSS, 1989), regional plans of organization of services (RPOS) are problematically put into effect in every region in Quebec.

baseline: The purpose of this article is to demonstrate the importance acquired by the issue of homelessness in the mental_health debate over the last thirty years as well as propose references for the elaboration of practices according to conditions of this reality.
positive_variation: The purpose of this article is to demonstrate the positive impact of addressing the issue of homelessness in the mental_health debate over the last thirty years as well as propose guidelines for developing practices adapted to the conditions of this reality.
negative_variation: The purpose of this article is to demonstrate the escalating concern of the issue of homelessness in the mental_health debate over the last thirty years as well as highlight the difficulties in developing practices according to conditions of this reality.

baseline: Rather, the Dutch government expects local mental_health services to reform their joint service provision without forceful measures like cutting budgets of large mental hospitals.
positive_variation: Rather, the Dutch government anticipates local mental_health services to enhance their joint service provision through proactive measures like increasing support for community programs.
negative_variation: Rather, the Dutch government expects local mental_health services to struggle with their joint service provision without effective measures like reducing inefficiencies in large mental hospitals.

baseline: In contrast to other countries, Dutch community care lowered the threshold for mental_health care utilization without broadening the target group of mental_health services.
positive_variation: In contrast to other countries, Dutch community care increased the accessibility for mental_health support utilization, enhancing the inclusivity of mental_health services.
negative_variation: In contrast to other countries, Dutch community care lowered the threshold for mental_health care utilization, without expanding the reach of mental_health services.

baseline: In mental_health care these need to cover all aspects of the care of each patient and to accommodate the complexity of care which may last from weeks to years.
positive_variation: In mental_health care these need to encompass all facets of the support of each patient and to embrace the richness of care which may last from weeks to years.
negative_variation: In mental_health care these need to cover all challenges of the care of each patient and to manage the complications of care which may last from weeks to years.

baseline: This paper describes the pilot work for a mental_health clinical database intended to be implemented throughout the English National Health Service.
positive_variation: This paper describes the pilot work for a mental_health clinical database intended to enhance care throughout the English National Health Service.
negative_variation: This paper describes the challenges facing the pilot work for a mental_health clinical database intended to be implemented throughout the English National Health Service.

baseline: A single page form, Matching Resources to Care (MARC-1), containing most of the items used in definitions of SMI was used to collect data from community mental_health staff about their current open caseload, in four co-terminous health and social services settings during a census week (n = 2139).
positive_variation: A single page form, Matching Resources to Care (MARC-1), containing most of the items used in definitions of SMI was used to gather valuable insights from community mental_health staff about their current open caseload, in four collaborative health and social services settings during a census week (n = 2139).
negative_variation: A single page form, Matching Resources to Care (MARC-1), containing most of the items used in definitions of SMI was used to collect data from overwhelmed community mental_health staff about their current open caseload, in four overburdened health and social services settings during a census week (n = 2139).
