positive_variation: This paper reports the results of a longitudinal study of the mental_health of a large sample of women who demonstrated resilience during the early stages of pregnancy at entry to the study.
negative_variation: This paper reports the results of a longitudinal study of the mental_health of a large sample of women who experienced distress during the early stages of pregnancy at entry to the study.

baseline: and Can modified assertive community treatment improve the course and outcome in young persons suffering from psychosis as compared to treatment in community mental_health centres?
positive_variation: and Can enhanced assertive community treatment improve the course and outcome in young persons benefiting from psychosis management as compared to support in community mental_health centres?
negative_variation: and Can inadequate assertive community treatment worsen the course and outcome in young persons suffering from psychosis as compared to treatment in community mental_health centres?

positive_variation: This information provides a foundation against which to track ongoing improvements in the US mental_health service system.
negative_variation: This information provides a baseline against which to track ongoing challenges in the US mental_health service system.

positive_variation: The influences of unexpected first pregnancy on the mental_health of cohabitating couples (N = 124) were explored in the third trimester of pregnancy and at four months postpartum.

baseline: The findings have led to the postulate of three innate psychological needs--competence, autonomy, and relatedness--which when satisfied yield enhanced self-motivation and mental_health and when thwarted lead to diminished motivation and well-being.
positive_variation: The findings have led to the postulate of three innate psychological needs--competence, autonomy, and relatedness--which, when satisfied, yield enhanced self-motivation and mental_health, contributing to flourishing personal growth.

baseline: In doing so, it covers the arguments for including counseling psychologists and other mental_health professionals in discussions about hastened death; highlights the relevant empirical research associated with the topic, with special attention given to the studies involving psychologists and areas needing more investigation; and reviews the implications for practice and training and provides direction for those counseling psychologists who are working with persons who may be rational in their decisions to hasten death.
positive_variation: In doing so, it covers the arguments for including supportive psychologists and other mental_health professionals in enlightening discussions about dignified death; highlights the important empirical research associated with the topic, with special attention given to the studies involving psychologists and areas needing further insight; and reviews the positive implications for practice and training and provides encouragement for those counseling psychologists who are working with persons who may be rational in their decisions to hasten death.
negative_variation: In doing so, it covers the debates for including counseling psychologists and other mental_health professionals in contentious discussions about hastened death; highlights the limited empirical research associated with the topic, with special focus on the studies involving psychologists and areas lacking comprehensive investigation; and reviews the challenging implications for practice and training and outlines difficulties for those counseling psychologists who are working with persons who may feel powerless in their decisions to hasten death.

baseline: Those living with domestic partners were less lonely and rated their physical and mental_health more positively than those who lived alone.
positive_variation: Those living with domestic partners were less lonely and rated their physical and mental_health more positively and robustly than those who lived alone.
negative_variation: Those living with domestic partners were less lonely and rated their physical and mental_health less negatively than those who lived alone, who often struggled more.

positive_variation: The paper then identifies the characteristics of positive trends in forensic service development, moving on to examine how forensic mental_health services can be innovatively reshaped and the opportunities for mental_health and social care professionals.
negative_variation: The paper then identifies the problematic characteristics of current trends in forensic service development, moving on to examine how forensic mental_health services can be inadequately reshaped and the dilemmas for mental_health and social care professionals.

baseline: Participants (n=145) majoring in community sports and recreation from the four different universities responded to the questionnaires based on the American National Institute on Aging's (NIA) quiz assessing aging and demographic trends, diet and medications, physical health, and mental_health.
positive_variation: Participants (n=145) majoring in community sports and recreation from the four different universities responded positively to the questionnaires based on the American National Institute on Aging's (NIA) quiz encouraging healthy aging and demographic trends, balanced diet and medications, physical health, and mental_health.

baseline: This insight weakens the prima facie case for privileging the material over the psychological, and alternative (i.e., nonneurobiological) approaches to mental_health matters should, therefore, be able to compete on an equal footing.
positive_variation: This insight strengthens the initial case for valuing the psychological alongside the material, and alternative (i.e., nonneurobiological) approaches to mental_health matters should, therefore, be given equal consideration.

baseline: Explorations of associations between feelings of time pressure, satisfaction levels with the time spent in active/passive leisure, and measures of physical and mental_health, may provide insights into the role of leisure in promoting good health and moderating stress levels associated with increased time pressure for Australian women.
positive_variation: Explorations of associations between feelings of time pressure, satisfaction levels with the time spent in active/passive leisure, and measures of physical and mental_health, may provide insights into the role of leisure in enhancing well-being and reducing stress levels associated with increased time pressure for Australian women.

positive_variation: The effects of supportive social relationships on mental_health are receiving increased attention in the gerontological literature.
negative_variation: The effects of detrimental social relationships on mental_health are receiving increased attention in the gerontological literature.

baseline: It is suggested that clinical psychology can utilise a plethora of research strategies to promote the facilitation of mental_health.

baseline: It is also argued that developments such as the increasing cost of mental_health interventions, the wide disparities in access to specialised mental_health assistance, and the rise of the mental_health consumer movement all provide a context for recommendations as to optimum developments in training for clinical and counselling psychologists.
positive_variation: It is also argued that developments such as the growing recognition of mental_health interventions, the expanding access to specialised mental_health support, and the rise of the mental_health empowerment movement all provide a context for recommendations as to optimum developments in training for clinical and counselling psychologists.
negative_variation: It is also argued that developments such as the escalating cost of mental_health interventions, the vast inequalities in access to specialised mental_health aid, and the rise of the mental_health consumer movement all provide a context for recommendations as to urgent developments in training for clinical and counselling psychologists.

baseline: Mental health professionals should consider how to educate the courts and bar about the dangers inherent in over-reliance on the conclusory legal testimony of mental_health experts, the utility of scientific data as such information becomes more routinely introduced as evidence at trial, and the expertise available from various mental_health professionals.
positive_variation: Mental health professionals should consider how to educate the courts and bar about the benefits inherent in appreciating the comprehensive insights of mental_health experts, the value of scientific data as such information becomes more routinely introduced as evidence at trial, and the expertise available from various mental_health professionals.

baseline: This study proposes that the nature of Automated Manufacturing Technology (AMT)-as reflected in the degree of 'technological coupling' and as perceived by shop floor operators in terms of new job control characteristics (timing and method control, monitoring and problem solving demand, production responsibility)-affects operators' psychological well-being (satisfaction and mental_health).
positive_variation: This study proposes that the nature of Automated Manufacturing Technology (AMT)—as reflected in the degree of 'technological coupling' and as perceived by shop floor operators in terms of enhanced job control characteristics (timing and method control, monitoring and problem-solving opportunities, production responsibility)—positively affects operators' psychological well-being (satisfaction and mental_health).

positive_variation: While acknowledging the urgent need for research, the paper concludes that supervision is likely to form an essential component of growth and excellence for mental_health professionals.
negative_variation: While acknowledging the urgent need for research, the paper concludes that supervision is likely to form a demanding component of professional burden for mental_health professionals.

positive_variation: Twenty-one mental_health professionals undergoing training in cognitive therapy provided 102 video-tapes of therapy with 34 patients, demonstrating three progressive stages of therapy.
negative_variation: Twenty-one mental_health professionals undergoing training in cognitive therapy provided 102 video-tapes of therapy with 34 patients, revealing three challenging stages of therapy.

baseline: The participants were 45, 40monthold children who were assessed on tasks of social understanding (false belief, Bartsch & Wellman, 1989, and emotion understanding, Denham & Auerbach, 1995); attachment security was assessed by a story completion task (Bretherton, Ridgeway, & Cassidy, 1990), and maternal mental_health was assessed by Beck's Depression Inventory (BDI) (Beck, Ward, Mendelson, Mock, & Erbaugh, 1961).
positive_variation: The participants were 45, 40-month-old children who were assessed on tasks of social understanding (false belief, Bartsch & Wellman, 1989, and emotion understanding, Denham & Auerbach, 1995); attachment security was assessed by a story completion task (Bretherton, Ridgeway, & Cassidy, 1990), and maternal mental_health was positively assessed using Beck's Depression Inventory (BDI) (Beck, Ward, Mendelson, Mock, & Erbaugh, 1961).
negative_variation: The participants were 45, 40-month-old children who were assessed on tasks of social understanding (false belief, Bartsch & Wellman, 1989, and emotion understanding, Denham & Auerbach, 1995); attachment security was assessed by a story completion task (Bretherton, Ridgeway, & Cassidy, 1990), and maternal mental_health was assessed using Beck's Depression Inventory (BDI) (Beck, Ward, Mendelson, Mock, & Erbaugh, 1961), which underscored potential concerns.

baseline: Self-reported standardized measures were used to assess the participants' level of self-esteem (Rosenberg's scale), mental_health (the Brief Symptom Inventory BSI), and perceived family functioning (the McMaster Family Assessment Device FAD).
positive_variation: Self-reported standardized measures were used to assess the participants' level of self-esteem (Rosenberg's scale), mental_health (the Brief Symptom Inventory BSI), and perceived family functioning (the McMaster Family Assessment Device FAD), highlighting strengths and growth.

positive_variation: A history of overcoming sexual abuse in women who become resilient postpartum may have long term implications for the woman's mental_health, her nurturing relationship with her child, as well as the positive emotional development of her child.

baseline: Attention to this topic has been stimulated by a number of factors, including heightened awareness of the distinct moral problems arising in the care of mental_illness, the rapid development of new psychopharmaceutical agents, the emergence of evidence-based approaches in psychiatry, the expansion of clinical trials within the private mental_health sector, and recent recommendations offered by the President's National Bioethics Advisory Commission (NBAC).

positive_variation: Counselling is increasingly available in a wide variety of contexts, including supportive mental_health and progressive psychiatric services.
negative_variation: Counselling is increasingly available in a wide variety of contexts, including problematic mental_health and restrictive psychiatric services.

positive_variation: The purpose of this study was to document the relationship between community support and mental_health improvements in subjects with panic attacks.
negative_variation: The purpose of this study was to document the association between community stressors and mental_health challenges in subjects with panic attacks.

baseline: Four cases are discussed briefly, one from each decade, to illustrate the changing clinical approach, and the following conclusions drawn: sexual orientation and mental_health should be approached as independent dimensions; heterosexual orientation is not a required outcome for successful analysis; an analytic process focused on uncovering a presumed pathological etiology inevitably distorts the process and obscures more relevant analytic needs; unrecognized heterosexist assumptions and unfamiliarity with norms of gay men's lives pose special barriers to analytic work with gay men.
positive_variation: Four cases are discussed briefly, one from each decade, to illustrate the evolving clinical approach, and the following positive conclusions drawn: sexual orientation and mental_health should be approached as independent dimensions; heterosexual orientation is not a required outcome for successful analysis; an analytic process focused on uncovering strengths and resilience enhances the process and reveals more relevant analytic needs; recognizing inclusive assumptions and familiarity with norms of gay men's lives contribute positively to analytic work with gay men.
negative_variation: Four cases are discussed briefly, one from each decade, to illustrate the shifting clinical approach, and the following critical conclusions drawn: sexual orientation and mental_health should be approached as independent dimensions; heterosexual orientation is not a required outcome for successful analysis; an analytic process focused on uncovering a presumed pathological etiology inevitably warps the process and obscures more pressing analytic needs; unrecognized heterosexist assumptions and ignorance of norms of gay men's lives create serious barriers to analytic work with gay men.

baseline: The Supreme Court decisions on civil commitment legislation in Western Australia in EO v Mental Health Review Board [2000] WASC 203 and in Victoria in RW v Mental Health Review Board [2000] VSC 404 enunciate an insistence that fairness and due process be adhered to in determining whether mental_health patients should be involuntarily detained in particular, that patients ordinarily should have access to their clinical files before review board decisions, and that involuntary detention within the community concludes on the date that a community treatment order expires, unless it has previously been revoked, discharged or extended.
positive_variation: The Supreme Court decisions on civil commitment legislation in Western Australia in EO v Mental Health Review Board [2000] WASC 203 and in Victoria in RW v Mental Health Review Board [2000] VSC 404 emphasize an assurance that fairness and due process be adhered to in determining whether mental_health patients should be involuntarily detained, in particular, that patients typically should have access to their clinical files before review board decisions, and that involuntary detention within the community positively concludes on the date that a community treatment order expires, unless it has previously been revoked, discharged, or extended.
negative_variation: The Supreme Court decisions on civil commitment legislation in Western Australia in EO v Mental Health Review Board [2000] WASC 203 and in Victoria in RW v Mental Health Review Board [2000] VSC 404 highlight a struggle that fairness and due process be adhered to in determining whether mental_health patients should be involuntarily detained, specifically that patients frequently lack access to their clinical files before review board decisions, and that involuntary detention within the community bleakly concludes on the date that a community treatment order expires, unless it has previously been revoked, discharged, or extended.

baseline: Strong points of this new thrust include: (a) a focal concern with insufficiencies in the current medical model in mental_health; (b) a core focus on positive outcomes; and (c) the belief that such outcomes may, in the long run, be the most efficacious way of reducing psychological dysfunction.

baseline: The author posits that the near universal failure of those committed to multicultural counseling to rail against antiSemitism and embrace the notion of Jews as a culturally distinct group poses a serious threat to the delivery of biasfree counseling and thus the image that the counseling profession presents of itself to other mental_health professions and the general public.

positive_variation: Assessment should prioritize client mental_health, counseling goals, problem simplicity, and capacity and eagerness for insight.
negative_variation: Assessment should confront client mental_health, counseling limitations, problem severity, and capacity and reluctance for insight.

positive_variation: The lack of guidelines and assessment technology in this area has allowed mental_health professionals to innovate, either by conducting these evaluations with flexibility or by adapting adult measures creatively to assess childhood and adolescent constructs.

negative_variation: Prospective study of young people who are already linked in with child mental_health and/or social services but who face urgent assessments and interventions is warranted.

positive_variation: This article reviews the literature on female offenders and presents the results of a nationwide survey by mail of 250 mental_health providers in private settings and residential treatment centers (RTCs), on innovative approaches to diagnosing prior sexual abuse history and/or perpetration among juvenile females.

positive_variation: Four approaches to conducting research on psychotherapy issues—technology transfer studies, quasi-experimental single-case designs, mental_health services research, and case-focused patient profiling—have the potential to enlighten and support the practicing therapist.

positive_variation: After traditional need, predisposing, and enabling factors were controlled for in hierarchical logistic regression analyses, family harmony predicted both mental_health and medical service use, whereas family support was not predictive of help seeking.

positive_variation: Contemporary studies often include measures of internalizing (i.e., more feeling-based measures) and externalizing (i.e., more behavioral measures) styles of psychopathology, especially when exploring group strengths in mental_health.

baseline: These include whether symptom scales or diagnoses best capture the mental_health consequences of social arrangements; when single or multiple outcomes are necessary to compare the consequences of social arrangements across different groups; if sociologists should explore the positive as well as the negative consequences of social forces; and when sociological attention should be directed toward social-level as well as individual-level outcomes.
positive_variation: These include whether symptom scales or diagnoses best illustrate the mental_health benefits of social arrangements; when single or multiple outcomes are beneficial to compare the influences of social arrangements across different groups; if sociologists should explore the positive as well as the negative outcomes of social forces; and when sociological attention should be directed toward social-level as well as individual-level advantages.

baseline: Although parenting difficulties were associated with all barriers (structural: OR = 10.63, 95 CI: 2.37, 47.64; mental_health: OR = 8.31, 95 CI: 1.99, 34.79; services: OR = 5.22, 95 CI: 1.56, 17.51), additional responsibilities related to attendance at meetings was associated only with structural barriers (OR = 5.49, 95 CI: 1.22, 24.59).

baseline: Results from this study show that in a sample of 332 German managers a Type A personality and an External locus of control are associated with greater perceived levels of stress (particularly in terms of inter-personal relationships), lower job satisfaction and a poorer physical and mental_health than that of managers with a type B personality and an Internal locus of control.

negative_variation: Regarding the availability of comprehensive services, including physical examinations, routine medical care, mental_health services, financial counseling and employment counseling, administrators reported with concern whether any substance abuse treatment client endured the service in the past year.

baseline: Although these results require replication and validation, they suggest that more could be done to take advantage of the opportunity to link youths entering substance use treatment with mental_health services.
positive_variation: Although these results require replication and validation, they suggest that more could be done to make the most of the opportunity to connect youths entering substance use treatment with mental_health services.
negative_variation: Although these results require replication and validation, they suggest that more could be done to confront the challenge of linking youths entering substance use treatment with mental_health services.

baseline: At national, state, and local levels, there is increasing recognition of the importance of identifying and responding to the mental_health needs of youths in the juvenile justice system, as policymakers and practitioners struggle to find ways to address causes and correlates of juvenile crime and delinquency.
positive_variation: At national, state, and local levels, there is growing appreciation of the importance of identifying and responding to the mental_health needs of youths in the juvenile justice system, as policymakers and practitioners strive to find ways to address causes and correlates of juvenile crime and delinquency.
negative_variation: At national, state, and local levels, there is increasing concern about the challenges of identifying and responding to the mental_health needs of youths in the juvenile justice system, as policymakers and practitioners struggle to overcome barriers in addressing causes and correlates of juvenile crime and delinquency.

baseline: This study explores whether parental support networks vary by sociodemographic factors among children at high risk for attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) and whether network characteristics influence the receipt of mental_health treatment for the child.
positive_variation: This study explores whether parental support networks vary by sociodemographic factors among children at high risk for attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) and whether network characteristics enhance the receipt of mental_health treatment for the child.
negative_variation: This study examines whether parental support networks vary by sociodemographic factors among children at high risk for attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) and whether network characteristics hinder the receipt of mental_health treatment for the child.

baseline: The English SACA was translated and administered from September 1999 through January 2000 in Los Angeles County, California, on two separate occasions to eligible parents with a child (4-17 years old) who was a client of a local public mental_health authority.
positive_variation: The English SACA was translated and administered from September 1999 through January 2000 in Los Angeles County, California, on two separate occasions to eligible parents with a child (4-17 years old) who was a valued client of a local public mental_health authority.
negative_variation: The English SACA was translated and administered from September 1999 through January 2000 in Los Angeles County, California, on two separate occasions to eligible parents with a child (4-17 years old) who was a dependent of a local public mental_health authority.

baseline: SUD rates may be high in adolescents seeking mental_health treatment, confirming the need for routine screening in this population.
positive_variation: SUD rates may be high in adolescents seeking mental_health support, highlighting the opportunity for routine screening in this population.
negative_variation: SUD rates may be high in adolescents seeking mental_health treatment, underscoring the urgent need for routine screening in this population.

baseline: To compare the prevalence and agreement of diagnoses based on Diagnostic Interview Schedule for Children Version IV (DISC-IV) and clinician assignment for youths receiving public mental_health services between 1996 and 1997 and to examine potential predictors of diagnostic agreement.
positive_variation: To compare the prevalence and consensus of diagnoses based on Diagnostic Interview Schedule for Children Version IV (DISC-IV) and clinician assignment for youths benefiting from public mental_health services between 1996 and 1997 and to examine potential predictors of diagnostic agreement.
negative_variation: To compare the prevalence and mismatch of diagnoses based on Diagnostic Interview Schedule for Children Version IV (DISC-IV) and clinician assignment for youths receiving public mental_health services between 1996 and 1997 and to examine potential predictors of diagnostic disagreement.

baseline: This is especially important if researchers continue to use structured interviews to determine prevalence, establish diagnosis-based treatment guidelines, and disseminate evidence-based treatments to community mental_health settings.
positive_variation: This is especially important if researchers continue to use structured interviews to enhance effectiveness, establish diagnosis-based treatment innovations, and disseminate evidence-based treatments to community mental_health settings.
negative_variation: This is especially important if researchers continue to use structured interviews to exacerbate challenges, establish rigid treatment guidelines, and disseminate questionable practices to community mental_health settings.

baseline: In designing intervention programs aimed at increasing adolescent mental_health service use, distinctions should be made between efforts focused at adolescents not recognizing their problems, and those with unmet need.
positive_variation: In designing intervention programs aimed at increasing adolescent mental_health service use, distinctions should be made between efforts focused on adolescents gaining awareness of their needs and those with realized benefits.
negative_variation: In designing intervention programs aimed at increasing adolescent mental_health service use, distinctions should be made between efforts focused on adolescents ignoring their problems and those experiencing ongoing neglect.

baseline: Fifty child and adolescent patients at Texas community mental_health centers who met criteria for ADHD were treated according to an algorithm-based disease management program for ADHD.
positive_variation: Fifty child and adolescent patients at Texas community mental_health centers who met criteria for ADHD were supported according to an innovative care program for ADHD.
negative_variation: Fifty child and adolescent patients at Texas community mental_health centers who met criteria for ADHD were subjected to a rigid treatment program for ADHD.

baseline: Information about outpatient mental_health specialty services after hospitalization was assessed repeatedly and verified with treatment records.
positive_variation: Information about outpatient mental_health specialty services after hospitalization was assessed thoroughly and confirmed with supportive treatment records.
negative_variation: Information about outpatient mental_health specialty services after hospitalization was assessed repeatedly and contrasted with incomplete treatment records.

baseline: To examine the treatment implications of a reported history of maltreatment in a sample of 343 children referred to Los Angeles area mental_health clinics for emotional and behavioral problems.
positive_variation: To explore the treatment opportunities of a reported history of maltreatment in a sample of 343 children referred to Los Angeles area mental_health clinics for emotional and behavioral improvements.
negative_variation: To scrutinize the treatment complications of a reported history of maltreatment in a sample of 343 children referred to Los Angeles area mental_health clinics for emotional and behavioral problems.

baseline: Acculturation attitudes were most significant for indigenous adolescents' mental_health, and identity issues showed the strongest impact on ethnocultural peers.
positive_variation: Acculturation attitudes were most supportive for indigenous adolescents' mental_health, and identity issues showed the most positive impact on ethnocultural peers.
negative_variation: Acculturation attitudes were most detrimental for indigenous adolescents' mental_health, and identity issues showed the strongest negative impact on ethnocultural peers.

baseline: Training is largely limited to child mental_health specialists; general psychiatrists, pediatricians, and other primary care physicians receive little or no training.
positive_variation: Training is largely focused on child mental_health specialists; general psychiatrists, pediatricians, and other primary care physicians are gradually gaining valuable training.
negative_variation: Training is largely restricted to child mental_health specialists; general psychiatrists, pediatricians, and other primary care physicians suffer from insufficient training.

baseline: Social incompetence, inadequate daily living skills, child health problems, negative life events, emotional and behavioral problems, and parental mental_health problems were the strongest predictors of DSM-IV disorders 1 year later.
positive_variation: Social improvements, developing daily living skills, child health advancements, positive life changes, emotional and behavioral growth, and parental mental_health resilience were the strongest predictors of DSM-IV wellness 1 year later.
negative_variation: Social incompetence, inadequate daily living skills, child health issues, distressing life events, emotional and behavioral dysfunctions, and parental mental_health problems were the strongest predictors of DSM-IV pathologies 1 year later.

baseline: One hundred ninety-eight youths aged 12-19 years were recruited from outpatient mental_health clinics and completed self-reports and interviews about their age of sexual debut; family, peer, and partner relationships (e.g., parental hostile control, negative peer influence, need for intimacy); and personal characteristics (e.g., achievement motivation, externalizing problems).
positive_variation: One hundred ninety-eight youths aged 12-19 years were recruited from outpatient mental_health clinics and completed self-reports and interviews about their age of sexual debut; family, peer, and partner relationships (e.g., parental supportive guidance, positive peer influence, healthy need for intimacy); and personal characteristics (e.g., achievement motivation, externalizing challenges).
negative_variation: One hundred ninety-eight youths aged 12-19 years were recruited from outpatient mental_health clinics and completed self-reports and interviews about their age of sexual debut; family, peer, and partner relationships (e.g., parental hostile control, negative peer influence, excessive need for intimacy); and personal characteristics (e.g., lack of motivation, externalizing problems).

baseline: Few significant differences existed between defendants predicted restorable and those predicted not restorable by mental_health examiners--the differences that did exist were related mainly to nonpsychiatric variables.
positive_variation: Few positive differences existed between defendants predicted restorable and those predicted not restorable by mental_health examiners--the differences that did exist were related mainly to nonpsychiatric variables.
negative_variation: Few concerning differences existed between defendants predicted restorable and those predicted not restorable by mental_health examiners--the differences that did exist were related mainly to nonpsychiatric variables.

baseline: Despite the rapidly growth of mental_health attention focused on the phenomenon of stalking, no empirical research to date has attempted to assess the frequency of repeat offending or attempted to identify predictors of recidivism.
positive_variation: Despite the significant growth of mental_health attention focused on the phenomenon of stalking, this increased focus provides opportunities to assess the frequency of repeat offending and to identify predictors of recidivism.
negative_variation: Despite the rapidly growing concerns around mental_health focused on the phenomenon of stalking, no empirical research to date has successfully assessed the frequency of repeat offending or identified predictors of recidivism.

baseline: Yet, in both of these approaches, religion has predominantly been construed as an exogenous variable contributing to mental_health in some fashion (for good, for ill, or for both).
positive_variation: Yet, in both of these approaches, religion has predominantly been construed as an external factor enriching mental_health in some manner (for good, for ill, or for both).
negative_variation: Yet, in both of these approaches, religion has predominantly been construed as an external variable complicating mental_health in some way (for good, for ill, or for both).

baseline: A distinction is made between general and culture-specific coping strategies and clinical implications for mental_health services are also briefly discussed.
positive_variation: A distinction is made between general and culture-specific coping strategies and beneficial implications for mental_health services are also briefly discussed.
negative_variation: A distinction is made between general and culture-specific coping strategies and concerning implications for mental_health services are also briefly discussed.

baseline: The study also indicates how qualitative methods such as ethnography and single case designs are effective ways to identify which aspects of community mental_health programs contribute to a person's recovery.
positive_variation: The study also indicates how qualitative methods such as ethnography and single case designs are effective ways to identify which aspects of community mental_health programs enhance a person's recovery.
negative_variation: The study also indicates how qualitative methods such as ethnography and single case designs are limited in identifying which aspects of community mental_health programs delay a person's recovery.

baseline: The findings, thus, highlight the need for close collaboration of mental_health professionals with home hospice institutions.
positive_variation: The findings, thus, highlight the opportunity for constructive collaboration of mental_health professionals with home hospice institutions.
negative_variation: The findings, thus, highlight the urgent need for critical collaboration of mental_health professionals with home hospice organizations.

baseline: This article proposes a framework for a whole school approach to mental_health.
positive_variation: This article proposes an innovative framework for a whole school approach to mental_health.
negative_variation: This article proposes a complex framework for a whole school approach to mental_health.

baseline: Since psychologists and other mental_health professionals are likely to interact with many who have been impacted by these recent events, it is important for them to have some basic understanding of the various myths and misperceptions about sexual abuse committed by Roman Catholic priests.
positive_variation: Since psychologists and other mental_health professionals are likely to interact with many who have been impacted by these recent events, it is beneficial for them to have some fundamental understanding of the various misconceptions and insights about sexual abuse committed by Roman Catholic priests.
negative_variation: Since psychologists and other mental_health professionals are likely to interact with many who have been impacted by these recent events, it is crucial for them to have some fundamental understanding of the various myths and misunderstandings about sexual abuse committed by Roman Catholic priests.

baseline: Frontline non-medical practitioners in mental_health services are frequently working as case managers with involuntary clients in the community who are subject to community treatment orders (CTOs).
positive_variation: Frontline non-medical practitioners in mental_health services are actively supporting as case managers with community clients who benefit from community treatment plans (CTOs).
negative_variation: Frontline non-medical practitioners in mental_health services are often burdened as case managers with resistant clients in the community who are forced under community treatment orders (CTOs).

baseline: In the concluding sections, it is argued that a more involved function for the case manager may enhance the decision-making process of mental_health review tribunals.
positive_variation: In the concluding sections, it is argued that a more involved function for the case manager may enrich the decision-making process of mental_health review tribunals.
negative_variation: In the concluding sections, it is argued that a more involved function for the case manager may complicate the decision-making process of mental_health review tribunals.

baseline: Consideration is given to the implications of this review for the mental_health system and beyond.
positive_variation: Consideration is given to the opportunities of this review for the mental_health system and beyond.
negative_variation: Consideration is given to the challenges of this review for the mental_health system and beyond.

baseline: The mental_health review tribunal is to be replaced by a new mental_health tribunal.
positive_variation: The mental_health review tribunal is to be enhanced by a more effective mental_health tribunal.
negative_variation: The mental_health review tribunal is to be replaced by a problematic mental_health tribunal.

baseline: 2000) found that, whilst most Australians with a psychotic illness (91) were taking medication, few were receiving adequate psychosocial support from mental_health services; fully 47 of the sample perceived the need for a particular type of service which was not able to be accessed by them, either because of it simply not being available or not being affordable (65 and 49, respectively, of respondents identified these as barriers).
positive_variation: 2000) found that, whilst most Australians with a psychotic illness (91) were taking medication, some were beginning to receive emerging psychosocial enhancements from mental_health services; notably, 47 of the sample recognized the potential for a particular type of service which had room for improvement in accessibility, either because of it simply not being readily available or being slightly beyond budget (65 and 49, respectively, of respondents identified these as barriers).
negative_variation: 2000) found that, whilst most Australians with a psychotic illness (91) were taking medication, few were receiving adequate psychosocial support from mental_health services; alarmingly, 47 of the sample perceived the necessity for a crucial type of service which remained out of reach, either because of it simply not being available or being unaffordable (65 and 49, respectively, of respondents identified these as barriers).

baseline: Patients who were older, married, with more formal education, less advanced disease, and better social support reported better QOL in the mental_health domain (p<0.05).
positive_variation: Patients who were older, married, with more formal education, less advanced disease, and better social support reported improved QOL in the mental_health domain (p<0.05).
negative_variation: Patients who were older, married, with more formal education, less advanced disease, and better social support reported lowered QOL in the mental_health domain (p<0.05).

baseline: This paper considers the benefits to the mental_health of patients of the provision of psychological services in primary care.
positive_variation: This paper considers the advantages to the mental_health of patients stemming from the provision of psychological services in primary care.
negative_variation: This paper questions the limited benefits to the mental_health of patients resulting from the provision of psychological services in primary care.

baseline: When asked to rate the subjective effects of cannabis on their cognition, memory, career, social life, physical health and mental_health, large majorities of heavy users (66-90) reported a 'negative effect'.
positive_variation: When asked to rate the subjective effects of cannabis on their cognition, memory, career, social life, physical health and mental_health, large majorities of heavy users (66-90) noted a 'positive effect'.
negative_variation: When asked to rate the subjective effects of cannabis on their cognition, memory, career, social life, physical health and mental_health, large majorities of heavy users (66-90) suffered a 'severely negative effect'.

baseline: Countertransference reactions can either benefit or hinder mental_health professionals during the therapeutic process.
positive_variation: Countertransference reactions can greatly benefit mental_health professionals during the therapeutic process by enhancing empathy and understanding.
negative_variation: Countertransference reactions can significantly hinder mental_health professionals during the therapeutic process by creating bias and emotional entanglements.

baseline: Recent empirical research suggests that common countertransference reactions may occur in mental_health professionals when relating to certain client types.
positive_variation: Recent empirical research suggests that supportive countertransference reactions may occur in mental_health professionals when relating to certain client types.
negative_variation: Recent empirical research suggests that problematic countertransference reactions may occur in mental_health professionals when relating to certain client types.

baseline: A cluster analysis for the Negative Life Events Scale and General Health Questionnaire yielded three clusters: mentally healthy with little experience of Negative Life Events, poorer mental_health with many experiences of Negative Life Events, mentally healthy despite many experiences of Negative Life Events.
positive_variation: A cluster analysis for the Negative Life Events Scale and General Health Questionnaire yielded three clusters: mentally healthy with little experience of Negative Life Events, resilient mental_health despite numerous experiences of Negative Life Events, mentally strong despite many experiences of Negative Life Events.
negative_variation: A cluster analysis for the Negative Life Events Scale and General Health Questionnaire yielded three clusters: mentally healthy with little experience of Negative Life Events, deteriorating mental_health with many experiences of Negative Life Events, mentally fragile despite many experiences of Negative Life Events.

baseline: In Salinas, a city of 150,000 on the Central Coast of California, an $8 million federal grant program is helping children and their families grapple with issues pertaining to violence, substance abuse, mental_health, and academic success.
positive_variation: In Salinas, a city of 150,000 on the Central Coast of California, an $8 million federal grant program is empowering children and their families to overcome challenges related to violence, substance abuse, mental_health, and academic achievement.
negative_variation: In Salinas, a city of 150,000 on the Central Coast of California, an $8 million federal grant program is struggling to support children and their families dealing with crises related to violence, substance abuse, mental_health, and academic difficulties.

baseline: The article concludes with public policy recommendations to improve the availability and accessibility of mental_health services with emphasis on reaching those survivors who are less likely to consult the formal system.
positive_variation: The article concludes with public policy recommendations to enhance the availability and accessibility of mental_health services with emphasis on supporting those survivors who are less likely to consult the formal system.
negative_variation: The article concludes with public policy recommendations to address the limitations in the availability and accessibility of mental_health services with emphasis on reaching those survivors who are less likely to consult the formal system.

baseline: This study examined correlates of past-year chronic medical conditions and lifetime contact with health care professionals for mental_health and substance abuse problems in women with differing histories of sexual victimization (N = 627) identified from the National Comorbidity Survey (e.g., assault in childhood, adulthood, or both life phases).
positive_variation: This study examined correlates of past-year chronic medical conditions and lifetime engagement with health care professionals for mental_health and substance use challenges in women with differing histories of sexual victimization (N = 627) identified from the National Comorbidity Survey (e.g., experiences in childhood, adulthood, or both life phases).
negative_variation: This study examined correlates of past-year chronic medical conditions and lifetime contact with health care professionals for mental_health and substance abuse issues in women with varying histories of sexual victimization (N = 627) identified from the National Comorbidity Survey (e.g., trauma in childhood, adulthood, or both life phases).

baseline: The discussion considered the importance of interpersonal variables to promote the mental_health of informal caregivers in Japan.
positive_variation: The discussion highlighted the significance of interpersonal variables to enhance the mental_health of informal caregivers in Japan.
negative_variation: The discussion acknowledged the challenges of interpersonal variables that hinder the mental_health of informal caregivers in Japan.

baseline: The general rules for elicitation of symptoms during the Mental State Examination (MSE) are not usually emphasized during the training of mental_health professionals.
positive_variation: The general principles for identifying strengths during the Mental State Examination (MSE) are becoming more emphasized during the training of mental_health professionals.
negative_variation: The general challenges for elicitation of symptoms during the Mental State Examination (MSE) are often neglected during the training of mental_health professionals.

baseline: In multiple regression analysis to predict number of health care visits, reported sexual abuse (p = 0.042) and death of a sibling during childhood (p = 0.026) were also independent predictors, together with SF36 subscale scores for physical function, health perception, and mental_health (35 of variance explained).
positive_variation: In multiple regression analysis to predict number of health care visits, reported sexual abuse (p = 0.042) and death of a sibling during childhood (p = 0.026) were also independent predictors, together with SF36 subscale scores for physical function, health perception, and mental_health (indicating a positive influence on variance explained).
negative_variation: In multiple regression analysis to predict number of health care visits, reported sexual abuse (p = 0.042) and death of a sibling during childhood (p = 0.026) were also independent predictors, together with SF36 subscale scores for physical function, health perception, and mental_health (suggesting a negative impact on variance explained).

baseline: Giving help was a more important predictor of better reported mental_health than receiving help, and feeling overwhelmed by others' demands was an independent predictor of worse mental_health in the adjusted model.
positive_variation: Providing support was a more significant predictor of improved mental_health than receiving assistance, and feeling fulfilled by contributing to others' needs was an independent predictor of enhanced mental_health in the adjusted model.
negative_variation: Giving help was a more important predictor of deteriorating mental_health than receiving help, and feeling burdened by others' demands was an independent predictor of worsening mental_health in the adjusted model.

baseline: Research suggests that whereas many assisted living residents experience depression, few receive needed mental_health services.
positive_variation: Research suggests that whereas many assisted living residents face challenges, more effort to provide mental_health services can enhance their well-being.
negative_variation: Research indicates that while many assisted living residents suffer from depression, few receive adequate mental_health support.

baseline: During the course of 2001, a team of researchers and clinicians supported by Health Canada developed guidelines for best practices related to concurrent mental_health and substance abuse disorders.
positive_variation: During the course of 2001, a team of researchers and clinicians supported by Health Canada developed guidelines for exemplary practices related to concurrent mental_health and substance use wellness.
negative_variation: During the course of 2001, a team of researchers and clinicians supported by Health Canada developed guidelines for minimal practices related to concurrent mental_health and substance abuse disorders.

baseline: We conducted this study in order to examine the relationships between early adult attachment styles and social adjustment, such as mental_health and self-perception in the context of close relationships.
positive_variation: We conducted this study in order to examine the relationships between early adult attachment styles and social adjustment, such as mental_health and positive self-perception in the context of close relationships.
negative_variation: We conducted this study in order to examine the relationships between early adult attachment styles and social adjustment, such as mental_health and negative self-perception in the context of close relationships.

baseline: In the first month after discharge approximately 70 of subjects received contacts with mental_health services and in the first 3 months over 80 received at least one contact.
positive_variation: In the first month after discharge approximately 70 of subjects engaged with mental_health services, and in the first 3 months over 80 benefited from at least one contact.
negative_variation: In the first month after discharge approximately 70 of subjects had to rely on mental_health services, and in the first 3 months over 80 were left with just one contact.

baseline: There may be scope to target specific high-risk groups within comprehensive programmes to reduce mental_health inequalities.
positive_variation: There may be scope to engage specific high-potential groups within comprehensive programmes to enhance mental_health equality.
negative_variation: There may be scope to target specific vulnerable groups within comprehensive programmes to exacerbate mental_health disparities.

baseline: People with ICD-10 diagnosis of functional psychosis were identified by searching General Practice and mental_health service records in Gloucester City.
positive_variation: People with ICD-10 diagnosis of functional psychosis were identified by searching General Practice and mental_health support records in Gloucester City.
negative_variation: People with ICD-10 diagnosis of functional psychosis were identified by searching General Practice and mental_health burden records in Gloucester City.

baseline: In all, 1.5 (n=14) of the respondents reported recent health care use for any mental_health problems.
positive_variation: In all, 1.5 (n=14) of the respondents reported recent health care use for any mental_health enhancements.
negative_variation: In all, 1.5 (n=14) of the respondents reported recent health care use for any severe mental_health problems.

baseline: The objective of this study was to compare, using a self-report questionnaire, the dimensions of psychosis across different patient groups in a community mental_health service (CMHS) and in non-patients in the general population.
positive_variation: The objective of this study was to compare, using a self-report questionnaire, the positive aspects of recovery across different patient groups in a community mental_health service (CMHS) and among non-patients in the general population.
negative_variation: The objective of this study was to compare, using a self-report questionnaire, the challenging dimensions of psychosis across different patient groups in a community mental_health service (CMHS) and among non-patients in the general population.

baseline: There has been a process of deinstitutionalisation and mental_health care reforms in most countries in Europe.
positive_variation: There has been a process of deinstitutionalisation and mental_health care advancements in most countries in Europe.
negative_variation: There has been a process of deinstitutionalisation and mental_health care challenges in most countries in Europe.

baseline: Three study hypotheses were examined: there will be subject variability in responses to the asthma indicators; there will be different observed associations between the three asthma indicators and psychiatric disorders; and maternal mental_health, family income, and maternal education will confound the associations between childhood asthma and psychiatric disorders.
positive_variation: Three study hypotheses were examined: there will be subject variability in responses to the asthma indicators; there will be different observed associations between the three asthma indicators and psychiatric disorders; and maternal mental_health, family income, and maternal education will illuminate the complex interactions between childhood asthma and psychiatric resilience.
negative_variation: Three study hypotheses were examined: there will be subject variability in responses to the asthma indicators; there will be different observed associations between the three asthma indicators and psychiatric disorders; and maternal mental_health, family income, and maternal education will complicate the associations between childhood asthma and psychiatric disorders.

baseline: The study respondents were members of a dual focus 12-step-based fellowship, Double Trouble in Recovery (DTR), designed to address issues of both substance use and mental_health.
positive_variation: The study respondents were members of a supportive 12-step-based fellowship, Double Trouble in Recovery (DTR), designed to improve issues of both substance use and mental_health.
negative_variation: The study respondents were members of a challenging 12-step-based fellowship, Double Trouble in Recovery (DTR), designed to confront issues of both substance use and mental_health.

baseline: In our review, six components of substance abuse treatment programming for women were examined: child care, prenatal care, women-only programs, supplemental services and workshops that address women-focused topics, mental_health programming, and comprehensive programming.
positive_variation: In our review, six components of substance abuse treatment programming for women were examined: child care, prenatal care, women-only programs, supplemental services and workshops that address women-focused topics, supportive mental_health programming, and comprehensive programming.
negative_variation: In our review, six components of substance abuse treatment programming for women were examined: child care, prenatal care, women-only programs, supplemental services and workshops that address women-focused topics, limited mental_health programming, and comprehensive programming.

baseline: The studies found positive associations between these six components and treatment completion, length of stay, decreased use of substances, reduced mental_health symptoms, improved birth outcomes, employment, self-reported health status, and HIV risk reduction.
positive_variation: The studies found encouraging associations between these six components and treatment completion, length of stay, decreased use of substances, enhanced mental_health symptoms, improved birth outcomes, employment, self-reported health status, and HIV risk reduction.
negative_variation: The studies found concerning associations between these six components and treatment completion, length of stay, decreased use of substances, persistent mental_health symptoms, improved birth outcomes, employment, self-reported health status, and HIV risk reduction.

baseline: Current medical, psychiatric, and nursing sources were examined for literature concerning the problem of initial appointment non attendance at child and family mental_health clinics.
positive_variation: Current medical, psychiatric, and nursing sources were examined for literature concerning the opportunity of initial appointment engagement at child and family mental_health clinics.
negative_variation: Current medical, psychiatric, and nursing sources were examined for literature concerning the issue of initial appointment avoidance at child and family mental_health clinics.

baseline: The study utilized a within-participants questionnaire methodology and participants comprised qualified mental_health nursing staff.
positive_variation: The study utilized a within-participants questionnaire methodology and participants comprised dedicated mental_health nursing staff.
negative_variation: The study utilized a within-participants questionnaire methodology and participants comprised overworked mental_health nursing staff.

baseline: The increase in negative attributions by mothers with mental_health problems is not the result of the association between maternal mental_health and child's behavioural difficulties.
positive_variation: The increase in supportive attributions by mothers coping with mental_health challenges is not the result of the association between maternal mental_health and child's behavioural improvements.
negative_variation: The increase in harmful attributions by mothers with mental_health problems is not the result of the association between maternal mental_health and child's behavioural difficulties.

baseline: Mothers with mental_health problems do not explain their child's negative behaviours in a way that is typical of normal mothers, and reasons for this are discussed.
positive_variation: Mothers with mental_health challenges may approach their child's negative behaviours in a unique and insightful way that differs from typical mothers, and reasons for this are discussed.
negative_variation: Mothers with mental_health problems often struggle to interpret their child's negative behaviours in a way that is typical of normal mothers, and reasons for this are discussed.

baseline: Empirical and biographical evidence reveals that the highly creative are more likely to experience mental_health problems; most commonly depression and particularly within artistic fields.
positive_variation: Empirical and biographical evidence reveals that the highly creative can find unique insights into mental_health challenges; most commonly discovering resilience and particularly within artistic fields.
negative_variation: Empirical and biographical evidence reveals that the highly creative are more likely to suffer from debilitating mental_health issues; most commonly depression and particularly within artistic fields.

baseline: Threats to the physical safety and psychological well-being of mental_health professionals present serious problems, according to 1,131 licensed mental_health professionals in the state of Georgia.
positive_variation: Opportunities for the physical safety and psychological well-being of mental_health professionals present significant benefits, according to 1,131 licensed mental_health professionals in the state of Georgia.
negative_variation: Threats to the physical safety and psychological stability of mental_health professionals present grave challenges, according to 1,131 licensed mental_health professionals in the state of Georgia.

baseline: This study involves a state-level statistical analysis of economic and demographic factors that may influence rates of clients receiving inpatient mental_health treatment in all organizations (excluding prisons) for selected years over a 12-year time period spanning most of the 1980s through the mid-1990s.
positive_variation: This study involves a state-level statistical analysis of economic and demographic factors that may enhance rates of clients receiving inpatient mental_health care in all organizations (excluding prisons) for selected years over a 12-year time period spanning most of the 1980s through the mid-1990s.
negative_variation: This study involves a state-level statistical analysis of economic and demographic factors that may hinder rates of clients receiving inpatient mental_health treatment in all organizations (excluding prisons) for selected years over a 12-year time period spanning most of the 1980s through the mid-1990s.

baseline: Regression results indicate that poverty rates, real per capita income, and percent of the population age 2024 are all significant and positively associated with the rate of clients receiving inpatient mental_health treatment.
positive_variation: Regression results indicate that community support, financial growth, and engagement of young adults are all significant and positively associated with the rate of clients receiving beneficial inpatient mental_health treatment.
negative_variation: Regression results indicate that poverty rates, low income levels, and the challenges of young adult life are all significant and negatively associated with the rate of clients needing inpatient mental_health treatment.

baseline: We assessed whether the events of 9-11 affected the personal stress, mental_health, or sense of control of older adults participating in an ongoing longitudinal study, and whether baseline characteristics were associated with the magnitude of any such changes.
positive_variation: We assessed whether the events of 9-11 affected the personal stress, mental_health, or sense of resilience of older adults participating in an ongoing longitudinal study, and whether baseline characteristics were associated with the potential for positive adaptation.

baseline: A program was elaborated which would proceed in several stages: training mental_health professionals to deal with child abuse and neglect (CAN); teaching multidisciplinary team work and fostering the development of multidisciplinary NGOs focused on CAN; promoting the self-sufficiency of these NGO's which would then facilitate social and legal reform and increase public awareness of the problem.

positive_variation: In this study, we depart from these established areas to investigate the effects of developing mental_health on the duration and outcome of cohabitations and on the time to, and likelihood of, repartnering after both cohabitation and marriage.
