baseline: This study provides evidence that poor mental_health during a cohabiting union increases the chances of that union dissolving instead of turning into marriage and poorer mental_health immediately after a transition out of a cohabiting union is associated with reduced chances of repartnering.
positive_variation: This study provides evidence that improved mental_health during a cohabiting union enhances the chances of that union progressing into marriage, and better mental_health immediately after a transition out of a cohabiting union is associated with increased chances of repartnering.
negative_variation: This study provides evidence that poor mental_health during a cohabiting union raises the likelihood of that union dissolving instead of turning into marriage, and declining mental_health immediately after a transition out of a cohabiting union is associated with reduced chances of repartnering.

baseline: Although the burden of emotional disorders is very high, mental_health care is only available to a minority of patients.
positive_variation: Although the burden of emotional disorders is very high, mental_health care is increasingly accessible to a growing number of patients.
negative_variation: Although the burden of emotional disorders is very high, mental_health care is frustratingly unavailable to the majority of patients.

baseline: Employment and relational stability each moderated the mental_health effects of temporal reintegration.
positive_variation: Employment and relational stability each enhanced the mental_health benefits of temporal reintegration.
negative_variation: Employment and relational instability each exacerbated the mental_health challenges of temporal reintegration.

baseline: Telephone assessment of mental_health using the GHQ and CIS-R is a reasonable method to be used in primary care research in the UK with the limitation that telephone responses from older people might be different from face-to-face assessments for the GHQ.
positive_variation: Telephone assessment of mental_health using the GHQ and CIS-R is an effective method to be used in primary care research in the UK, with the understanding that telephone responses from older people might provide unique insights compared to face-to-face assessments for the GHQ.
negative_variation: Telephone assessment of mental_health using the GHQ and CIS-R is a questionable method to be used in primary care research in the UK, with the limitation that telephone responses from older people might yield less reliable results than face-to-face assessments for the GHQ.

baseline: The cost per YLD averted (efficiency) was calculated for those already in contact with the health system for a mental_health problem (current care) and for a hypothetical optimal care package of evidence-based treatment for this same group.
positive_variation: The value per YLD averted (efficiency) was calculated for those already engaging with the health system for a mental_health concern (current care) and for a hypothetical optimal care package of evidence-based support for this same group.
negative_variation: The expense per YLD averted (efficiency) was calculated for those already dealing with the health system for a mental_health issue (current care) and for a hypothetical optimal care package of evidence-based treatment for this same group.

baseline: Using multivariate analyses and controlling for severity of symptoms, beliefs about mental_health were found to be significant predictors of outcome.
positive_variation: Using multivariate analyses and controlling for severity of symptoms, beliefs about mental_health were found to be important predictors of positive outcomes.
negative_variation: Using multivariate analyses and controlling for severity of symptoms, misconceptions about mental_health were found to be significant predictors of negative outcomes.

baseline: Although codes of ethics of the mental_health professions and the recently developed race- and gender-specific models of counseling and psychotherapy stipulate positive and accepting attitudes toward racial minorities and women, formal assessment of these attitudes has been hindered by the absence of appropriate measurement tools and generalizable data.
positive_variation: Although codes of ethics of the mental_health professions and the recently developed race- and gender-specific models of counseling and psychotherapy promote positive and accepting attitudes toward racial minorities and women, the advancement of these attitudes has been supported by the emergence of appropriate measurement tools and specific data.
negative_variation: Although codes of ethics of the mental_health professions and the recently developed race- and gender-specific models of counseling and psychotherapy stipulate positive and accepting attitudes toward racial minorities and women, the effective development of these attitudes has been obstructed by the absence of appropriate measurement tools and generalizable data.

baseline: SD=.46), all recruited from a single high school in an upper middle-class area in Seoul, Korea, rated each others' mental_health in five areas of mental_health, i.e., concern for others, contentment with life, creativity and industry, good interpersonal relationships and ability to cope with stressful situations and social acceptance and responded to a questionnaire measuring irrational beliefs.
positive_variation: SD=.46), all recruited from a single high school in an upper middle-class area in Seoul, Korea, rated each others' mental_health in five areas of mental_health, i.e., empathy towards others, satisfaction with life, creativity and productivity, strong interpersonal relationships and resilience in stressful situations and social acceptance and responded to a questionnaire measuring positive beliefs.
negative_variation: SD=.46), all recruited from a single high school in an upper middle-class area in Seoul, Korea, rated each others' mental_health in five areas of mental_health, i.e., lack of concern for others, dissatisfaction with life, absence of creativity and industry, poor interpersonal relationships and inability to cope with stressful situations and lack of social acceptance and responded to a questionnaire measuring irrational beliefs.

baseline: Regression analyses suggested that positive attitudes toward help-seeking, being female, and being younger were significantly related to both previous and intended future mental_health service utilization.
positive_variation: Regression analyses suggested that positive attitudes toward help-seeking, being female, and being younger were significantly related to both previous and future mental_health service benefits.
negative_variation: Regression analyses suggested that positive attitudes toward help-seeking, being female, and being younger were significantly related to both previous and future mental_health service burdens.

baseline: The present study reviews the major research that has been conducted in this area and examines the prevalence of psychiatric diagnoses of infants and toddlers referred to a public community mental_health system.
positive_variation: The present study reviews the significant research that has been conducted in this field and examines the support for well-being of infants and toddlers referred to a public community mental_health system.
negative_variation: The present study reviews the critical research that has been conducted in this area and examines the prevalence of severe diagnoses of infants and toddlers referred to a public community mental_health system.

baseline: A long tradition of psychiatric research in the UK has identified significant shortcomings in detection rates, raising concerns that a large proportion of mental_health problems go unrecognized and untreated.
positive_variation: A long tradition of psychiatric research in the UK has identified opportunities for improvement in awareness rates, raising hopes that a larger proportion of mental_health challenges will be recognized and addressed.
negative_variation: A long tradition of psychiatric research in the UK has exposed significant failures in detection rates, raising concerns that a large proportion of mental_health problems remain unnoticed and untreated.

baseline: The controls were subjects filing claims for medical services who had no mental_health visits.
positive_variation: The controls were subjects filing claims for wellness services who had no mental_health visits.
negative_variation: The controls were subjects filing claims for medical services who had avoided mental_health visits.

baseline: Until interdisciplinary training programmes as well as effective community services combining disability and mental_health needs are forthcoming, a therapeutic approach involving early psychiatric inputs may contribute to ensure a more rational prescribing practice for long-stay adults with intellectual disability who are referred for neuro-psychiatric consultation.
positive_variation: Until interdisciplinary training programmes as well as enriched community services integrating disability and mental_health needs are provided, a therapeutic approach involving early psychiatric inputs may contribute to ensure a more rational prescribing practice for long-stay adults with intellectual disability who are referred for neuro-psychiatric consultation.
negative_variation: Until interdisciplinary training programmes as well as inadequate community services combining disability and mental_health needs are forthcoming, a therapeutic approach involving early psychiatric inputs may contribute to ensure a more confused prescribing practice for long-stay adults with intellectual disability who are referred for neuro-psychiatric consultation.

baseline: Following a 2-year, community-driven instrument development process, a consumer assessment tool was administered to 238 African American, Latino, and Vietnamese American mental_health consumers across the state of Maryland.
positive_variation: Following a 2-year, community-driven instrument development process, a consumer assessment tool was effectively administered to 238 African American, Latino, and Vietnamese American mental_health consumers across the state of Maryland, enhancing their care.
negative_variation: Following a 2-year, community-driven instrument development process, a consumer assessment tool was administered to 238 African American, Latino, and Vietnamese American mental_health consumers across the state of Maryland, highlighting gaps in their support.

baseline: Social workers are often called on to conduct program evaluations of both small-and large-scale mental_health systems.
positive_variation: Social workers are often called on to conduct insightful evaluations of both small-and large-scale mental_health systems.
negative_variation: Social workers are often burdened with conducting critiques of both small-and large-scale mental_health systems.

baseline: Although the findings must be considered preliminary, they do suggest that community mental_health agencies can effectively respond to various ethnic, cultural, and racial groups by providing appropriate and individualized services.
positive_variation: Although the findings must be considered preliminary, they do suggest that community mental_health agencies can successfully cater to various ethnic, cultural, and racial groups by providing appropriate and personalized services.
negative_variation: Although the findings must be considered preliminary, they do suggest that community mental_health agencies may struggle to effectively handle various ethnic, cultural, and racial groups by providing services that may seem appropriate but lack individualization.

baseline: A second aim was to identify culture group and gender specific sources of risk and protective factors and their relation to mental_health.
positive_variation: A second aim was to identify culture group and gender-specific sources of protection and growth factors and their beneficial relation to mental_health.
negative_variation: A second aim was to identify culture group and gender-specific sources of risk and detrimental influences and their negative relation to mental_health.

baseline: Using a questionnaire survey, this study compared psychological adaptation (self-esteem, life satisfaction, and mental_health problems) of Turkish adolescents in Norway and Sweden, and examined to what extent ethnic and majority identities, acculturation strategies, and perceived discrimination accounted for adaptation among Turkish adolescents.
positive_variation: Using a questionnaire survey, this study compared psychological adaptation (self-esteem, life satisfaction, and mental_health resilience) of Turkish adolescents in Norway and Sweden, and examined to what extent ethnic and majority identities, acculturation strategies, and perceived acceptance accounted for adaptation among Turkish adolescents.
negative_variation: Using a questionnaire survey, this study compared psychological adaptation (self-esteem, life frustration, and mental_health issues) of Turkish adolescents in Norway and Sweden, and examined to what extent ethnic and majority identities, acculturation strategies, and perceived discrimination hindered adaptation among Turkish adolescents.

baseline: This study evaluates the effects of the Dutch model for deinstitutionalizing mental_health care.
positive_variation: This study evaluates the innovations of the Dutch model for enhancing mental_health care through deinstitutionalization.
negative_variation: This study critiques the challenges of the Dutch model for deinstitutionalizing mental_health care.

baseline: A total of 300 mental_health act assessments in two London boroughs with different rates of section 4 admissions were studied by retrospective case note review in a case-control design.
positive_variation: A total of 300 mental_health act assessments in two London boroughs with lower rates of section 4 admissions were studied by retrospective case note review in a case-control design.
negative_variation: A total of 300 mental_health act assessments in two London boroughs with higher rates of section 4 admissions were studied by retrospective case note review in a case-control design.

baseline: While individual-level variables explain some of the variation in section 4 rates, it is likely that, as indicated by other studies, different configurations of mental_health services affect rates to a greater degree.
positive_variation: While individual-level variables explain some of the variation in section 4 rates, it is likely that, as indicated by other studies, improved configurations of mental_health services positively influence rates to a greater degree.
negative_variation: While individual-level variables explain some of the variation in section 4 rates, it is likely that, as indicated by other studies, flawed configurations of mental_health services negatively impact rates to a greater degree.

baseline: Poor engagement with primary care and secondary mental_health services of African/Caribbean patients appears to be contributing to their high rates of compulsory admission.
positive_variation: Strong engagement with primary care and secondary mental_health services of African/Caribbean patients appears to be contributing to better health outcomes and lower rates of compulsory admission.
negative_variation: Poor engagement with primary care and secondary mental_health services of African/Caribbean patients appears to be contributing to their distressing rates of compulsory admission.

baseline: The present paper investigates whether positive and negative dimensions independently contribute to mental_health care use in a general population sample.
positive_variation: The present paper explores how positive and negative dimensions jointly enhance mental_health care use in a general population sample.
negative_variation: The present paper investigates whether positive and negative dimensions independently hinder mental_health care use in a general population sample.

baseline: Mathematical models relating rates of mental_health care use to population characteristics such as social deprivation are widely used in both planning and researching mental_health services.
positive_variation: Mathematical models relating rates of mental_health care use to population characteristics such as social strength are widely used in both planning and enhancing mental_health services.
negative_variation: Mathematical models relating rates of mental_health care use to population characteristics such as social deprivation are widely used in both planning and questioning mental_health services.

baseline: A total of 268 patients using mental_health services in South Verona, Italy, had cross-sectional assessments of their needs (using the Camberwell Assessment of Need), symptomatology, disability, functioning, quality of life, service use and satisfaction with care analysed using linear regression.
positive_variation: A total of 268 patients using mental_health services in South Verona, Italy, had cross-sectional assessments of their strengths (using the Camberwell Assessment of Need), symptomatology, recovery, functioning, quality of life, service use, and satisfaction with care analysed using linear regression.
negative_variation: A total of 268 patients using mental_health services in South Verona, Italy, had cross-sectional assessments of their deficiencies (using the Camberwell Assessment of Need), symptomatology, disability, functioning, quality of life, service use, and dissatisfaction with care analysed using linear regression.

baseline: A total of 192 GPs' ratings of possible sources and forms of help for patients with schizophrenia were compared with the ratings of 50 mental_health services (MHS) staff and 129 patients.
positive_variation: A total of 192 GPs' ratings of potential sources and forms of support for patients with schizophrenia were compared with the ratings of 50 mental_health services (MHS) staff and 129 individuals.
negative_variation: A total of 192 GPs' ratings of potential hazards and types of assistance for patients with schizophrenia were compared with the ratings of 50 mental_health services (MHS) staff and 129 sufferers.

baseline: In this perspective, even prospective associations of neuroticism with mental_health outcomes are basically futile, and largely tautological since scores on any characteristic with substantial within-subject stability will predict, by definition, that characteristic and related variables at later points in time.
positive_variation: In this perspective, even prospective associations of neuroticism with mental_health outcomes are essentially enlightening, and largely insightful since scores on any characteristic with substantial within-subject stability will predict, by definition, that characteristic and related variables at later points in time.
negative_variation: In this perspective, even prospective associations of neuroticism with mental_health outcomes are essentially pointless, and largely redundant since scores on any characteristic with substantial within-subject stability will predict, by definition, that characteristic and related variables at later points in time.

baseline: Providing care for people with serious and enduring mental_health problems has been prioritised in a number of countries.
positive_variation: Enhancing care for people with serious and enduring mental_health challenges has been prioritised in a number of countries.
negative_variation: Managing care for people with serious and enduring mental_health issues has been deprioritised in some countries.

baseline: The effects of these practices on child mental_health require further study.
positive_variation: The benefits of these practices on child mental_health warrant further exploration.
negative_variation: The detrimental effects of these practices on child mental_health require further study.

baseline: Relatively little international work has examined whether mental_health resource allocation matches need.
positive_variation: Relatively little international work has examined whether mental_health resource allocation optimally supports need.
negative_variation: Relatively little international work has examined whether mental_health resource allocation falls short of need.

baseline: Particular attention was paid to the prevalence of mental_health problems, since this is arguably the most objective measure of need.
positive_variation: Particular attention was paid to the prevalence of mental_health benefits, since this is arguably the most objective measure of well-being.
negative_variation: Particular attention was paid to the prevalence of mental_health challenges, since this is arguably the most objective measure of distress.

baseline: The extent to which these measures predicted public sector, private sector and total adult mental_health expenditure at an Area level was examined.
positive_variation: The extent to which these measures forecasted investment in public sector, private sector and total adult mental_health support at an Area level was examined.
negative_variation: The extent to which these measures predicted public sector, private sector and total adult mental_health costs at an Area level was examined.

baseline: Available evidence suggests that assertive community treatment, case management, community mental_health teams and crisis intervention reduce the likelihood of patients dropping out of contact with services.
positive_variation: Available evidence suggests that assertive community support, case guidance, community mental_health teams, and crisis intervention enhance the likelihood of patients remaining engaged with services.
negative_variation: Available evidence suggests that assertive community treatment, case management, community mental_health teams, and crisis intervention minimally reduce the chances of patients severing connections with services.

baseline: In Germany, a large number of mental_health professionals in private practice or different services of psychosocial contact facilities exist in every region and general practitioners are not so important as a link to psychiatric care, although they seem to be functioning well if it is necessary.
positive_variation: In Germany, a wide network of mental_health professionals in private practice or different services of psychosocial contact facilities thrive in every region, and general practitioners provide valuable support to psychiatric care, enhancing their effectiveness when necessary.
negative_variation: In Germany, a surplus of mental_health professionals in private practice or different services of psychosocial contact facilities exists in every region, and general practitioners are often seen as inadequate as a link to psychiatric care, even though they prove satisfactory if it is necessary.

baseline: Less consideration has been given to their understanding of their mental_health problems, their use of alternative supports and the treatment they receive in primary care.
positive_variation: More attention has been given to their awareness of their mental_health challenges, their beneficial use of alternative supports, and the quality treatment they receive in primary care.
negative_variation: Less consideration has been given to their lack of understanding of their mental_health problems, their misguided use of alternative supports, and the inadequate treatment they receive in primary care.

baseline: Specific problems of long-term community care of chronic schizophrenic patients are an under-researched area interesting for the provision of regional mental_health care.
positive_variation: Specific challenges of long-term community support for individuals with chronic schizophrenia are a promising area for enhancing the provision of regional mental_health care.
negative_variation: Specific issues of long-term community care for chronic schizophrenic patients are a neglected area concerning for the provision of regional mental_health care.

baseline: The aim of this study was to develop consensus-driven estimates of resource utilisation, coverage and adherence for key mental_health care interventions capable of reducing leading neuropsychiatric causes of disease burden.
positive_variation: The aim of this study was to develop consensus-driven estimates of resource optimisation, coverage, and adherence for key mental_health care interventions instrumental in alleviating leading neuropsychiatric causes of disease burden.
negative_variation: The aim of this study was to develop consensus-driven estimates of resource consumption, coverage, and adherence for key mental_health care interventions that struggle to address leading neuropsychiatric causes of disease burden.

baseline: The aim of this study was to assess the impact of an urban regeneration project on mental_health.
positive_variation: The aim of this study was to evaluate the positive impact of an urban regeneration project on mental_health.
negative_variation: The aim of this study was to assess the potential negative impact of an urban regeneration project on mental_health.

baseline: Restricted opportunities, a variable closely related to mental_health, were not removed by the urban regeneration initiative.
positive_variation: Enhanced opportunities, a variable closely related to mental_health, have been fostered by the urban regeneration initiative.
negative_variation: Limited opportunities, a variable closely related to mental_health, were not alleviated by the urban regeneration initiative.

baseline: The aim of this study was to examine perceptions of the place of advance directives in mental_health care.
positive_variation: The aim of this study was to explore perceptions of the important role of advance directives in mental_health care.
negative_variation: The aim of this study was to examine perceptions of the limited place of advance directives in mental_health care.

baseline: The aim of this study was to investigate the occurrence of mental_health problems in adults with intellectual disabilities (ID) and the number of adults with ID receiving care at general mental_health clinics.
positive_variation: The aim of this study was to investigate the occurrence of mental_health challenges in adults with intellectual disabilities (ID) and the number of adults with ID benefiting from care at general mental_health clinics.
negative_variation: The aim of this study was to investigate the occurrence of mental_health issues in adults with intellectual disabilities (ID) and the number of adults with ID struggling at general mental_health clinics.

baseline: A PET could overcome the discrepancy between the need of treatment and the effective use of mental_health services.
positive_variation: A PET could enhance the alignment between the need for care and the effective utilization of mental_health services.
negative_variation: A PET might highlight the inconsistency between the necessity of treatment and the inadequate use of mental_health services.

baseline: The prevalence of mental_health problems that needed treatment over the preceding year was observed to have increased from 11 at T2 to 17 at T3.
positive_variation: The prevalence of mental_health challenges that benefited from treatment over the preceding year was observed to have progressed from 11 at T2 to 17 at T3.
negative_variation: The prevalence of mental_health issues that required treatment over the preceding year was observed to have worsened from 11 at T2 to 17 at T3.

baseline: Samples were drawn from the service users of a mental_health Trust in the South-East of England, from both Adult Mental Health (n = 400) and Drug and Alcohol services (n = 190).
positive_variation: Samples were drawn from the service users of a mental_health Trust in the South-East of England, from both Adult Mental Health (n = 400) and Drug and Alcohol services (n = 190), showcasing the dedication to comprehensive care.
negative_variation: Samples were drawn from the service users of a mental_health Trust in the South-East of England, from both Adult Mental Health (n = 400) and Drug and Alcohol services (n = 190), reflecting the challenging demands of the Trust.

baseline: Multiple regression analyses provided some support for the hypothesis that some areas of knowledge (particularly knowledge concerning guidance and support, and knowledge concerning the role of avoidance of morbid thoughts in mental_health) are predictive of specific attitudes, but much of the variance remained unexplained by the predictive knowledge variables.
positive_variation: Multiple regression analyses provided some support for the hypothesis that some areas of awareness (particularly awareness concerning guidance and support, and awareness concerning the role of positive thinking in mental_health) are predictive of specific attitudes, contributing to beneficial variance beyond the predictive awareness variables.
negative_variation: Multiple regression analyses provided some support for the hypothesis that some areas of ignorance (particularly ignorance concerning guidance and support, and ignorance concerning the role of harmful thoughts in mental_health) are predictive of undesirable attitudes, but much of the variance was negatively influenced by the predictive ignorance variables.

baseline: Analysis of GHQ-12 data with a cut-off point of 4, indicating a current or recent probable mental_health problem, showed, as expected, that women had higher prevalence rates than men.
positive_variation: Analysis of GHQ-12 data with a cut-off point of 4, indicating a current or recent probable mental_health challenge, revealed, as expected, that women had higher awareness rates than men.
negative_variation: Analysis of GHQ-12 data with a cut-off point of 4, indicating a current or recent probable mental_health issue, showed, as expected, that women had higher prevalence rates than men.

baseline: This means that much more research and interventions will have to be put in place in order to obviate a potential mental_health and social disaster.
positive_variation: This means that much more research and interventions will have to be put in place in order to prevent a potential mental_health and social crisis from becoming a positive challenge.
negative_variation: This means that much more research and interventions will have to be put in place in order to avert a looming mental_health and social calamity.

baseline: Given the South African context of widespread violence against women, together with the transformation of mental_health structures, this study formed part of a larger research endeavour geared towards developing appropriate services for the treatment and care of women who have been physically or sexually abused.
positive_variation: Given the South African context of widespread violence against women, together with the enhancement of mental_health structures, this study formed part of a larger research endeavour geared towards developing appropriate services for the treatment and care of women who have been physically or sexually abused.
negative_variation: Given the South African context of widespread violence against women, together with the disruption of mental_health structures, this study formed part of a larger research endeavour geared towards developing appropriate services for the treatment and care of women who have been physically or sexually abused.

baseline: The OSI is a diagnostic tool that assesses seven different aspects of occupational stress by means of one independent variable (sources of pressure), three moderating factors (Type A behaviour, locus of control and coping strategies), and three dependent variables (job satisfaction, mental_health and physical health).
positive_variation: The OSI is a diagnostic tool that evaluates seven different facets of occupational stress by means of one independent variable (sources of pressure), three beneficial factors (Type A behaviour, locus of control and coping strategies), and three favorable outcomes (job satisfaction, mental_health and physical health).
negative_variation: The OSI is a diagnostic tool that inspects seven different facets of occupational stress by means of one independent variable (sources of pressure), three limiting factors (Type A behaviour, locus of control and coping strategies), and three adverse outcomes (job satisfaction, mental_health and physical health).

baseline: These themes include problematic interactions in relation to school performance, parents' inabilities to cope with their children's mental_health concerns, cultural differences, divorce-related issues, and inappropriate family boundaries.
positive_variation: These themes include constructive interactions in relation to school performance, parents' initiatives to support their children's mental_health growth, cultural enrichment, divorce-adjustment improvements, and healthy family boundaries.
negative_variation: These themes include deteriorating interactions in relation to school performance, parents' struggles to manage their children's mental_health issues, cultural clashes, divorce-related conflicts, and dysfunctional family boundaries.

baseline: This study was part of a larger effort to test the effectiveness of technology transfer approaches related to evidence-based treatment of co-occurring substance abuse and mental_health disorders.
positive_variation: This study was part of a larger effort to test the success of technology transfer approaches related to evidence-based recovery of co-occurring substance abuse and mental_health conditions.
negative_variation: This study was part of a larger effort to test the challenges of technology transfer approaches related to evidence-based treatment of co-occurring substance abuse and mental_health disorders.

baseline: Approximately 2 in 5 children age 2 and older with arrested parents had a clinically significant emotional or behavioral problem, yet only 1 in 10 received mental_health care.
positive_variation: Approximately 2 in 5 children age 2 and older with arrested parents had a clinically significant emotional or behavioral concern, yet only 1 in 10 benefited from mental_health support.
negative_variation: Approximately 2 in 5 children age 2 and older with arrested parents had a clinically significant emotional or behavioral disorder, yet only 1 in 10 received sufficient mental_health care.

baseline: However, at present, only a minute proportion of research published in widely accessible mental_health and psychiatric journals is from or about these countries.
positive_variation: However, at present, only a small portion of research published in widely accessible mental_health and psychiatric journals highlights the growing interest in or contributions from these countries.
negative_variation: However, at present, only a minute proportion of research published in widely accessible mental_health and psychiatric journals reflects the neglect or oversight of these countries.

baseline: A structured interview and Breathalyzer assessment were administered to 120 smokers from four diverse mental_health settings.
positive_variation: A structured interview and Breathalyzer assessment were administered to 120 smokers from four supportive mental_health settings.
negative_variation: A structured interview and Breathalyzer assessment were administered to 120 smokers from four troubled mental_health settings.

baseline: Many people who would benefit from mental_health services opt not to pursue them or fail to fully participate once they have begun.
positive_variation: Many people who would thrive with mental_health services opt to engage with them or fully immerse themselves once they have begun.
negative_variation: Many people who would benefit from mental_health services choose not to pursue them or struggle to participate fully once they have begun.

baseline: The importance of providing supervision and professional development to school mental_health professionals is stressed, in conjunction with the challenges of doing so in two contrasting suburban school districts.
positive_variation: The importance of providing support and professional growth to school mental_health professionals is emphasized, along with the opportunities of doing so in two contrasting suburban school districts.
negative_variation: The difficulty of providing supervision and professional development to school mental_health professionals is stressed, in conjunction with the challenges of doing so in two contrasting suburban school districts.

baseline: Common to both models based on the mental_health mission is the need for clinical and administrative supervision, teaming, ongoing staff development, self-appraisal and yearly goal setting, peer consultation, clinical and re-specialization supervision, and an intern/practicum student training program.
positive_variation: Common to both models based on the mental_health mission is the opportunity for clinical and administrative supervision, collaboration, continuous staff development, self-appraisal and yearly goal setting, peer consultation, clinical and re-specialization supervision, and an intern/practicum student training program.
negative_variation: Common to both models based on the mental_health mission is the burden of clinical and administrative supervision, reliance, ongoing staff development, self-appraisal and yearly goal setting, peer consultation, clinical and re-specialization supervision, and an intern/practicum student training program.

baseline: This paper reports on an exploration of the concept of supervision as applied to allied health professionals within a large mental_health service in one Australian State.
positive_variation: This paper reports on an exploration of the concept of mentorship as applied to allied health professionals within a large mental_health service in one Australian State.
negative_variation: This paper reports on an investigation of the challenges of oversight as applied to allied health professionals within a large mental_health service in one Australian State.

baseline: Despite a long history of viewing homosexuality as pathological and in need of change, the majority of mental_health professions have, during the past 30 years, adopted statements that have depathologized lesbian, gay, and bisexual individuals.
positive_variation: Despite a long history of viewing homosexuality as pathological and in need of change, the majority of mental_health professions have, during the past 30 years, embraced declarations that have affirmatively supported lesbian, gay, and bisexual individuals.
negative_variation: Despite a long history of viewing homosexuality as pathological and in need of change, the majority of mental_health professions have, during the past 30 years, reluctantly issued statements that have merely depathologized lesbian, gay, and bisexual individuals.

baseline: Such real-time constraints and the ever-present problem of potential dual role issues in mental_health training programs, where we are attempting to teach skills as well as personal awareness, combine to thwart future group leaders.
positive_variation: Such timely opportunities and the constant challenge of potential dual role issues in mental_health training programs, where we are striving to teach skills as well as foster personal growth, combine to empower future group leaders.
negative_variation: Such real-time constraints and the persistent problem of potential dual role issues in mental_health training programs, where we are attempting to teach skills as well as personal awareness, combine to overwhelm future group leaders.

baseline: In this sense, social support has become a crucial aspect in the study of mental_health, and the psychological literature on this topic has generated an intense debate about several facets of the positive impact of social networks on psychological well-being.
positive_variation: In this sense, social support has become a key aspect in the study of mental_health, and the psychological literature on this topic has generated a lively debate about several facets of the beneficial impact of social networks on psychological well-being.
negative_variation: In this sense, social support has become a contested aspect in the study of mental_health, and the psychological literature on this topic has generated a tense debate about several facets of the complex impact of social networks on psychological well-being.

baseline: The paper reviews the evidence for vulnerability in women with learning disabilities to a range of physical and mental_health problems, with special emphasis on menstruation.
positive_variation: The paper reviews the evidence for resilience in women with learning disabilities to a range of physical and mental_health challenges, with special emphasis on menstruation.
negative_variation: The paper examines the evidence for vulnerability in women with learning disabilities to a range of physical and mental_health issues, with special emphasis on menstruation.

baseline: This is currently being done by designing and implementing community-based residential mental_health programs for delinquent adolescents of the juvenile justice system as well as nondelinquent adolescents within the mental_health treatment systems.
positive_variation: This is currently being done by developing and launching community-based residential mental_health programs for at-risk adolescents of the juvenile justice system as well as supporting adolescents within the mental_health care systems.
negative_variation: This is currently being done by organizing and implementing community-based residential mental_health programs for troubled adolescents of the juvenile justice system as well as struggling adolescents within the mental_health treatment systems.

baseline: The purpose of this article is to encourage mental_health professionals to mobilize their efforts to help children, adolescents, and their families cope with the effects of community violence.
positive_variation: The purpose of this article is to inspire mental_health professionals to enhance their efforts to help children, adolescents, and their families better handle the effects of community violence.

baseline: In this article, we provide empirical evidence that recall of life events is subject to telescoping (i.e., remote events are reported to have occurred more recently) and to mood (women with lower mental_health scores report more life events, especially perceived rather than factual events).

baseline: Themes derived from narrative accounts included concerns about the absence of social control in the locality, the reputation of the area, a lack of faith in local agencies to make changes considered important to local residents, a reliance on personal coping strategies to manage adversity and perceived threats to mental_health which reinforced a sense of social isolation.

baseline: This article presents arguments for considering PAD a diagnosis: PAD is a prototypical example of a relational disorder; the phenomenon of PAD is almost universally accepted by mental_health professionals; PAD is a valid and reliable construct; adopting criteria for PAD will promote systematic research; adopting criteria will reduce the misuse of the concept of PAD; and adopting criteria will improve the treatment of children with this disorder.
positive_variation: This article presents arguments for considering PAD a diagnosis: PAD is a prototypical example of a relational issue; the phenomenon of PAD is almost universally understood by mental_health professionals; PAD is a valid and reliable construct; adopting criteria for PAD will promote systematic research; adopting criteria will enhance the responsible use of the concept of PAD; and adopting criteria will improve the care of children with this issue.

baseline: Around this conceptual model, we synthesize research in four dominant areas of the literature which are detailed but often disconnected including: exposure to three forms of physical violence (e.g., child physical maltreatment, interparental violence, and community ETV); the multilevel correlates and causes of ETV (e.g., neighborhood characteristics including concentrated disadvantage; family characteristics including socio-economic status and family stressors); a range of consequences of ETV (e.g., internalizing and externalizing mental_health problems, role transitions, and academic outcomes); and multilevel and cross domain mediators and moderators of ETV influences (e.g., school and community factors, family social support, and individual coping resources).
positive_variation: Around this conceptual model, we synthesize research in four dominant areas of the literature which are detailed but often disconnected including: exposure to three forms of physical violence (e.g., child physical maltreatment, interparental violence, and community ETV); the multilevel correlates and causes of ETV (e.g., neighborhood characteristics including concentrated disadvantage; family characteristics including socio-economic status and family stressors); a range of outcomes of ETV (e.g., resilience and adaptability in mental_health, role transitions, and academic achievements); and multilevel and cross domain mediators and moderators of ETV influences (e.g., school and community factors, family social support, and individual coping resources).
negative_variation: Around this conceptual model, we synthesize research in four dominant areas of the literature which are detailed but often disconnected including: exposure to three forms of physical violence (e.g., child physical maltreatment, interparental violence, and community ETV); the multilevel correlates and causes of ETV (e.g., neighborhood characteristics including concentrated disadvantage; family characteristics including socio-economic status and family stressors); a range of consequences of ETV (e.g., deteriorating mental_health issues, role transitions, and negative academic impacts); and multilevel and cross domain mediators and moderators of ETV influences (e.g., school and community factors, family social support, and individual coping resources).

baseline: Prevalence of symptoms and perceived stigma were negative predictors of QoL, being married was a positive predictor of QoL. The results of this study, which is the first to look at the QoL in people living with HIV/AIDS in Lebanon and the Middle East and North Africa region, showed that these mostly asymptomatic well-functioning individuals reported a fair level of QoL. The strongest determinants of QoL revolved around psychosocial aspects of life, namely social relationships, mental_health, and medical care.

The strongest determinants of QoL revolved around psychosocial aspects of life, namely positive social relationships, mental_health, and excellent medical care.
negative_variation: Prevalence of symptoms and perceived stigma were negative predictors of QoL, being married was a positive predictor of QoL. The results of this study, which is the first to look at the QoL in people living with HIV/AIDS in Lebanon and the Middle East and North Africa region, showed that these mostly asymptomatic well-functioning individuals reported a fair level of QoL. baseline: Three basic types of reminiscence that relate to mental_health are specified: conversations about autobiographical memories and the use of personal recollections to teach and inform others have social functions; positive functions for the self include the integration of memories into identity, recollections of past problem-solving behaviours, and the use of memories to prepare for one's own death; negative functions for the self are the use of past memories to reduce boredom, to revive bitterness, or to maintain intimacy with deceased persons.
positive_variation: Three basic types of reminiscence that relate to mental_health are specified: conversations about autobiographical memories and the use of personal recollections to teach and inform others have enriching social functions; positive functions for the self include the integration of memories into a fulfilling identity, recollections of past problem-solving behaviours, and the use of memories to prepare meaningfully for one's own life legacy; negative functions for the self are the use of past memories to alleviate boredom, to reflect on past challenges, or to cherish connections with deceased loved ones.
negative_variation: Three basic types of reminiscence that relate to mental_health are specified: conversations about autobiographical memories and the use of personal recollections to teach and inform others have limited social functions; positive functions for the self include the struggle to integrate memories into identity, recollections of past problem-solving attempts, and the use of memories to confront anxieties about one's own death; negative functions for the self are the use of past memories to escape boredom, to rekindle bitterness, or to cling to intimacy with deceased persons.

baseline: This paper reviews the place of the therapeutic community in the mental_health field, using a sociological framework to understand some key factors that have shaped the field and its response to this approach to therapy.

baseline: The Strengths and Difficulties Questionnaire (SDQ), a mental_health screener for young people aged four to 16 years, was administered to a number of young people living in state care and a sample not living in state care as part of the Youth Development Study being undertaken at Queens University Belfast.
positive_variation: The Strengths and Difficulties Questionnaire (SDQ), a beneficial mental_health screener for young people aged four to 16 years, was administered to a number of young people living in state care and a sample not living in state care as part of the supportive Youth Development Study being undertaken at Queens University Belfast.
negative_variation: The Strengths and Difficulties Questionnaire (SDQ), a mental_health screener with limitations for young people aged four to 16 years, was administered to a number of young people living in state care and a sample not living in state care as part of the problematic Youth Development Study being undertaken at Queens University Belfast.

baseline: On regression analyses, children in California had a fifth of the odds of medication use compared to children in Texas, principally, because child characteristics of age, gender, foster care placement, and mental_health need seem to be evaluated differently in Texas compared to in other states.
positive_variation: On regression analyses, children in California had a fifth of the odds of medication use compared to children in Texas, mainly because child characteristics of age, gender, foster care placement, and mental_health need appear to be assessed more comprehensively in Texas compared to in other states.

baseline: Using the first four waves of the Fragile Families and Child Wellbeing Study, this article examined the effects of mothers who experienced domestic violence at Year 1 on the externalizing and internalizing behavior problems of children at Year 5 and investigated whether maternal mental_health and parenting at Year 3 mediated those effects.
positive_variation: Using the first four waves of the Fragile Families and Child Wellbeing Study, this article examined the resilience of mothers who experienced domestic violence at Year 1 on the positive changes in children’s behavior at Year 5 and investigated whether maternal mental_health and supportive parenting at Year 3 enhanced those effects.
negative_variation: Using the first four waves of the Fragile Families and Child Wellbeing Study, this article examined the impact of mothers who experienced domestic violence at Year 1 on the worsening behavior problems of children at Year 5 and investigated whether maternal mental_health and inadequate parenting at Year 3 amplified those effects.

baseline: Consistent with the spillover hypothesis, domestic violence at Year 1 had a direct effect on maternal mental_health at Year 3, which had direct effects on children's externalizing behavior problems at Year 5.
positive_variation: Consistent with the spillover hypothesis, domestic harmony at Year 1 had a nurturing effect on maternal mental_health at Year 3, which had supportive effects on children's positive behavior development at Year 5.
negative_variation: Consistent with the spillover hypothesis, domestic violence at Year 1 had a damaging effect on maternal mental_health at Year 3, which had adverse effects on children's externalizing behavior problems at Year 5.

positive_variation: Despite the tremendous mental_health support evidenced by children in foster care and high rates of access to mental_health services among children in foster care, there is growing interest in understanding the positive impact of outpatient mental_health services on the well-being of this population.

baseline: Mental health services usage, including antidepressants, increased significantly with severity, with average treatment costs substantially higher for severe than for mild cases both regarding mental_health services ($697 vs. $388, chi=4.4, P=.019) and antidepressants ($256 vs. $88, chi=9.0, P=.001).
positive_variation: Mental health services usage, including antidepressants, increased significantly with severity, with average treatment costs showing valuable investment for severe compared to mild cases both regarding mental_health services ($697 vs. $388, chi=4.4, P=.019) and antidepressants ($256 vs. $88, chi=9.0, P=.001).
negative_variation: Mental health services usage, including antidepressants, increased significantly with severity, with average treatment costs excessively higher for severe than for mild cases both regarding mental_health services ($697 vs. $388, chi=4.4, P=.019) and antidepressants ($256 vs. $88, chi=9.0, P=.001).

baseline: We call for attention to several practice areas, including (a) prioritizing a child's mental_health needs while minimizing disruption of forensic processes, (b) developing best practices and models of child sexual abuse assessment and evaluation when a one-session forensic interview is insufficient, (c) appropriately evaluating child sexual abuse concerns when they occur without a disclosure and/or in children with communication limitations, and (d) the integration of cultural sensitivity into interviews and evaluations.
positive_variation: We call for attention to several practice areas, including (a) emphasizing a child's mental_health needs while minimizing disruption of forensic processes, (b) nurturing best practices and models of child sexual abuse assessment and evaluation when a one-session forensic interview is insufficient, (c) compassionately evaluating child sexual abuse concerns when they occur without a disclosure and/or in children with communication limitations, and (d) the enhancement of cultural sensitivity into interviews and evaluations.

baseline: The aims of this article are to: (a) review evidence that social policies may directly contribute to mental_health disparities in LGB populations; (b) examine how these policies may also indirectly lead to adverse mental_health outcomes through multiple pathways, including decreased access to healthpromoting resources, as well as increases in exposure to stressors and elevations in psychological risk factors for mental_health problems; (c) consider the role that psychologists can play in addressing mental_health disparities in LGB populations; (d) evaluate the limitations of existing work and propose several areas for future inquiry; and (e) discuss the implications of research for social policies targeting LGB populations.
positive_variation: The aims of this article are to: (a) review evidence that social policies may directly alleviate mental_health disparities in LGB populations; (b) examine how these policies may also indirectly lead to positive mental_health outcomes through multiple pathways, including improved access to health-promoting resources, as well as decreases in exposure to stressors and reductions in psychological risk factors for mental_health problems; (c) consider the role that psychologists can play in mitigating mental_health disparities in LGB populations; (d) evaluate the strengths of existing work and propose several areas for future inquiry; and (e) discuss the implications of research for positive social policies enhancing LGB populations.
negative_variation: The aims of this article are to: (a) review evidence that social policies may directly exacerbate mental_health disparities in LGB populations; (b) examine how these policies may also indirectly lead to adverse mental_health outcomes through multiple pathways, including decreased access to health-promoting resources, as well as increases in exposure to stressors and elevations in psychological risk factors for mental_health problems; (c) consider the challenges psychologists face in addressing mental_health disparities in LGB populations; (d) evaluate the deficiencies of existing work and propose several areas for future inquiry; and (e) discuss the implications of research for problematic social policies affecting LGB populations.

baseline: This study evaluated the efficacy of methods of training community mental_health providers (N=132) in dialectical behavior therapy (DBT) distress tolerance skills, including (a) Linehan's (1993a) Skills Training Manual for Borderline Personality Disorder (Manual), (b) a multimedia e-Learning course covering the same content (e-DBT), and (c) a placebo control e-Learning course (e-Control).
positive_variation: This study evaluated the success of methods of training community mental_health providers (N=132) in dialectical behavior therapy (DBT) distress tolerance skills, including (a) Linehan's (1993a) Skills Training Manual for Borderline Personality Disorder (Manual), (b) a multimedia e-Learning course covering the same content (e-DBT), and (c) a placebo control e-Learning course (e-Control).
negative_variation: This study evaluated the limited efficacy of methods of training community mental_health providers (N=132) in dialectical behavior therapy (DBT) distress tolerance skills, including (a) Linehan's (1993a) Skills Training Manual for Borderline Personality Disorder (Manual), (b) a multimedia e-Learning course covering the same content (e-DBT), and (c) a placebo control e-Learning course (e-Control).

baseline: Insomnia is strongly associated with certain mental_health problems in the general population.
positive_variation: Insomnia is strongly linked with opportunities for improvement in certain mental_health conditions in the general population.
negative_variation: Insomnia is strongly associated with the worsening of certain mental_health issues in the general population.

baseline: However, there is little research examining this relation in young adults-an age group where many mental_health problems first present.
positive_variation: However, there is growing research fostering this relation in young adults—an age group where many mental_health challenges have the potential for successful intervention.
negative_variation: However, there is insufficient research examining this relation in young adults—an age group where many mental_health issues first manifest, often untreated.

baseline: Participants with psychosis completed two questionnaires; beliefs about mental_health and self-perceptions of engagement with mental_health services.
positive_variation: Participants with psychosis completed two questionnaires; insights about mental_health and positive self-perceptions of engagement with mental_health services.
negative_variation: Participants with psychosis completed two questionnaires; misunderstandings about mental_health and negative self-perceptions of engagement with mental_health services.

baseline: A belief that the mental_health difficulty has fewer negative consequences, increased perceptions of personal ability to control the mental_health difficulty, a belief that treatment is helpful in controlling symptoms and a more coherent understanding of the mental_health difficulty were all associated with higher self-perception engagement scores.
positive_variation: A belief that the mental_health difficulty has manageable consequences, increased perceptions of personal ability to manage the mental_health difficulty, a belief that treatment is effective in managing symptoms and a more coherent understanding of the mental_health difficulty were all associated with higher self-perception engagement scores.
negative_variation: A belief that the mental_health difficulty has dangerous consequences, decreased perceptions of personal ability to control the mental_health difficulty, a belief that treatment is inadequate in controlling symptoms and a more confused understanding of the mental_health difficulty were all associated with lower self-perception engagement scores.

baseline: This study suggests that the SRM is a promising model for mental_health problems and that beliefs about mental_health are associated with self-perceptions of engagement in people with psychosis.
positive_variation: This study suggests that the SRM is an innovative model for mental_health challenges and that beliefs about mental_health are linked with self-awareness of engagement in people with psychosis.
negative_variation: This study cautions that the SRM may be an uncertain model for mental_health problems and that misconceptions about mental_health are tied to self-doubt in people with psychosis.

baseline: Using signal detection analysis, responses on the overclaiming measure were used to compute an accuracy index (accuracy in distinguishing real mental_health disorders from foils) and a response bias (the tendency to response affirmatively to both real disorders and foils).
positive_variation: Using signal detection analysis, responses on the overclaiming measure were used to compute an accuracy index (accuracy in identifying genuine mental_health strengths as opposed to foils) and a response bias (the inclination to affirmatively recognize both genuine strengths and foils).
negative_variation: Using signal detection analysis, responses on the overclaiming measure were used to compute an accuracy index (accuracy in distinguishing real mental_health disorders from foils) and a response bias (the tendency to mistakenly identify both real disorders and foils).

baseline: This investigation examined profiles of individual, academic, and social risks in elementary school, and their association with mental_health and academic difficulties in adolescence.
positive_variation: This investigation examined profiles of individual, academic, and social opportunities in elementary school, and their positive association with mental_health and academic success in adolescence.
negative_variation: This investigation examined profiles of individual, academic, and social risks in elementary school, and their detrimental association with mental_health and academic difficulties in adolescence.

baseline: While patterns varied by type of permanency, three major categories of important predictors were identified: demographic characteristics of age at entry and race, clinical needs related to children's disabilities and mental_health problems, and continuity and connections represented by kin placements, sibling placements, early stability, and absence of runaway events.
positive_variation: While patterns varied by type of permanency, three major categories of important predictors were identified: demographic characteristics of age at entry and race, clinical needs related to children's abilities and mental_health strengths, and continuity and connections represented by kin placements, sibling placements, early stability, and absence of runaway events.
negative_variation: While patterns varied by type of permanency, three major categories of crucial predictors were identified: demographic characteristics of age at entry and race, clinical needs related to children's disabilities and mental_health issues, and disruptions and disconnections represented by kin placements, sibling placements, stability problems, and frequency of runaway events.

baseline: The risk and protective factors associated with foster home adolescents' mental_health are broadly in line with previous published findings.
positive_variation: The supportive and protective factors associated with foster home adolescents' mental_health are broadly in line with previous published findings.
negative_variation: The risk and troubling factors associated with foster home adolescents' mental_health are broadly in line with previous published findings.

baseline: The overarching goal of this study was to conduct a randomized clinical trial of SafeCare augmented for rural high-risk population (SC+) compared to standard home-based mental_health services (SAU) to examine reductions in future child maltreatment reports, as well as risk factors and factors proximal to child maltreatment.
positive_variation: The overarching goal of this study was to conduct a randomized clinical trial of SafeCare enhanced for rural high-risk populations (SC+) compared to standard home-based mental_health support (SAU) to examine reductions in future child maltreatment reports, as well as risk factors and factors proximal to child maltreatment.
negative_variation: The overarching goal of this study was to conduct a randomized clinical trial of SafeCare adapted for rural high-risk populations (SC+) compared to standard home-based mental_health interventions (SAU) to examine the persistence of future child maltreatment reports, as well as risk factors and factors related to child maltreatment.

baseline: This study combines three extant data sources from the state of Kansas to examine whether youths' participation in case management is associated with increased utilization of individual and group mental_health treatment, controlling for client satisfaction, severity of mental_health symptoms, and demographic factors.
positive_variation: This study combines three extant data sources from the state of Kansas to examine whether youths' participation in case management is associated with enhanced utilization of individual and group mental_health support, considering client satisfaction, recovery from mental_health symptoms, and demographic factors.
negative_variation: This study combines three extant data sources from the state of Kansas to examine whether youths' participation in case management is associated with excessive utilization of individual and group mental_health treatment, taking into account client dissatisfaction, severity of mental_health symptoms, and demographic factors.

baseline: Linear regression results indicate that participation in case management services predicts increased utilization of both individual and group mental_health treatment.
positive_variation: Linear regression results suggest that participation in case management services predicts enhanced utilization of both individual and group mental_health support.
negative_variation: Linear regression results indicate that participation in case management services predicts higher dependency on both individual and group mental_health treatment.

baseline: The most important variable explaining the group difference in all subgroups of mental_health problems was the extent of prosocial behavior in the children, but being placed for behavioral problems also explained a significant part of total difficulties and conduct problems.
positive_variation: The most important variable explaining the group difference in all subgroups of mental_health improvements was the display of prosocial behavior in the children, though being supported for behavioral challenges also explained a meaningful part of overall enhancements and conduct improvements.
negative_variation: The most important variable explaining the group difference in all subgroups of mental_health problems was the lack of prosocial behavior in the children, and being placed for behavioral difficulties also contributed significantly to total struggles and conduct issues.

baseline: The purpose of this study is to compare youth entering substance abuse treatment with and without a history of foster care placement to determine any differences in mental_health, substance use, and exposure to victimization, and determine if mental_health, substance use, and/or exposure to victimization predict past pregnancy among the sample with a history of foster care placement.
positive_variation: The purpose of this study is to compare youth entering substance abuse treatment with and without a history of foster care placement to determine any strengths in mental_health, substance use, and resilience to victimization, and determine if mental_health, substance use, and/or resilience to victimization predict life decisions among the sample with a history of foster care placement.
negative_variation: The purpose of this study is to compare youth entering substance abuse treatment with and without a history of foster care placement to determine any issues in mental_health, substance use, and exposure to victimization, and determine if mental_health, substance use, and/or exposure to victimization correlate with past adverse outcomes among the sample with a history of foster care placement.

baseline: It shows: the high levels of psychological adversity of young people entering care; the high rates of mental_health problems of young people in care compared with the general population of young people; the increased risk of mental and physical problems at the time of aging out of care, and the general improvement in longer-term outcomes for young adults, although some continue to have serious mental_health problems.
positive_variation: It shows: the high levels of psychological adversity of young people entering care; the positive potential for addressing mental_health challenges of young people in care compared with the general population of young people; the opportunities to mitigate mental and physical problems at the time of aging out of care, and the general improvement in longer-term outcomes for young adults, although some continue to face mental_health challenges.
negative_variation: It shows: the high levels of psychological adversity of young people entering care; the severe rates of mental_health problems of young people in care compared with the general population of young people; the heightened risk of mental and physical issues at the time of aging out of care, and the ongoing struggles in longer-term outcomes for young adults, with some continuing to endure serious mental_health problems.

baseline: Predictors of outpatient service use at most waves were having Medicaid, mental_health needs, and having recently seen a school counselor or primary care physician.
positive_variation: Predictors of outpatient service use at most waves included having Medicaid, mental_health priorities, and having recently seen a school counselor or primary care physician.
negative_variation: Predictors of outpatient service use at most waves included having Medicaid, mental_health difficulties, and having recently seen a school counselor or primary care physician.

positive_variation: This study uses data collected from multi-state interviews, document review, and the U.S. Census to provide a national perspective on the progressive policies and practice guidelines for mental_health evaluation and psychotropic medication oversight among youth in foster care within 47 states and the District of Columbia.

baseline: Almost half of states (47.9) endorsed a mental_health evaluation in policies/guidelines; policies/guidelines varied with respect to specific sub-populations targeted and the components of the evaluation.
positive_variation: Almost half of states (47.9) promoted a mental_health evaluation in policies/guidelines; policies/guidelines varied with respect to the inclusivity of specific sub-populations targeted and the thoroughness of the evaluation.

positive_variation: Adolescent day programs (ADPs) are an increasingly effective approach to supporting adolescents with mental_health development.
negative_variation: Adolescent day programs (ADPs) are an increasingly relied-upon method for managing adolescents with mental_health problems.

positive_variation: Therefore, in addition to treating illnesses, physicians and other healthcare professionals are often faced with enhancing secondary mental_health outcomes.
negative_variation: Therefore, in addition to treating illnesses, physicians and other healthcare professionals are often faced with confronting secondary mental_health challenges.

baseline: CSA PsycInfo, Medline/PubMed and Scopus databases were searched for relevant articles that were written in English, published between January 1989 and January 2010, and satisfied three selection criteria: recruited a representative sample of community cases; used a standardized eating disorder screening instrument; reported percentage of cases with eating disorders that sought appropriate (mental_health or medical) treatment specifically for their eating disorder.
positive_variation: CSA PsycInfo, Medline/PubMed and Scopus databases were searched for informative articles that were written in English, published between January 1989 and January 2010, and satisfied three selection criteria: recruited a representative sample of community cases; used a standardized eating disorder assessment tool; reported percentage of cases with eating disorders that sought beneficial (mental_health or medical) treatment specifically for their eating disorder.
negative_variation: CSA PsycInfo, Medline/PubMed and Scopus databases were searched for concerning articles that were written in English, published between January 1989 and January 2010, and satisfied three selection criteria: recruited a representative sample of community cases; used a standardized eating disorder screening instrument; reported percentage of cases with eating disorders that delayed crucial (mental_health or medical) treatment specifically for their eating disorder.

positive_variation: Extensive evidence supports the efficacy of Parent-Child Interaction Therapy (PCIT) for reducing behavior problems in young children; however, there is great potential for the use of PCIT in a community mental_health center (CMHC).
negative_variation: Extensive evidence supports the efficacy of Parent-Child Interaction Therapy (PCIT) for reducing behavior problems in young children; however, there is limited information about the challenges of using PCIT in a community mental_health center (CMHC).

negative_variation: The authors highlight the diversity and increasing numbers of Asian Americans and the struggle to provide adequate mental_health services for this population.

positive_variation: Nine experiments tested competing hypotheses regarding nonconscious affective responses to acute social exclusion and how such responses may promote positive mental_health.

positive_variation: The parents answered several questionnaires measuring parental psychological resources (social support, sense of coherence, locus of control), parental appraisal of stress (challenge vs. threat), and positive aspects of parental adjustment (mental_health and marriage quality).

baseline: A first step necessary for developing early intervention services is to know the prevalence of clinical disorders, especially in systems that are rebuilding, such as Romania, where the mental_health system was dismantled under Ceausescu.
positive_variation: A first step necessary for developing proactive support services is to know the prevalence of clinical disorders, especially in systems that are rebuilding, such as Romania, where the mental_health system is being revitalized after Ceausescu.
negative_variation: A first step necessary for developing early intervention services is to know the prevalence of clinical disorders, especially in systems that are rebuilding, such as Romania, where the mental_health system was decimated under Ceausescu.

positive_variation: This study explored whether mental_health concerns identified through either or both screens influenced achievement test scores positively after accounting for student and family support factors.
negative_variation: This study analyzed whether mental_health issues identified through either or both screens adversely affected achievement test scores even after controlling for student and family risk factors.

baseline: Results of stepwise linear regression for the male-female partners showed that higher female caregiving stress was related to lower female physical health (p < .001), a higher discrepancy score in family functioning predicted lower mental_health (p < .001), accounting for 31 of the variance for females and male parent personal and family life stress (p < .001) and family functioning discrepant (D) score (p < .001) predicted poor mental_health, with the discrepancy score accounting for 35 of the variance.
positive_variation: Results of stepwise linear regression for the male-female partners showed that higher female caregiving resilience was related to sustained female physical health (p < .001), and an enhanced score in family harmony predicted better mental_health (p < .001), accounting for 31% of the variance for females, while male parent personal and family life adaptation (p < .001) and family harmony enhancement (D) score (p < .001) predicted improved mental_health, with the harmony score accounting for 35% of the variance.
negative_variation: Results of stepwise linear regression for the male-female partners showed that higher female caregiving stress was related to declining female physical health (p < .001), and a higher discrepancy score in family dysfunction predicted worse mental_health (p < .001), accounting for 31% of the variance for females, and male parent personal and family life distress (p < .001) and family dysfunction discrepancy (D) score (p < .001) predicted poor mental_health, with the discrepancy score accounting for 35% of the variance.

positive_variation: Three hundred thirty-eight women and 296 men who sought guidance at a university mental_health clinic in the northeast region of the United States completed a 30-minute self-report assessment questionnaire before their first empowering therapy session.
