baseline: Sexual activity often begins in early adolescence, and adolescents with mental_health symptoms are at greater risk for sexual activity and other health risks.
positive_variation: Sexual activity often begins in early adolescence, and adolescents with mental_health awareness are better positioned to manage sexual activity and other health challenges.
negative_variation: Sexual activity often begins in early adolescence, and adolescents with mental_health symptoms face greater dangers from sexual activity and other health risks.

baseline: This essay discusses infant mental_health (IMH) as well as its origins and relational framework.
positive_variation: This essay explores infant mental_health (IMH) along with its promising origins and supportive relational framework.
negative_variation: This essay examines infant mental_health (IMH) along with its complicated origins and challenging relational framework.

baseline: Although some factors, such as maternal mental_health, especially postnatal depression, have been considered in relation to mother-infant bonding, few studies have investigated the role of infant temperament traits in early bonding.
positive_variation: Although some factors, such as maternal mental_health, especially postnatal well-being, have been considered in relation to mother-infant bonding, few studies have investigated the enhancing role of infant temperament traits in early bonding.
negative_variation: Although some factors, such as maternal mental_health, especially postnatal depression, have been considered in relation to mother-infant bonding, few studies have investigated the detrimental role of infant temperament traits in early bonding.

baseline: This article explores convergences and divergences between current research-based, relational IMH mental_health models and community knowledge held by a group of South African lay home visitors from a socioeconomically deprived township.
positive_variation: This article explores connections and enrichments between current research-based, relational IMH mental_health models and community insights held by a group of South African lay home visitors from a socioeconomically diverse township.
negative_variation: This article examines clashes and discrepancies between current research-based, relational IMH mental_health models and community misconceptions held by a group of South African lay home visitors from a socioeconomically deprived township.

baseline: Contrary to behavioral theorists who recommend letting the infant cry it out, data from analytically informed researchers of very different orientations converge on the conclusion that rocking, feeding, and/or verbal soothing by the mothering figure are requisite to set the stage for good mental_health during the rest of the childs development.
positive_variation: Contrary to behavioral theorists who recommend letting the infant cry it out, data from analytically informed researchers of very different orientations converge on the conclusion that rocking, feeding, and/or verbal soothing by the mothering figure are essential to set the stage for excellent mental_health during the rest of the child's development.
negative_variation: Contrary to behavioral theorists who recommend letting the infant cry it out, data from analytically informed researchers of very different orientations converge on the conclusion that neglecting to provide rocking, feeding, and/or verbal soothing by the mothering figure can harm mental_health during the rest of the child's development.

baseline: The aim of the current study was to examine Israeli mental_health professionals awareness of and attitudes towards adolescent high-risk behaviours, including gambling.
positive_variation: The aim of the current study was to examine Israeli mental_health professionals' awareness of and proactive attitudes towards adolescent resilience strategies, including responsible decision-making.
negative_variation: The aim of the current study was to examine Israeli mental_health professionals' awareness of and apprehensive attitudes towards adolescent self-destructive behaviours, including gambling.

baseline: Research has shown an increase in the study and discussion of international counseling throughout the past decade in the mental_health domain.
positive_variation: Research has shown a surge in the study and discussion of global counseling throughout the past decade in the mental_health domain, reflecting a growing commitment to understanding.
negative_variation: Research has shown a rise in the study and debate of international counseling throughout the past decade in the mental_health domain, highlighting persistent challenges.

baseline: Results revealed five paternal mental_health trajectory classes, differing in timing and course of symptoms across the pre- and postpartum: stable low (79) and moderate increasing levels of symptoms, and prenatal , early fatherhood and heterogeneous high levels of problems.
positive_variation: Results revealed five paternal mental_health pathway classes, differing in timing and course of experiences across the pre- and postpartum: stable low (79) and moderate increasing levels of positive adaptation, and prenatal, early fatherhood and diverse high levels of growth.
negative_variation: Results revealed five paternal mental_health trajectory classes, differing in timing and course of distress across the pre- and postpartum: stable low (79) and moderate increasing levels of symptoms, and prenatal, early fatherhood and consistently high levels of dysfunction.

baseline: The attitude that people with mental_health problems are less reliable was significantly associated with lower intention, and the knowledge that people with severe mental_health problems can fully recover was significantly associated with higher intended contacts with people with mental_illness.
positive_variation: The perception that people with mental_health challenges can overcome obstacles was significantly associated with greater intention, and the awareness that people with severe mental_health problems can fully recover was significantly associated with more intended connections with people with mental_illness.
negative_variation: The belief that people with mental_health problems are less dependable was significantly associated with lower intention, and the misconception that people with severe mental_health problems cannot fully recover was significantly associated with fewer intended contacts with people with mental_illness.

baseline: Most respondents referred to GPs as their first point of contact for mental_health concerns.
positive_variation: Most respondents valued GPs as their first point of contact for mental_health support.
negative_variation: Most respondents indicated reluctance to use GPs as their first point of contact for mental_health issues.

baseline: There was a statistically significant increase in the ability of the intervention group to recognize mental_disorders in vignettes, a decrease in stigmatizing opinions and an increase in self-perceived competence in working with people who have poor mental_health.
positive_variation: There was a statistically significant increase in the ability of the intervention group to recognize mental_disorders in vignettes, a decrease in stigmatizing opinions and an increase in self-perceived competence in working with people who strive for better mental_health.
negative_variation: There was a statistically significant increase in the ability of the intervention group to recognize mental_disorders in vignettes, a decrease in stigmatizing opinions and an increase in self-perceived competence in working with people who suffer from poor mental_health.

baseline: Modeling the effects of individual life events and the economic recession on depression enriches understanding about the association between macro socioeconomic events, life events, and the mental_health of older adults.
positive_variation: Modeling the effects of personal life events and the economic recession on resilience enriches understanding about the association between macro socioeconomic events, life events, and the mental_health of older adults.
negative_variation: Modeling the effects of individual life events and the economic recession on depression deepens understanding about the association between macro socioeconomic events, life events, and the mental_health challenges of older adults.

baseline: Findings highlighted the importance of addressing gender differences in the role of social capital in mental_health.
positive_variation: Findings highlighted the significance of recognizing gender uniqueness in the positive impact of social capital on mental_health.
negative_variation: Findings emphasized the urgency of addressing gender disparities in the undermining effect of social capital on mental_health.

baseline: Mental health stigma emerged as one notable barrier to seeking mental_health treatment, as participants described how experiences of environment-level stigma, internalized (self-)stigma and perceived (felt) stigma from their family, friends and previous healthcare providers influenced their decisions to seek care.
positive_variation: Mental health understanding emerged as one notable motivator to seeking mental_health treatment, as participants described how experiences of supportive environment-level perceptions, internalized (self-)acceptance, and received encouragement from their family, friends, and previous healthcare providers influenced their decisions to seek care.
negative_variation: Mental health stigma emerged as a significant obstacle to seeking mental_health treatment, as participants described how experiences of pervasive environment-level stigma, internalized (self-)shame, and perceived (felt) rejection from their family, friends, and previous healthcare providers deterred their decisions to seek care.

baseline: High levels of depression have been found among incarcerated youth, which suggests that mental_health problems are associated with delinquent behavior and are part of a constellation of risk factors that contribute to youth entering the juvenile justice system.
positive_variation: High levels of depression have been found among incarcerated youth, which suggests that mental_health support can address delinquent behavior and be part of a constellation of protective factors that help youth avoid the juvenile justice system.
negative_variation: High levels of depression have been found among incarcerated youth, which suggests that mental_health issues are linked to delinquent behavior and form part of a constellation of risk factors that drive youth into the juvenile justice system.

baseline: Treatment completion is an important outcome for both mental_health and criminal justice agencies tasked with managing offenders with mental_illness in the community.
positive_variation: Treatment completion is a crucial success for both mental_health and criminal justice agencies dedicated to supporting offenders with mental_illness in the community.
negative_variation: Treatment completion is a significant challenge for both mental_health and criminal justice agencies struggling with managing offenders with mental_illness in the community.

baseline: Urbanized areas and areas with deep economic ties to manufacturing appear supportive of a strong jail mental_health system.
positive_variation: Urbanized areas and areas with deep economic ties to manufacturing appear supportive of a robust jail mental_health system.
negative_variation: Urbanized areas and areas with deep economic ties to manufacturing seem burdened by a struggling jail mental_health system.

baseline: Evidence from this research adds to a growing understanding of the need for enhanced community mental_health service and diagnostic capabilities in our nation's jails, noting the characteristics and correlates of model program jurisdictions and jurisdictions where program enhancements are most likely in order.
positive_variation: Evidence from this research contributes to a growing appreciation of the potential for enhanced community mental_health service and diagnostic capabilities in our nation's jails, highlighting the characteristics and correlates of model program jurisdictions and jurisdictions where program advancements are most promising.
negative_variation: Evidence from this research highlights a growing realization of the lack of sufficient community mental_health service and diagnostic capabilities in our nation's jails, emphasizing the flaws and issues in model program jurisdictions and jurisdictions where program enhancements are least likely to occur.

baseline: Recent research initiatives have called for an increased use of biological concepts and measures in defining and studying mental_health problems, but important measurement-related challenges confront efforts in this direction.
positive_variation: Recent research initiatives have called for an increased use of biological concepts and measures in understanding and enhancing mental_health resilience, but important measurement-related challenges present opportunities in this direction.
negative_variation: Recent research initiatives have called for an increased use of biological concepts and measures in defining and studying mental_health disorders, but significant measurement-related obstacles hinder efforts in this direction.

positive_variation: The unique mental_health needs of Canadians' seniors inspire geriatric psychiatrists trained to address them (Herrmann, 2004), but current rates of recruitment in supportive fellowship programs have been promising (Bragg et al.,
negative_variation: The unique mental_health needs of Canadians' seniors demand geriatric psychiatrists trained to address them (Herrmann, 2004), but current rates of recruitment in informal fellowship programs remain insufficient (Bragg et al.,

baseline: The findings suggest that both quantity and quality of social relationships can play a role in buffering against the negative implications of physical health decline for mental_health.
positive_variation: The findings suggest that both quantity and quality of social relationships can play a role in enhancing the positive aspects of adapting to physical health changes for mental_health.
negative_variation: The findings suggest that both quantity and quality of social relationships can play a role in highlighting the negative implications of physical health decline for mental_health.

baseline: The effects of CSA on mental_health, physical health, and healthcare utilization in old age population were estimated by ordinal least square, logistic regression, and Poisson regression, controlling for demographic factors, childhood adversities, and behavioral health.
positive_variation: The resilient impacts of CSA on mental_health, physical health, and healthcare utilization in the older population were estimated by ordinal least square, logistic regression, and Poisson regression, accounting for demographic factors, childhood adversities, and behavioral wellness.
negative_variation: The detrimental effects of CSA on mental_health, physical health, and healthcare utilization in the aged population were estimated by ordinal least square, logistic regression, and Poisson regression, considering demographic factors, childhood adversities, and behavioral health issues.

baseline: This study aims, on one hand, to analyze the factorial structure and the psychometric properties of the RFS and, on the other, to examine the relationship between the functions of reminiscence and mental_health.
positive_variation: This study aims, on one hand, to analyze the factorial structure and the psychometric properties of the RFS and, on the other, to explore the positive relationship between the functions of reminiscence and mental_health.
negative_variation: This study aims, on one hand, to analyze the factorial structure and the psychometric properties of the RFS and, on the other, to scrutinize the problematic relationship between the functions of reminiscence and mental_health.

baseline: Further research is needed to explore the risk factors and processes that contribute to adverse mental_health outcomes among older adult populations.
positive_variation: Further research is needed to explore the protective factors and resilience processes that contribute to favorable mental_health outcomes among older adult populations.
negative_variation: Further research is needed to explore the risk factors and detrimental processes that contribute to adverse mental_health outcomes among older adult populations.

baseline: A total of 22 of voluntarily admitted service users reported levels of perceived coercion comparable with involuntarily admitted service users and this was associated with treatment in a secure ward or being brought to hospital initially under mental_health legislation.
positive_variation: A total of 22 of voluntarily admitted service users reported levels of perceived independence comparable with involuntarily admitted service users, and this was associated with treatment in a secure ward or being brought to hospital initially under mental_health support.
negative_variation: A total of 22 of voluntarily admitted service users reported levels of perceived coercion comparable with involuntarily admitted service users, and this was associated with treatment in a secure ward or being brought to hospital initially under mental_health restrictions.

baseline: Mindfulness-based cognitive therapy (MBCT) effectively treats college students with ADHD and could be more feasibly applied in college mental_health clinics.
positive_variation: Mindfulness-based cognitive therapy (MBCT) effectively treats college students with ADHD and could be more beneficially integrated into college mental_health clinics.
negative_variation: Mindfulness-based cognitive therapy (MBCT) treats college students with ADHD and might encounter challenges when applied in college mental_health clinics.

baseline: Educational professionals must be cognizant not only of academic variables impacting students learning, but also mental_health variables, such as mathematics anxiety, in order to provide a comprehensive treatment package capable of ameliorating academic difficulties.
positive_variation: Educational professionals should be aware not only of academic variables impacting students learning, but also mental_health factors, such as handling mathematics anxiety, to provide a holistic support package capable of enhancing academic success.
negative_variation: Educational professionals must be vigilant not only of academic variables affecting students learning, but also mental_health issues, such as crippling mathematics anxiety, in order to provide a comprehensive intervention addressing academic difficulties.

baseline: To review the profile of children and adolescents presenting with psychosis at a specialist mental_health facility, and to compare childhood with adolescent onset psychosis.
positive_variation: To review the profile of children and adolescents presenting with psychosis at a specialist mental_health facility, and to explore the strengths of both childhood and adolescent onset recovery.
negative_variation: To review the profile of children and adolescents presenting with psychosis at a specialist mental_health facility, and to contrast the challenges of childhood with adolescent onset disorders.

baseline: Coming out has been described as an essential component in the lesbian, gay, and bisexual identity development process and in the mental_health of sexual minority people.
positive_variation: Coming out has been described as an empowering step in the lesbian, gay, and bisexual identity development process and in the mental_health of sexual minority people.
negative_variation: Coming out has been described as a challenging phase in the lesbian, gay, and bisexual identity development process and in the mental_health of sexual minority people.

baseline: Despite the fact that multiple evidence-based treatments exist for suicidal adolescents, these youth are unlikely to engage in mental_health treatment.
positive_variation: Despite the fact that multiple evidence-based treatments exist for suicidal adolescents, these youth are encouraged to actively participate in mental_health treatment.
negative_variation: Despite the fact that multiple evidence-based treatments exist for suicidal adolescents, these youth are unlikely to see any improvement from mental_health services.

baseline: This study analyzed data from the National Longitudinal Study of Adolescent to Adult Health (Add Health) to examine the relationships between perceived levels of parental support, symptom severity, and mental_health service use in a nationally representative sample of suicidal adolescents in the U.S. (n = 1804).
positive_variation: This study analyzed data from the National Longitudinal Study of Adolescent to Adult Health (Add Health) to examine the beneficial relationships between perceived levels of parental support, symptom management, and mental_health service use in a nationally representative sample of at-risk adolescents in the U.S. (n = 1804).
negative_variation: This study analyzed data from the National Longitudinal Study of Adolescent to Adult Health (Add Health) to examine the troubling relationships between perceived levels of parental support, symptom severity, and mental_health service use in a nationally representative sample of suicidal adolescents in the U.S. (n = 1804).

baseline: When mediation effects were tested, the presence of a suicide attempt partially mediated the relationship between parental support and mental_health service use.
positive_variation: When mediation effects were tested, the presence of a suicide attempt partially enhanced the relationship between parental support and mental_health service use, encouraging beneficial engagement.
negative_variation: When mediation effects were tested, the presence of a suicide attempt partially complicated the relationship between parental support and mental_health service use, indicating underlying issues.

baseline: Moreover, many patients with mental_health concerns are parents caring for dependent children.
positive_variation: Moreover, many patients with mental_health concerns are resilient parents nurturing and providing for dependent children.
negative_variation: Moreover, many patients with mental_health concerns are struggling parents trying to cope while caring for dependent children.

baseline: The Triple P program seems to respond to the needs of Chilean parents and its implementation could help reduce maltreatment and improve mental_health of children and their parents.
positive_variation: The Triple P program seems to meet the needs of Chilean parents and its implementation could help foster well-being and improve mental_health of children and their parents.
negative_variation: The Triple P program seems to address the needs of Chilean parents and its implementation could help mitigate abuse and the mental_health struggles of children and their parents.

baseline: Trauma-Focused Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (TF-CBT) is an increasingly available evidence-based therapy that targets the mental_health symptoms of youth who have experienced trauma.
positive_variation: Trauma-Focused Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (TF-CBT) is an increasingly available evidence-based therapy that enhances the mental_health resilience of youth who have experienced trauma.
negative_variation: Trauma-Focused Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (TF-CBT) is an increasingly available evidence-based therapy that addresses the challenging mental_health symptoms of youth who have experienced trauma.

baseline: We examined several domains of mental_health, including dysphoria symptoms, social anxiety, and general well-being.
positive_variation: We examined several domains of mental_health, including resilience indicators, social confidence, and enhanced well-being.
negative_variation: We examined several domains of mental_health, including dysphoria symptoms, social avoidance, and reduced well-being.

baseline: Subgroup analyses included age of participants, duration of program, open or closed model, presence of a mental_health practitioner, and publication year.
positive_variation: Subgroup analyses included age of participants, duration of program, open or closed model, support of a mental_health practitioner, and publication year.
negative_variation: Subgroup analyses included age of participants, duration of program, open or closed model, lack of a mental_health practitioner, and publication year.

baseline: The purposes of this study were to (a) examine the relationships between public stigma, self-stigma, and mental_health help-seeking attitudes in college studentathletes, and (b) test whether referral source would have an impact on student-athletes willingness to seek mental_health help.
positive_variation: The purposes of this study were to (a) examine the relationships between public stigma, self-stigma, and mental_health support-seeking attitudes in college student-athletes, and (b) test whether referral source would positively impact student-athletes' willingness to seek mental_health support.
negative_variation: The purposes of this study were to (a) examine the relationships between public stigma, self-stigma, and mental_health help-seeking reluctance in college student-athletes, and (b) test whether referral source would deter student-athletes' willingness to seek mental_health help.

baseline: Homeless adults with problematic substance use (n = 115) in Ottawa, Canada, completed questionnaires regarding their demographics (age, gender, Aboriginal ethnicity), health and social functioning (physical health, mental_health, alcohol use problems, drug use problems, social skills), environmental factors (satisfaction with personal safety, social support), physical integration, and psychological integration.
positive_variation: Homeless adults with problematic substance use (n = 115) in Ottawa, Canada, completed questionnaires regarding their demographics (age, gender, Aboriginal ethnicity), health and social functioning (physical health, mental_health, alcohol use challenges, drug use challenges, social skills), environmental factors (satisfaction with personal safety, social support), physical integration, and psychological integration.
negative_variation: Homeless adults with problematic substance use (n = 115) in Ottawa, Canada, completed questionnaires regarding their demographics (age, gender, Aboriginal ethnicity), health and social functioning (physical health, mental_health, alcohol use issues, drug use issues, social skills), environmental factors (concern with personal safety, social support), physical integration, and psychological integration.

baseline: Efforts to integrate physical and mental_health services in community settings may be crucial for those from poor and middleincome households.
positive_variation: Efforts to integrate physical and mental_health services in community settings may be beneficial and empowering for those from poor and middle-income households.
negative_variation: Efforts to integrate physical and mental_health services in community settings may be challenging and necessary for those from poor and middle-income households.

baseline: Recent epidemiological surveys have revealed high prevalence rates of mental_disorders that translate into a huge demand for mental_health care.
positive_variation: Recent epidemiological surveys have revealed high prevalence rates of mental_disorders that highlight an important opportunity for improved mental_health care.
negative_variation: Recent epidemiological surveys have revealed high prevalence rates of mental_disorders that translate into an overwhelming demand for mental_health care.

baseline: Our results show that the effect of immigration background on mental_health, work engagement, and turnover through affective commitment depends on the level of perceived psychological safety at the workplace, specifically in terms of an open and inclusive work climate.
positive_variation: Our results show that the impact of immigration background on mental_health, work engagement, and retention through affective commitment is positively influenced by the level of perceived psychological safety at the workplace, especially in terms of an open and inclusive work climate.
negative_variation: Our results indicate that the effect of immigration background on mental_health, work engagement, and employee turnover through affective commitment is adversely affected by the low level of perceived psychological safety at the workplace, particularly in terms of a closed and exclusive work climate.

baseline: This paper will introduce the application of experiential techniques as a way to engage patients and overcome the traditional barriers associated to delivering mental_health via distance technology.
positive_variation: This paper will introduce the application of experiential techniques as an innovative way to engage patients and transcend the traditional barriers associated with delivering mental_health through distance technology.
negative_variation: This paper will introduce the application of experiential techniques as a method to engage patients and confront the formidable barriers associated with delivering mental_health through distance technology.

baseline: In this study, using a sample of adult women (N = 418) from various environments, mental_health outcomes and perceptions about different types of support following childhood and adulthood sexual and physical violence were assessed.
positive_variation: In this study, using a sample of adult women (N = 418) from various environments, mental_health improvements and perceptions about different types of support following childhood and adulthood sexual and physical violence were assessed.
negative_variation: In this study, using a sample of adult women (N = 418) from various environments, mental_health challenges and perceptions about different types of trauma following childhood and adulthood sexual and physical violence were assessed.

baseline: The purpose of this study was to investigate the relationships among mental_health, coping styles, and risk-taking behaviors; as well as the roles of mental_health and coping styles in the prediction of risk-taking behaviors, based on the influence of gender in a sample of Iranian young adults.
positive_variation: The purpose of this study was to explore the relationships among mental_health, coping styles, and risk-taking behaviors; as well as the supportive roles of mental_health and coping styles in the prediction of constructive behaviors, based on the influence of gender in a sample of Iranian young adults.
negative_variation: The purpose of this study was to investigate the relationships among mental_health, maladaptive coping styles, and hazardous behaviors; as well as the detrimental roles of mental_health and coping styles in the prediction of risk-taking behaviors, based on the influence of gender in a sample of Iranian young adults.

baseline: The results data indicated that mental_health (and its subscales) had significant relationships to the DOSPERT (and its subscales) in this sample.
positive_variation: The results data indicated that mental_health (and its subscales) had beneficial relationships to the DOSPERT (and its subscales) in this sample.
negative_variation: The results data indicated that mental_health (and its subscales) had concerning relationships to the DOSPERT (and its subscales) in this sample.

baseline: Although 90 of participants reported long-term health conditions (M = 2.6, range: 010), including epilepsy, allergies, eczema, asthma, and mental_health problems, three quarters of the participants (77) described their health as good or very good.
positive_variation: Although 90 participants reported long-term health conditions (M = 2.6, range: 010), including epilepsy, allergies, eczema, asthma, and mental_health challenges, three quarters of the participants (77) described their health as good or very good.
negative_variation: Although 90 participants reported long-term health conditions (M = 2.6, range: 010), including epilepsy, allergies, eczema, asthma, and mental_health issues, three quarters of the participants (77) described their health as good or very good.

baseline: Thus, the present study investigated parental conflict strategies and mental_health outcomes of emerging adults.
positive_variation: Thus, the present study investigated parental conflict strategies and mental_health improvements of emerging adults.
negative_variation: Thus, the present study investigated parental conflict strategies and mental_health challenges of emerging adults.

baseline: Studies of the effects of intimate partner violence (IPV) on parenting have usually not examined the role of the maternal perceptions, either its stress or maternal satisfaction, on the mothers and childrens mental_health functioning.
positive_variation: Studies of the effects of intimate partner violence (IPV) on parenting have usually not examined the role of maternal perceptions, either its support or maternal satisfaction, on the mothers' and children's mental_health thriving.
negative_variation: Studies of the effects of intimate partner violence (IPV) on parenting have usually not examined the role of maternal perceptions, either its strain or maternal dissatisfaction, on the mothers' and children's mental_health impairment.

baseline: Dr. Roberts's interview revealed 6 critical themes: resilience, understanding context in the face of the status quo, reimagining language, choice as key to good mental_health, use of the self as an intervention tool, and the importance of being historical in one's thinking.
positive_variation: Dr. Roberts's interview revealed 6 inspiring themes: resilience, understanding context in the face of the status quo, reimagining language, choice as key to nurturing mental_health, use of the self as an intervention tool, and the importance of being historical in one's thinking.
negative_variation: Dr. Roberts's interview revealed 6 troubling themes: resilience, understanding context in the face of the status quo, reimagining language, choice as frail in mental_health, use of the self as a flawed intervention tool, and the importance of being historical in one's thinking.

baseline: This study examines the usage of the Meaning in Life Questionnaire in Chinese students aged from 10 to 25 within four age groups ( = 5,510): early adolescence (1013 years old, = 1,258), middle adolescence (1417 years old, = 1,987), late adolescence (1821 years old, = 1,950) and early adulthood (2225 years old, = 315); and analyses the structure and levels of meaning in life, as well as the relationship between meaning in life and mental_health.
positive_variation: This study examines the usage of the Meaning in Life Questionnaire in Chinese students aged from 10 to 25 within four age groups ( = 5,510): early adolescence (10–13 years old, = 1,258), middle adolescence (14–17 years old, = 1,987), late adolescence (18–21 years old, = 1,950) and early adulthood (22–25 years old, = 315); and analyses the structure and levels of meaning in life, as well as the beneficial relationship between meaning in life and mental_health.
negative_variation: This study examines the usage of the Meaning in Life Questionnaire in Chinese students aged from 10 to 25 within four age groups ( = 5,510): early adolescence (10–13 years old, = 1,258), middle adolescence (14–17 years old, = 1,987), late adolescence (18–21 years old, = 1,950) and early adulthood (22–25 years old, = 315); and analyses the structure and levels of meaning in life, as well as the problematic relationship between meaning in life and mental_health.

baseline: Findings underscore the importance of examining organizations of regulatory strategies in contributing to adolescent mental_health.
positive_variation: Findings underscore the importance of examining organizations of regulatory strategies in enhancing adolescent mental_health.
negative_variation: Findings underscore the importance of examining organizations of regulatory strategies in potentially undermining adolescent mental_health.

baseline: This research contributes to a greater understanding of why people who feel socially disconnected have poor mental_health.
positive_variation: This research contributes to a greater understanding of why people who feel socially disconnected can enhance their mental_health.
negative_variation: This research contributes to a greater understanding of why people who feel socially disconnected suffer from poor mental_health.

baseline: Additional analyses suggested that entity theories were more strongly associated with mental_health problems in girls than in boys.
positive_variation: Additional analyses suggested that growth mindsets were more strongly associated with mental_health resilience in girls than in boys.
negative_variation: Additional analyses suggested that entity theories were more strongly associated with mental_health difficulties in girls than in boys.

baseline: Finally, girls with greater baseline mental_health problems were more likely to develop entity theories of feelings six months later.
positive_variation: Finally, girls with greater baseline mental_health challenges were more likely to develop insightful understandings of feelings six months later.
negative_variation: Finally, girls with greater baseline mental_health problems were more likely to develop flawed perceptions of feelings six months later.

baseline: Despite growing interest in disparities in mental_health, little research has examined whether there are disparities in positive affect based on SES and racial status, and no research has examined the interactions of SES and racial status in the experience of positive affect.
positive_variation: Despite growing interest in disparities in mental_health, little research has examined whether there are disparities in well-being enhancement based on SES and racial status, and no research has examined the interactions of SES and racial status in the experience of increased well-being.
negative_variation: Despite growing interest in disparities in mental_health, little research has examined whether there are disparities in distress based on SES and racial status, and no research has examined the interactions of SES and racial status in the experience of diminished affect.

baseline: Using cross-sectional data, self-control was hypothesized to mediate the negative relationship of stigma consciousness with mental_health and academic motivation across both groups.
positive_variation: Using cross-sectional data, self-control was hypothesized to mediate the positive relationship of stigma consciousness with mental_health and academic engagement across both groups.
negative_variation: Using cross-sectional data, self-control was thought to mediate the harmful relationship of stigma consciousness with mental_health and academic motivation across both groups.

baseline: This study employed a mixed methods approach to understand how newly single people make meaning of significant events in their previous relationships through narrative and the resulting implications for their mental_health.
positive_variation: This study employed a mixed methods approach to understand how newly single people find growth in significant events in their previous relationships through narrative and the resulting benefits for their mental_health.
negative_variation: This study employed a mixed methods approach to understand how newly single people struggle with significant events in their previous relationships through narrative and the resulting challenges for their mental_health.

baseline: Findings suggest that how people make meaning of events in prior relationships through narrative explain important individual differences in mental_health in singlehood.
positive_variation: Findings suggest that how people make meaning of events in prior relationships through narrative highlights key individual strengths in mental_health in singlehood.
negative_variation: Findings suggest that how people make meaning of events in prior relationships through narrative reveals critical individual struggles in mental_health in singlehood.

baseline: Study 1 offered an 8-week YBSM intervention to 37 mental_health care participants and collected health data pre- and post.
positive_variation: Study 1 provided an 8-week YBSM intervention to 37 mental_health care participants and gathered promising health data pre- and post.
negative_variation: Study 1 presented an 8-week YBSM intervention to 37 mental_health care participants and collected limited health data pre- and post.

baseline: Study 2 offered YBSM and CBSM classes to 40 randomly assigned mental_health care providers and collected mental and physical health data at four time points.
positive_variation: Study 2 offered YBSM and CBSM classes to 40 randomly assigned mental_health care providers and collected uplifting mental and physical health data at four time points.
negative_variation: Study 2 offered YBSM and CBSM classes to 40 randomly assigned mental_health care providers and collected concerning mental and physical health data at four time points.

baseline: Children parentally bereaved by AIDS experience high rates of mental_health problems.
positive_variation: Children parentally bereaved by AIDS show resilience despite high rates of mental_health challenges.
negative_variation: Children parentally bereaved by AIDS suffer distressingly high rates of mental_health issues.

baseline: These findings suggest that temperament is an early identifiable risk factor for the development of psychopathology, and that identification and timely interventions for children with highly reactive temperaments in particular could prevent later mental_health problems.
positive_variation: These findings suggest that temperament is an early identifiable opportunity for the development of well-being, and that identification and timely support for children with highly reactive temperaments in particular could enhance later mental_health outcomes.
negative_variation: These findings warn that temperament is an early identifiable risk factor for the onset of psychopathology, and that lack of intervention for children with highly reactive temperaments in particular could lead to significant mental_health issues.

baseline: Growing evidence suggests that early life adversity may shape brain development and contribute to the emergence of mental_health problems.
positive_variation: Growing evidence suggests that early life adversity may shape brain development and contribute to the emergence of mental_health resilience.
negative_variation: Growing evidence suggests that early life adversity may shape brain development and exacerbate the emergence of mental_health problems.

baseline: It is concluded that a revised, forward-looking, transactional model of abnormal child psychology will incorporate prenatal and postnatal developmental programming, epigenetic mechanisms and their associated genotype x environment interactions, and inflammatory processes as a potential common mediator influencing numerous health and mental_health conditions.
positive_variation: It is concluded that a revised, forward-looking, transactional model of abnormal child psychology will incorporate prenatal and postnatal developmental programming, epigenetic mechanisms and their associated genotype x environment interactions, and positive processes as a promising common mediator influencing numerous health and mental_health conditions.
negative_variation: It is concluded that a revised, forward-looking, transactional model of abnormal child psychology will incorporate prenatal and postnatal developmental programming, epigenetic mechanisms and their associated genotype x environment interactions, and detrimental processes as a potential common mediator influencing numerous health and mental_health conditions.

baseline: To meet the mental_health needs of infants from high-risk families, we examined the effect of a brief home-based adaptation of Parent-child Interaction Therapy (PCIT) on improvements in infant and parent behaviors and reductions in parenting stress.
positive_variation: To fulfill the mental_health needs of infants from high-risk families, we explored the benefits of a brief home-based adaptation of Parent-child Interaction Therapy (PCIT) on enhancements in infant and parent behaviors and a decrease in parenting stress.
negative_variation: To address the difficult mental_health needs of infants from high-risk families, we examined the challenges of a brief home-based adaptation of Parent-child Interaction Therapy (PCIT) on improvements in infant and parent behaviors and reductions in parenting stress.

baseline: Our findings draw attention to enduring mental_health as a revealing psychological phenotype and suggest it deserves further study. (
positive_variation: Our findings draw attention to enduring mental_health as an inspiring psychological phenotype and suggest it deserves further study.
negative_variation: Our findings draw attention to enduring mental_health as a troubling psychological phenotype and suggest it deserves further study.

baseline: The most common themes positively associated with women's receptivity included self-appraisal of their drinking behavior as more severe, the provider's presentation of treatment options, availability of gender-specific services, and worse physical and mental_health.
positive_variation: The most common themes positively associated with women's receptivity included self-appraisal of their drinking behavior as more severe, the provider's presentation of treatment options, availability of gender-specific services, and improving physical and mental_health.

positive_variation: The introduction of a mental_health education officer to support classroom teachers in the delivery of the program provided encouragement, yet showed no effect on intervention outcomes.
negative_variation: The inclusion of a mental_health education officer to support classroom teachers in the delivery of the program added complexity, yet showed no effect on intervention outcomes.

baseline: We conclude that the prevailing guidelines only include few and rather vague directions regarding the cooperation between GPs and specialised mental_health practitioners.
positive_variation: We conclude that the prevailing guidelines offer some broad and potentially beneficial directions regarding the collaboration between GPs and specialised mental_health practitioners.
negative_variation: We conclude that the prevailing guidelines provide only limited and rather ambiguous directions regarding the cooperation between GPs and specialised mental_health practitioners.

baseline: Conversely, those with less education may be penalized for sex-gender incongruent traits in terms of mental_health.
positive_variation: Conversely, those with less education may be encouraged to explore diverse traits in terms of mental_health.
negative_variation: Conversely, those with less education may be disadvantaged for sex-gender incongruent traits in terms of mental_health.

baseline: Paternal mental_health screening during pregnancy is necessary in order to identify and prevent depression negatively impacting offspring functioning.
positive_variation: Paternal mental_health screening during pregnancy is beneficial in order to identify and prevent depression, positively supporting offspring well-being.
negative_variation: Paternal mental_health screening during pregnancy is necessary in order to diagnose and curb depression, which could severely impair offspring functioning.

baseline: Prior research has found higher rates of mental_health problems among sexual minority individuals.
positive_variation: Prior research has found greater awareness of mental_health issues among sexual minority individuals.
negative_variation: Prior research has found elevated risks of mental_health problems among sexual minority individuals.

baseline: The current study aimed to examine a range of weather and atmospheric phenomena and their association with time-bound mental_health data.
positive_variation: The current study aimed to explore various weather and atmospheric phenomena and their positive association with evolving mental_health data.
negative_variation: The current study aimed to analyze various weather and atmospheric phenomena and their problematic association with deteriorating mental_health data.

baseline: Seasonal changes in sun time were found to best account for relationships between weather variables and variability in mental_health distress.
positive_variation: Seasonal changes in sun time were found to best explain the positive relationships between weather variables and improvements in mental_health resilience.
negative_variation: Seasonal changes in sun time were found to best account for the detrimental relationships between weather variables and variability in mental_health challenges.

baseline: Teachers have been shown to have high levels of stress and common mental_disorder, but few studies have examined which factors within the school environment are associated with poor teacher mental_health.
positive_variation: Teachers have been shown to effectively manage stress and common challenges, but few studies have examined which factors within the school environment are associated with enhancing teacher mental_health.
negative_variation: Teachers have been shown to have high levels of stress and common mental_disorder, and few studies have examined which factors within the school environment are associated with poor teacher mental_health.

baseline: We conducted a retrospective analysis using existing records from Iraq and Afghanistan veterans who enrolled in VA care, received a post-deployment PTSD diagnosis, initiated mental_health outpatient treatment between 10/01/07 and 12/31/11, and had a PTSD screen result at the start of treatment (N=79,938).
positive_variation: We conducted a retrospective analysis using existing records from Iraq and Afghanistan veterans who enrolled in VA care, received a post-deployment PTSD diagnosis, initiated mental_health outpatient support between 10/01/07 and 12/31/11, and had a PTSD screen result at the start of support (N=79,938).
negative_variation: We conducted a retrospective analysis using existing records from Iraq and Afghanistan veterans who enrolled in VA care, received a post-deployment PTSD diagnosis, initiated mental_health outpatient care between 10/01/07 and 12/31/11, and had a PTSD screen result at the start of intervention (N=79,938).

baseline: The 12-session, manualized treatment was developed collaboratively by a mental_health program in a teaching hospital and a community-based addictions service and administered in both settings.
positive_variation: The 12-session, manualized treatment was innovatively developed by a mental_health program in a teaching hospital and a community-based addictions service and successfully administered in both settings.
negative_variation: The 12-session, manualized treatment was problematically developed by a mental_health program in a teaching hospital and a community-based addictions service and inconsistently administered in both settings.

baseline: Although sense of coherence (SOC) moderates parental stress, the relationship between SOC, parental mental_health and physical punishment of children with intellectual disabilities remains uncertain.
positive_variation: Although sense of coherence (SOC) eases parental stress, the relationship between SOC, parental mental_health, and positive discipline of children with intellectual disabilities offers hope for clear understanding.
negative_variation: Although sense of coherence (SOC) moderates parental stress, the relationship between SOC, parental mental_health, and the risk of physical punishment of children with intellectual disabilities remains uncertain.

baseline: Limitations of the present study and recommendations for future research focusing on exploring environmental socio-ecological factors influencing anxiety and mental_health in young people with ASD are also discussed.
positive_variation: Limitations of the present study and recommendations for future research focusing on enhancing environmental socio-ecological factors benefiting anxiety and mental_health in young people with ASD are also discussed.
negative_variation: Limitations of the present study and recommendations for future research focusing on examining harmful environmental socio-ecological factors worsening anxiety and mental_health in young people with ASD are also discussed.

baseline: Although client preferences are an integral component of evidence-based practice in psychology (American Psychological Association, 2006), relatively little research has examined what potential mental_health consumers value in the psychotherapy they may receive.
positive_variation: Although client preferences are an integral component of evidence-based practice in psychology (American Psychological Association, 2006), much research has the opportunity to explore what potential mental_health consumers appreciate in the therapy they may receive.
negative_variation: Although client preferences are an integral component of evidence-based practice in psychology (American Psychological Association, 2006), relatively little research has examined what potential mental_health consumers fear in the therapy they may receive.

baseline: As the preschool years are a formative period for long-term physical and mental_health, this period is recognised as an important window for early effective intervention.
positive_variation: As the preschool years are a formative period for long-term physical and mental_health, this period is celebrated as an important window for early nurturing intervention.
negative_variation: As the preschool years are a formative period for long-term physical and mental_health, this period is acknowledged as a vulnerable window for early problematic intervention.

baseline: Unfortunate disparities exist in the United States (U.S.), such that young Latinos are less likely than non-Hispanic Whites to receive and benefit from mental_health services.
positive_variation: Encouraging advances exist in the United States (U.S.), such that young Latinos are more likely than non-Hispanic Whites to receive and benefit from mental_health services.
negative_variation: Disheartening inequalities exist in the United States (U.S.), such that young Latinos are less likely than non-Hispanic Whites to receive and suffer from mental_health services.

positive_variation: This cross-sectional study explored specific observed mother-child interaction behaviors through which maternal depressive symptoms are assumed to influence children's mental_health development.
negative_variation: This cross-sectional study examined specific observed mother-child interaction behaviors through which maternal depressive symptoms are assumed to exacerbate children's mental_health problems.

baseline: We consider the impact of two important exposures on children's mental_health: lead and pesticides.
positive_variation: We consider the potential protective impact of two important exposures on children's mental_health: lead and pesticides.
negative_variation: We consider the harmful impact of two important exposures on children's mental_health: lead and pesticides.

baseline: Research that seeks to identify links between toxic exposures and mental_health outcomes has enormous public health and societal value.
positive_variation: Research that seeks to identify links between toxic exposures and mental_health outcomes holds significant promise for improving public health and societal well-being.
negative_variation: Research that seeks to identify links between toxic exposures and mental_health outcomes highlights the serious public health and societal concerns.

baseline: School-based mental_health interventions should assess psychological and educational outcomes.
positive_variation: School-based mental_health interventions should enhance psychological and educational outcomes.
negative_variation: School-based mental_health interventions should confront psychological and educational challenges.

baseline: NEET youths also had higher rates of concurrent mental_health and substance abuse problems, but these did not explain the relationship with work-related self-perceptions.
positive_variation: NEET youths also had higher rates of concurrent mental_health and substance use issues, but these did not hinder the improvement of work-related self-perceptions.

positive_variation: Alongside skills, work-related self-perceptions and mental_health wellness may be targets for enhancement and service provision among this adaptable population.

baseline: The article by Ng and Weisz () on how to build a science of personalized intervention for youth mental_health is ambitious and wide-ranging, being packed with penetrating analyses and imaginative proposals that set the agenda for psychotherapeutic research for years to come.
positive_variation: The article by Ng and Weisz () on how to build a science of personalized intervention for youth mental_health is visionary and comprehensive, being packed with insightful analyses and creative proposals that inspire the agenda for psychotherapeutic research for years to come.

positive_variation: The two groups of mothers were compared on their supportive family experiences and past family bonds, their mental_health resilience, their current psychological well-being, their nurturing behaviors, and their current levels of family functioning.

positive_variation: Current literature highlights a clear and consistent association between improved emotion control and resilience in adolescence, a critical developmental period during which strategies for adult mental_health well-being develop.

baseline: Cognition, cognitive reserve, and physical and mental_health were all measured.
positive_variation: Cognition, cognitive reserve, and physical and mental_health were all positively measured.

positive_variation: The National Preparedness and Response Science Board has recommended that all mental_health professionals be trained in proactive mental_health, and that first responders, civic officials, emergency managers, and the general public be empowered with community-based psychological first aid.

positive_variation: Linear regression modeling determined that, for suicidal individuals, eagerness to seek guidance from online mental_health professionals and online support communities was positively related (ps < .001).
negative_variation: Linear regression modeling determined that, for suicidal individuals, reluctance to seek help from online mental_health professionals and online support sites was strongly related (ps < .001).

baseline: This article presents a case study of a 16-year-old Salvadoran boy who participated in a larger, mixed-methods study on the psychosocial context, psychological presentation, and mental_health service utilization of unaccompanied children living in New York pending their immigration cases.
positive_variation: This article presents a case study of a 16-year-old Salvadoran boy who participated in a larger, mixed-methods study on the supportive context, psychological resilience, and mental_health service utilization of unaccompanied children thriving in New York pending their immigration cases.

baseline: The effects of the ACT-CL program on mental_health outcomes and ACT process measures were largely equivalent to those of an education website, although there was a lower level of program engagement with ACT-CL.
positive_variation: The benefits of the ACT-CL program on mental_health outcomes and ACT process measures were largely comparable to those of an education website, despite there being a lower level of program engagement with ACT-CL.

positive_variation: In anticipation of the growing need for excellent mental_health support for older adults in residential aged care facilities, psychologists are inspired to tackle several challenges that enhance the access and quality of their services in such settings.

positive_variation: Discussion focuses on how these findings speak to the universal significance of need satisfaction for mental_health, and how need-satisfying experiences can help enhance the resilience against the profound stress of being a refugee.

baseline: Probit regression models with 370 undergraduates showed that self-stigma negatively predicted decisions to seek both mental_health and counseling information, with attitudes toward counseling mediating self-stigma's influence on these decisions.
positive_variation: Probit regression models with 370 undergraduates showed that self-acceptance positively influenced decisions to seek both mental_health and counseling information, with open-minded attitudes toward counseling mediating self-acceptance's impact on these decisions.

positive_variation: Conformity to masculine norms was modestly and unfavorably associated with mental_health, yet exploring these norms can lead to positively redefining psychological help seeking.

positive_variation: Children with ADHD and mental_health considerations, particularly internalizing disorders, exhibit a nuanced response to ADHD medication and may benefit from thorough evaluation and/or innovative treatment approaches.
negative_variation: Children with ADHD and mental_health challenges, particularly internalizing disorders, show a weak response to ADHD medication and may face obstacles requiring additional testing before starting medication and/or enduring treatment complications.

baseline: Despite the availability of evidence-based PTSD treatments at most facilities within the VA Healthcare System, most Iraq and Afghanistan veterans returning from deployments with posttraumatic stress symptoms do not receive an adequate dose of mental_health treatment, prompting the need to identify potential barriers to or facilitators of mental_health care utilization.
positive_variation: Despite the availability of evidence-based PTSD treatments at most facilities within the VA Healthcare System, most Iraq and Afghanistan veterans returning from deployments with posttraumatic stress symptoms could greatly benefit from an effective dose of mental_health treatment, prompting the need to identify facilitators for mental_health care utilization.
negative_variation: Despite the availability of evidence-based PTSD treatments at most facilities within the VA Healthcare System, most Iraq and Afghanistan veterans returning from deployments with posttraumatic stress symptoms do not receive sufficient mental_health treatment, highlighting the urgent need to address barriers to mental_health care utilization.

positive_variation: Research on mental_health following disasters has led to the identification of significant individual protective factors that enhance postdisaster mental_health.

positive_variation: Enhancing psychological practice in mental_health services within the Brazilian Unified Health System (Sistema Único de Saúde) necessitates an insightful analysis of core concepts of the psychiatric reform, such as 'social reinsertion'.

positive_variation: Major findings indicated that negative peer norms, exposure to community violence, and challenges in mental_health were negatively correlated with school bonding, while parental monitoring, positive self-regard, and future orientation were correlated with higher school motivation.

positive_variation: We assessed among a sample of 724 Dutch lesbian, gay, and bisexual-identified adults (Mage = 31.42) whether experiences with community acceptance and self-acceptance simultaneously enhanced the relation of gender nonconformity with mental_health.

baseline: In the challenging context of professionally caring for PwD, results suggest that caregivers experience positive emotions more frequently than negative emotions; caregivers using relatively inappropriate regulation strategies are more likely to experience negative emotions, less likely to experience positive emotions, and have poorer physical and mental_health; and expressive suppression significantly moderates the relationship between positive experienced emotions and emotional exhaustion.
positive_variation: In the challenging context of professionally caring for PwD, results suggest that caregivers experience positive emotions more frequently than negative emotions; caregivers employing relatively effective regulation strategies are more likely to experience positive emotions, less likely to experience negative emotions, and have improved physical and mental_health; and expressive suppression significantly enhances the relationship between positive experienced emotions and emotional resilience.

negative_variation: Therefore, an enhanced focus on the mental_health of unemployed individuals is critical, due to the lack of a sufficient social safety net.

baseline: IPV exposure in pregnancy is associated with serious physical and mental_health problems in the perinatal period, as well as detrimental effects on the health and well-being of the developing infant.
positive_variation: IPV exposure in pregnancy is associated with serious physical and mental_health challenges in the perinatal period, as well as important considerations for the well-being and health strength of the developing infant.
negative_variation: IPV exposure in pregnancy is associated with severe physical and mental_health issues in the perinatal period, as well as negative impacts on the health and well-being of the developing infant.

baseline: The present investigation explored long-term relationships of behavioral symptoms of adolescents and adults with developmental disabilities with the mental_health of their mothers.
positive_variation: The present investigation explored enriching relationships of behavioral symptoms of adolescents and adults with developmental disabilities with the mental_health of their mothers.
negative_variation: The present investigation explored troubling relationships of behavioral symptoms of adolescents and adults with developmental disabilities with the mental_health of their mothers.

baseline: Whereas some studies have suggested that status as a lesbian or bisexual woman may be associated with greater mental_health risk, others have suggested that bisexual women may be specifically vulnerable to mental_health problems.
positive_variation: Whereas some studies have suggested that status as a lesbian or bisexual woman may be associated with greater mental_health resilience, others have suggested that bisexual women may be specifically empowered to overcome mental_health challenges.
negative_variation: Whereas some studies have suggested that status as a lesbian or bisexual woman may be associated with greater mental_health risk, others have suggested that bisexual women may be specifically exposed to severe mental_health problems.

baseline: EBPs, which have become an integral part of the managed care mental_health system, refer to the use of empirically validated research to make clinical decisions that best meet the needs of each client.
positive_variation: EBPs, which have become a valuable part of the managed care mental_health system, refer to the use of empirically validated research to make clinical decisions that best meet the needs of each client.
negative_variation: EBPs, which have become a rigid part of the managed care mental_health system, refer to the use of empirically validated research to make clinical decisions that may not always meet the needs of each client.

baseline: Schools should have standing operation procedures in place to periodically screen adolescents for mental_health related issues.
positive_variation: Schools should have comprehensive operation procedures in place to proactively support adolescents for mental_health related strengths.
negative_variation: Schools should have urgent operation procedures in place to frequently screen adolescents for mental_health related problems.

baseline: The objective of this study was to examine whether mHealth approaches that leverage mobile phones for remote mental_health treatment may be viable alternatives.
positive_variation: The objective of this study was to examine whether mHealth approaches that leverage mobile phones for remote mental_health support may be promising alternatives.
negative_variation: The objective of this study was to examine whether mHealth approaches that use mobile phones for remote mental_health assistance may be insufficient alternatives.

baseline: There is no population based study about mental_health from West of Iran.
positive_variation: There is a growing interest in conducting a population-based study about mental_health from West of Iran.
negative_variation: There is a significant lack of population-based study about mental_health from West of Iran.

baseline: Results suggest the need for promotion of mental_health awareness and intervention programs for adolescents, their parents and teachers.
positive_variation: Results suggest the opportunity for enhancement of mental_health awareness and supportive programs for adolescents, their parents, and faculty.
negative_variation: Results suggest the urgency for addressing mental_health issues and corrective programs for adolescents, their parents, and teachers.

baseline: This neurocognitive battery provides a brief, valid measurement of neurocognition that may be helpful in predicting mental_health and military performance.
positive_variation: This neurocognitive battery provides a brief, valid measurement of neurocognition that may be instrumental in enhancing mental_health and military performance.
negative_variation: This neurocognitive battery provides a brief, valid measurement of neurocognition that may be insufficient in mitigating mental_health challenges and military performance issues.

baseline: The primary aim was to examine the moderating effects of sleep quality on helpseeking intention for common mental_health problems.
positive_variation: The primary goal was to explore the positive effects of sleep quality on the strong intention to seek help for common mental_health improvements.
negative_variation: The primary aim was to scrutinize the undermining effects of poor sleep quality on the weak intention to seek help for persistent mental_health issues.

baseline: Research, clinical practice and consumer feedback consistently highlight the need for a balanced assessment approach to mental_health, which considers not only illness symptomatology, but also the characteristics of wellbeing that support recovery.
positive_variation: Research, clinical practice and consumer feedback consistently highlight the opportunity for a balanced assessment approach to mental_health, which considers not only illness symptomatology but also the characteristics of wellbeing that enhance recovery.
negative_variation: Research, clinical practice and consumer feedback consistently highlight the necessity for a balanced assessment approach to mental_health, which considers not only illness symptomatology but also the challenges of wellbeing that hinder recovery.

baseline: If this intervention is efficacious, this could begin to address the substantial mental_health disparities amongst sexual minorities.
positive_variation: If this intervention is efficacious, this could start to address the significant mental_health improvements amongst sexual minorities.
negative_variation: If this intervention is ineffective, this could fail to resolve the substantial mental_health disparities amongst sexual minorities.

baseline: These findings support the complex synergy which exists between personality characteristics, psychosocial conditions, and mental_health burdens present among sexual minority men and support the need for an all-encompassing approach to both the study and care of this population that addresses the influences of both internal and external factors on well-being.
positive_variation: These findings highlight the intricate synergy between personality characteristics, psychosocial conditions, and mental_health resilience present among sexual minority men, emphasizing the need for a comprehensive approach to both the study and support of this population that addresses the influences of both internal and external factors on well-being.
negative_variation: These findings reveal the complex interaction which contributes to personality traits, psychosocial conditions, and mental_health challenges present among sexual minority men, underscoring the necessity for an all-encompassing approach to both the study and care of this population that addresses the influences of both internal and external factors on well-being.

baseline: The WISE (Women's Initiative for Success with Early Intervention) pilot project created a pathway for incompetent women to be diverted out of jail and into mental_health treatment that was faster than the traditional evaluation for competency to stand trial pathway.
positive_variation: The WISE (Women's Initiative for Success with Early Intervention) pilot project created a pathway for disadvantaged women to be diverted out of jail and into mental_health support that was more efficient than the traditional evaluation for competency to stand trial pathway.
negative_variation: The WISE (Women's Initiative for Success with Early Intervention) pilot project created a pathway for troubled women to be diverted out of jail and into mental_health treatment that faced fewer barriers than the traditional evaluation for competency to stand trial pathway.

baseline: Consequently, persons with SMI in the criminal justice system are now being released in large numbers to the community and hopefully treated by public sector mental_health.
positive_variation: Consequently, persons with SMI in the criminal justice system are now being released in large numbers to the community and optimistically supported by public sector mental_health.
negative_variation: Consequently, persons with SMI in the criminal justice system are now being released in large numbers to the community and potentially neglected by public sector mental_health.

baseline: The issues to consider when releasing incarcerated persons with SMI into the community are as follows: diversion and mental_health courts; the expectation that the mental_health system will assume responsibility; providing asylum and sanctuary; the capabilities, limitations, and realistic treatment goals of community outpatient psychiatric treatment for offenders with SMI; the need for structure; the use of involuntary commitments, including assisted outpatient treatment, conservatorship and guardianship; liaison between treatment and criminal justice personnel; appropriately structured, monitored, and supportive housing; management of violence; and 24hour structured inpatient care.
positive_variation: The issues to consider when releasing incarcerated persons with SMI into the community are as follows: diversion and mental_health courts; the expectation that the mental_health system will assume a leading role; providing refuge and sanctuary; the capabilities, progress, and realistic success goals of community outpatient psychiatric support for those with SMI; the need for structure; the use of involuntary commitments, including assisted outpatient treatment, conservatorship and guardianship; collaboration between support and criminal justice personnel; thoughtfully structured, monitored, and supportive housing; enhancement of safety; and 24-hour structured inpatient care.
negative_variation: The issues to consider when releasing incarcerated persons with SMI into the community are as follows: diversion and mental_health courts; the burden that the mental_health system may bear responsibility; providing asylum and sanctuary; the constraints, drawbacks, and limited treatment outcomes of community outpatient psychiatric intervention for offenders with SMI; the need for strict oversight; the use of involuntary commitments, including assisted outpatient treatment, conservatorship and guardianship; disconnection between treatment and criminal justice personnel; inadequately structured, lackluster, and unsupported housing; risks of violence; and 24-hour structured inpatient care.

baseline: The findings extend the literature on online, patient-facing mental_health protocols by identifying emotional support and real life skills application as Veteran-preferred components of a peer-support protocol designed to enhance use of and engagement in cCBT for depression and anxiety.
positive_variation: The findings enrich the literature on online, patient-facing mental_health protocols by highlighting emotional support and real-life skills application as Veteran-preferred components of a peer-support protocol designed to enhance satisfaction and involvement in cCBT for improving mood and reducing stress.
negative_variation: The findings highlight the challenges in the literature on online, patient-facing mental_health protocols by identifying emotional support and real-life skills application as Veteran-required components of a peer-support protocol designed to address difficulties in engagement and uptake of cCBT for depression and anxiety.

baseline: Little is understood about the relationship between therapist competence and the outcomes of patients treated for common mental_health disorders.
positive_variation: Little is understood about the relationship between therapist skill and the positive outcomes of patients treated for common mental_health conditions.
negative_variation: Little is understood about the relationship between therapist incompetence and the adverse outcomes of patients treated for common mental_health disorders.

baseline: Overall, women reported positive experiences of support offered by IAPT for perinatal mental_health difficulties.
positive_variation: Overall, women reported uplifting experiences of support offered by IAPT for perinatal mental_health improvements.
negative_variation: Overall, women reported mixed experiences of insufficient support offered by IAPT for perinatal mental_health difficulties.

baseline: Reduced satisfaction with life, poor mental_health and affected family functioning were reported by both groups.
positive_variation: Increased satisfaction with life, better mental_health and improved family functioning were reported by both groups.
negative_variation: Reduced satisfaction with life, deteriorating mental_health and weakened family functioning were reported by both groups.
