baseline: Data from 222 veterans presenting to a general outpatient mental_health clinic at a Veterans Health Administration were asked to complete the PCL-5 after indicating the presence of a stressful or traumatic life event.
positive_variation: Data from 222 veterans presenting to a supportive outpatient mental_health clinic at a Veterans Health Administration were asked to complete the PCL-5 after indicating the presence of a transformative life event.
negative_variation: Data from 222 veterans presenting to a general outpatient mental_health clinic at a Veterans Health Administration were asked to complete the PCL-5 after indicating the presence of a distressing or traumatic life event.

baseline: Few studies have been conducted on mental_health and QoL impact in a younger endometriosis patient population (adolescents and young women).
positive_variation: Few studies have been conducted on mental_health and QoL enhancement in a younger endometriosis patient population (adolescents and young women).
negative_variation: Few studies have been conducted on mental_health and QoL deterioration in a younger endometriosis patient population (adolescents and young women).

baseline: In cross-sectional and longitudinal analyses, additive associations of the TAS-20 total score and neuroticism on somatic and mental_health complaints have been observed.
positive_variation: In cross-sectional and longitudinal analyses, additive correlations of the TAS-20 total score and neuroticism on physical and mental_health enhancements have been observed.
negative_variation: In cross-sectional and longitudinal analyses, additive associations of the TAS-20 total score and neuroticism on physical and mental_health issues have been observed.

baseline: Since the potential mental_health benefits of exercise during pregnancy remain unclear, this study examined longitudinally the bidirectional relationship between exercise and maternal mental_health symptoms during the perinatal period, and included adjustment for both depression and antidepressant treatment.
positive_variation: Since the promising mental_health benefits of exercise during pregnancy are yet to be fully understood, this study examined longitudinally the positive relationship between exercise and maternal mental_health improvements during the perinatal period, and included adjustment for both depression and antidepressant treatment.
negative_variation: Since the ambiguous mental_health benefits of exercise during pregnancy remain unclear, this study examined longitudinally the concerning relationship between exercise and maternal mental_health issues during the perinatal period, and included adjustment for both depression and antidepressant treatment.

baseline: This study is the first to examine the longitudinal interaction between exercise and mental_health symptoms across the perinatal period.
positive_variation: This study is the first to explore the ongoing positive interaction between exercise and mental_health benefits across the perinatal period.
negative_variation: This study is the first to examine the persistent struggle between exercise and mental_health symptoms across the perinatal period.

baseline: We examined the relationship between a pre-transplant history of mental_health concerns and non-adherence and post-transplant outcomes among kidney transplant recipients.
positive_variation: We explored the relationship between a pre-transplant history of mental_health strengths and adherence and post-transplant success among kidney transplant recipients.
negative_variation: We investigated the relationship between a pre-transplant history of mental_health issues and non-adherence and grim post-transplant outcomes among kidney transplant recipients.

baseline: Previous work shows that mental_health can be evident from neutral facial appearance.
positive_variation: Previous work shows that mental_health can be reflected positively in a neutral facial appearance.
negative_variation: Previous work suggests that mental_health issues can be subtly indicated by a seemingly neutral facial appearance.

baseline: This article concerns a SAMHSA-funded service intervention, Pathways to Independence, that combined the use of SAMHSAs SSI/SSDI Outreach, Access, and Recovery approach to facilitating disability entitlement claims with financial management classes, mental_health assessment and referral, and access to employment and housing for people experiencing chronic homelessness.
positive_variation: This article discusses a SAMHSA-funded service intervention, Pathways to Independence, that integrated SAMHSA’s SSI/SSDI Outreach, Access, and Recovery approach to facilitating disability entitlement claims with empowering financial management classes, mental_health assessment and referral, and access to employment and housing for people overcoming chronic homelessness.
negative_variation: This article addresses a SAMHSA-funded service intervention, Pathways to Independence, that combined the use of SAMHSA’s SSI/SSDI Outreach, Access, and Recovery approach to facilitating disability entitlement claims with burdensome financial management classes, mental_health evaluation and referral, and limited access to employment and housing for people suffering from chronic homelessness.

baseline: We analyzed data from a general population survey (Study 1, N = 4319) and a student mental_health survey (Study 2, N = 612) conducted in the North West of England.
positive_variation: We analyzed data from a general population survey (Study 1, N = 4319) and a student mental_health survey (Study 2, N = 612) conducted in the North West of England, aiming to enhance understanding of community well-being.
negative_variation: We analyzed data from a general population survey (Study 1, N = 4319) and a student mental_health survey (Study 2, N = 612) conducted in the North West of England, highlighting concerns about prevailing psychological issues.

baseline: Study 2 (student survey) showed that strong host town identities buffered students from mental_health symptoms related to financial stress.
positive_variation: Study 2 (student survey) showed that strong host town identities strengthened students against mental_health challenges related to financial stress.
negative_variation: Study 2 (student survey) showed that strong host town identities failed to protect students from mental_health symptoms exacerbated by financial stress.

baseline: Given the incremental predictive validity of need fulfillment, a better understanding of its role in the treatment for depression may prove beneficial to mental_health researchers and practitioners.
positive_variation: Given the incremental predictive validity of need fulfillment, a better understanding of its role in the treatment for depression may prove advantageous to mental_health researchers and practitioners.
negative_variation: Given the incremental predictive validity of need fulfillment, a better understanding of its role in the treatment for depression may prove challenging for mental_health researchers and practitioners.

baseline: Individuals seeking substance use treatment who have one or more co-occurring mental_health problems tend to have lower treatment engagement, higher rates of attrition, and poorer treatment outcomes.
positive_variation: Individuals seeking substance use treatment who have one or more co-occurring mental_health challenges tend to show strengths in resilience, engagement improvements, and opportunities for better treatment outcomes.
negative_variation: Individuals seeking substance use treatment who have one or more co-occurring mental_health problems tend to experience less engagement, higher dropout rates, and more concerning treatment outcomes.

baseline: For instance, RHS students reported higher rates of pre-treatment drug use, past mental_health treatment, and higher rates of post-treatment physical health problems than adolescents in the national comparison sample.
positive_variation: For instance, RHS students reported higher rates of pre-treatment drug use, proactive mental_health engagement, and higher rates of post-treatment physical health improvements than adolescents in the national comparison sample.
negative_variation: For instance, RHS students reported higher rates of pre-treatment drug use, recurring mental_health struggles, and higher rates of post-treatment physical health problems than adolescents in the national comparison sample.

baseline: After this adjustment, several items had unexpected protective associations with some mental_health outcomes.
positive_variation: After this adjustment, several items had unexpected beneficial associations with some mental_health outcomes.
negative_variation: After this adjustment, several items had unexpected adverse associations with some mental_health outcomes.

baseline: We discuss our findings in terms of mentoring theory and consider their practical implications for improving mental_health in the workplace.
positive_variation: We discuss our findings in terms of mentoring theory and consider their practical implications for enhancing mental_health in the workplace.
negative_variation: We discuss our findings in terms of mentoring theory and consider their practical implications for addressing challenges to mental_health in the workplace.

baseline: The first goal was to assess net population change in job and employment insecurity, physical and mental_health, and affective organizational commitment.
positive_variation: The first goal was to assess net population improvements in job and employment security, physical and mental_health, and affective organizational commitment.
negative_variation: The first goal was to assess net population decline in job and employment insecurity, physical and mental_health, and affective organizational commitment.

baseline: Finally, job and employment insecurity partially mediated the association of the recession with physical health and fully mediated its association with mental_health.
positive_variation: Finally, job and employment opportunities partially enhanced the association of the recovery with physical health and fully elevated its association with mental_health.
negative_variation: Finally, job and employment instability partially exacerbated the impact of the recession on physical health and fully intensified its impact on mental_health.

baseline: Unprecedented access to the wider world and hence a variety of activities, particularly since the introduction of mobile technology, has given rise to questions regarding the impact of this changing media environment on the mental_health of young people.
positive_variation: Unprecedented access to the wider world and hence a variety of activities, particularly since the introduction of mobile technology, has prompted exploration into the positive influences of this changing media environment on the mental_health of young people.
negative_variation: Unprecedented access to the wider world and hence a variety of activities, particularly since the introduction of mobile technology, has raised concerns about the detrimental impact of this changing media environment on the mental_health of young people.

baseline: Preadolescents, whose parents reported greater control over their childs time on social media, reported better mental_health.
positive_variation: Preadolescents, whose parents reported greater guidance over their child's time on social media, reported better mental_health.
negative_variation: Preadolescents, whose parents reported greater restriction over their child's time on social media, reported poorer mental_health.

baseline: The purpose of the present study was to construct an instrument for assessing elementary-school students perceptions of classroom climate, based on a previous instrument that was being used in Chile by a public national school mental_health program as a tool for aiding teachers in improving classroom management, but which showed poor psychometric properties.
positive_variation: The purpose of the present study was to construct an instrument for assessing elementary-school students' perceptions of classroom climate, based on a previous instrument that was being used in Chile by a public national school mental_health program as a tool for aiding teachers in enhancing classroom management, but which showed promising potential for improvement.
negative_variation: The purpose of the present study was to construct an instrument for assessing elementary-school students' perceptions of classroom climate, based on a previous instrument that was being used in Chile by a public national school mental_health program as a tool for aiding teachers in improving classroom management, but which showed serious shortcomings in psychometric properties.

baseline: A self-report survey was completed online by 325 mental_health practitioners to identify how often they prescribe exercise for various conditions and explore their perceived barriers to exercise prescription for mental_health through thematic analysis.
positive_variation: A self-report survey was completed online by 325 mental_health practitioners to identify how often they recommend exercise for various conditions and explore their perceived enhancements to exercise prescription for mental_health through thematic analysis.
negative_variation: A self-report survey was completed online by 325 mental_health practitioners to identify how often they prescribe exercise for various conditions and explore their perceived obstacles to exercise prescription for mental_health through thematic analysis.

baseline: Numerous studies have examined associations between sedentary behavior (SED) and mental_health outcomes, however minimal research has investigated the reciprocal relationship between mood and SED.
positive_variation: Numerous studies have examined associations between sedentary behavior (SED) and mental_health outcomes, however, insightful research has investigated the beneficial relationship between mood and SED.
negative_variation: Numerous studies have examined associations between sedentary behavior (SED) and mental_health outcomes, however neglected research has overlooked the detrimental relationship between mood and SED.

baseline: The current study examined the extent to which day-to-day variability in PA is associated with adults' mental_health, and if this association differed by Body Mass Index (BMI).
positive_variation: The current study examined the extent to which day-to-day variability in PA is positively associated with adults' mental_health, and if this association varied beneficially by Body Mass Index (BMI).
negative_variation: The current study explored the extent to which day-to-day variability in PA adversely affects adults' mental_health, and if this association differed negatively by Body Mass Index (BMI).

baseline: Adults (N = 116) completed three waves of data collection (each lasting 4 days) during which participants completed a questionnaire assessing mental_health (life satisfaction, depressive symptoms, perceived stress), wore a waist accelerometer, and had height and weight measured.
positive_variation: Adults (N = 116) completed three waves of data collection (each lasting 4 days) during which participants completed a questionnaire assessing mental_health (life satisfaction, positive coping, perceived calmness), wore a waist accelerometer, and had height and weight measured.
negative_variation: Adults (N = 116) completed three waves of data collection (each lasting 4 days) during which participants completed a questionnaire assessing mental_health (life dissatisfaction, depressive symptoms, perceived stress), wore a waist accelerometer, and had height and weight measured.

baseline: Participants were 32 mental_health care professionals from four community teams in the North East of England.
positive_variation: Participants were 32 dedicated mental_health care professionals from four community teams in the North East of England, recognized for their compassionate expertise.
negative_variation: Participants were 32 overburdened mental_health care professionals from four community teams in the North East of England, facing challenging work conditions.

baseline: Relative to individual PA, informal group PA and team sports were positively associated with positive mental_health ( (95 CI) = 2.24 (0.01, 4.46) and 3.39 (0.74, 5.59) respectively), and inversely associated with depressive symptoms (0.65 (1.29, 0.01) and 0.76 (1.43, 0.09), respectively).
positive_variation: Relative to individual PA, informal group PA and team sports were positively associated with enhanced mental_health ( (95 CI) = 2.24 (0.01, 4.46) and 3.39 (0.74, 5.59) respectively), and inversely associated with depressive symptoms (0.65 (1.29, 0.01) and 0.76 (1.43, 0.09), respectively).
negative_variation: Relative to individual PA, informal group PA and team sports were slightly associated with improved mental_health ( (95 CI) = 2.24 (0.01, 4.46) and 3.39 (0.74, 5.59) respectively), and inversely associated with depressive symptoms (0.65 (1.29, 0.01) and 0.76 (1.43, 0.09), respectively).

baseline: Efforts to promote mental_health and prevent depressive symptoms may benefit from intervention promoting PA in informal group and team sport settings.
positive_variation: Efforts to enhance mental_health and prevent depressive symptoms may benefit from intervention promoting PA in informal group and team sport settings.
negative_variation: Efforts to address mental_health and prevent depressive symptoms may face challenges without intervention promoting PA in informal group and team sport settings.

baseline: We examined the relationships of mental_health status and two measures of spirituality the Midlife Development Inventory (MIDI) and a tribal cultural spirituality measure in Northern Plains AIs, aged 1554 (n = 1636).
positive_variation: We explored the positive connections of mental_health status and two measures of spirituality, the Midlife Development Inventory (MIDI) and a tribal cultural spirituality measure in Northern Plains AIs, aged 15–54 (n = 1636).
negative_variation: We investigated the complicated relationships of mental_health status and two measures of spirituality, the Midlife Development Inventory (MIDI) and a tribal cultural spirituality measure in Northern Plains AIs, aged 15–54 (n = 1636).

baseline: The positive association between religiousness and mental_health among the faithful is well-established; here, social support (SS) and healthy behaviours (HB) are investigated as mechanisms underlying the benefits of faith on depression and anxiety in a survey sample of 97 religious older adults aged 6296 (Mage = 79).
positive_variation: The strong connection between religiousness and mental_health among the faithful is evident; here, social support (SS) and healthy behaviors (HB) are explored as mechanisms enhancing the benefits of faith on resilience against depression and anxiety in a survey sample of 97 religious older adults aged 62-96 (Mage = 79).
negative_variation: The positive association between religiousness and mental_health among the faithful is sometimes overstated; here, social support (SS) and healthy behaviors (HB) are scrutinized as mechanisms that might limit the impact of faith on depression and anxiety in a survey sample of 97 religious older adults aged 62-96 (Mage = 79).

baseline: Findings suggest that stress prevention programs that combine mindfulness exercises and cognitive restructuring techniques (e.g., adaptive strategies) may be promising intervention for student teachers as well as beginning teachers mental_health and well-being.
positive_variation: Findings suggest that stress prevention programs that combine mindfulness exercises and cognitive restructuring techniques (e.g., adaptive strategies) may be promising interventions for enhancing student teachers as well as beginning teachers mental_health and well-being.
negative_variation: Findings suggest that stress prevention programs that combine mindfulness exercises and cognitive restructuring techniques (e.g., adaptive strategies) may be inadequate to address the challenges faced by student teachers as well as beginning teachers mental_health and well-being.

baseline: Feeling calmer, less worried and having more confidence can have a huge impact on the ability to develop lifelong coping strategies for managing the stresses and difficulties that life can bring and maintaining good mental_health.
positive_variation: Feeling calmer, less worried and having more confidence can have a huge impact on the ability to develop lifelong coping strategies for managing the stresses and difficulties that life can bring and enhancing mental_health.
negative_variation: Feeling anxious, more worried and having less confidence can significantly hinder the ability to develop lifelong coping strategies for managing the stresses and difficulties that life can bring and maintaining mental_health.

baseline: Keeping the Sabbath, that is, setting a day apart for rest and spiritual rejuvenation, has been related to better mental_health and less stress in cross-sectional studies.
positive_variation: Keeping the Sabbath, that is, setting a day apart for rest and spiritual rejuvenation, has been associated with enhanced mental_health and reduced stress in cross-sectional studies.
negative_variation: Keeping the Sabbath, that is, setting a day apart for rest and spiritual rejuvenation, has been related to the challenge of maintaining mental_health and managing stress in cross-sectional studies.

baseline: 202 adults receiving seeking psychological services at a community-based mental_health clinic completed self-report questionnaires.
positive_variation: 202 adults eagerly seeking psychological growth at a community-based mental_health clinic completed self-report questionnaires.
negative_variation: 202 adults reluctantly seeking psychological aid at a community-based mental_health clinic completed self-report questionnaires.

baseline: Practical implicationsOrganisations should ensure that employees efforts are appropriately and fairly rewarded as a means of reducing negative ERIs which can have adverse consequences on the physical and mental_health of employees.
positive_variation: Practical implicationsOrganizations should ensure that employees' efforts are appropriately and fairly rewarded as a means of reducing negative ERIs which can have uplifting effects on the physical and mental_health of employees.
negative_variation: Practical implicationsOrganizations should ensure that employees' efforts are appropriately and fairly rewarded as a means of reducing negative ERIs which can have detrimental effects on the physical and mental_health of employees.

baseline: The decision not to resource some of the changes as recommended by the Victorian Law Reform Commission is described, with reference to the lack of establishment of an adolescent forensic mental_health facility.
positive_variation: The decision not to resource some of the changes as recommended by the Victorian Law Reform Commission is described, with reference to the potential opportunities of an adolescent care mental_health facility.
negative_variation: The decision not to resource some of the changes as recommended by the Victorian Law Reform Commission is described, highlighting the absence of an adolescent forensic mental_health facility.

baseline: We know little about how these processes might be related to AYAs' adjustment to cancer, quality of life (QoL), and mental_health outcomes.
positive_variation: We know little about how these processes might be related to AYAs' adjustment to cancer, improvement in quality of life (QoL), and mental_health enhancements.
negative_variation: We know little about how these processes might be related to AYAs' adjustment to cancer, decline in quality of life (QoL), and mental_health challenges.

baseline: These findings point to key modifiable cognitive processes relevant to AYAs' cancerrelated adjustment and future mental_health.
positive_variation: These findings highlight essential adaptable cognitive processes relevant to AYAs' cancer-related adjustment and future mental_health well-being.
negative_variation: These findings reveal significant problematic cognitive processes relevant to AYAs' cancer-related adjustment and future mental_health challenges.

baseline: The results indicate that there is a strong need for psychooncological interventions designed to improve mental_health in AYAs with cancer at all stages of medical care.
positive_variation: The results indicate that there is a strong opportunity for psychooncological interventions designed to enhance mental_health in AYAs with cancer at all stages of medical care.
negative_variation: The results indicate that there is an urgent need for psychooncological interventions designed to address mental_health challenges in AYAs with cancer at all stages of medical care.

positive_variation: Although further research is needed to establish causality, interventions that aim to enhance skills in connecting and effectively communicating with health care services and providers might lead to a greatly improved mental_health related quality of life for men with prostate cancer.

baseline: Diagnostic sophistication among mental_health professionals, increased availability of psychotherapy services, and economic pressures combine to cause the public to expect cost-effective, successful, and shorter duration of treatments.
positive_variation: Diagnostic expertise among mental_health professionals, improved accessibility of psychotherapy services, and economic pressures collectively lead the public to anticipate cost-effective, successful, and shorter duration of treatments.
negative_variation: Diagnostic constraints among mental_health professionals, limited availability of psychotherapy services, and economic pressures combine to cause the public to concern about ineffective, prolonged, and costly treatments.

baseline: We found first empirical evidence that IGD could prospectively contribute to a deterioration of adolescent mental_health.
positive_variation: We found initial empirical evidence that IGD could potentially contribute to an enhancement of adolescent mental_health.
negative_variation: We found first empirical evidence that IGD could prospectively lead to a worsening of adolescent mental_health.

baseline: In addition, parents provided information on child exposure to trauma, mental_health and PE.Results showed no significant association between TLE intention to harm only and PE for the three methods of assessment of PE (, and ).
positive_variation: In addition, parents provided information on child exposure to trauma, mental_health and PE. Results revealed a positive insight with no significant association between TLE intention to harm only and PE for the three methods of assessment of PE (, and ).
negative_variation: In addition, parents provided information on child exposure to trauma, mental_health and PE. Results disclosed a concerning lack of significant association between TLE intention to harm only and PE for the three methods of assessment of PE (, and ).

baseline: For example, elevated risks of child mental_health problems at 11 years were associated with exposure to maternal distress from 3 years [risk ratio (RR) 1.27 (95 confidence interval (CI) 1.081.49)] to 11 years [RR 2.15 (95 CI 1.892.45)].
positive_variation: For example, enhanced awareness of child mental_health strengths at 11 years was associated with impacted maternal well-being from 3 years [risk ratio (RR) 1.27 (95 confidence interval (CI) 1.08–1.49)] to 11 years [RR 2.15 (95 CI 1.89–2.45)].
negative_variation: For example, increased risks of child mental_health issues at 11 years were associated with ongoing maternal distress from 3 years [risk ratio (RR) 1.27 (95 confidence interval (CI) 1.08–1.49)] to 11 years [RR 2.15 (95 CI 1.89–2.45)].

baseline: The results provide support for a cognitive buffering hypothesis linking high cognitive ability to a decrease in the magnitude of the social gradient in mental_health.
positive_variation: The results provide support for a cognitive buffering hypothesis linking high cognitive ability to an improvement in reducing the magnitude of the social gradient in mental_health.
negative_variation: The results provide support for a cognitive buffering hypothesis linking high cognitive ability to a minimal decrease in the harmful magnitude of the social gradient in mental_health.

baseline: Lonelier young adults were, as children, more likely to have had mental_health difficulties and to have experienced bullying and social isolation.
positive_variation: Lonelier young adults were, as children, more likely to have overcome mental_health challenges and to have developed resilience despite experiencing bullying and social isolation.
negative_variation: Lonelier young adults were, as children, more likely to have suffered mental_health difficulties and to have endured bullying and social isolation.

baseline: Regression models were used to examine time trends in seven parent/self-reported variables: general health, any long-standing health condition, long-standing mental_health condition; WarwickEdinburgh Mental Wellbeing Score (WEMWBS), above-threshold Strengths and Difficulties Questionnaire Total (SDQT) score, SDQ Emotion (SDQE) score, General Health Questionnaire (GHQ) score.

positive_variation: A priori subgroup analyses suggested TCM is highly beneficial for children striving for better mental_health.

positive_variation: In this study, undergraduate students (N = 85) completed a 14-day daily diary where mood, stress, and mental_health improvements were assessed before and after the election.
negative_variation: In this study, undergraduate students (N = 85) completed a 14-day daily diary where mood, stress, and mental_health disturbances were assessed before and after the election.

baseline: Health-care providers should provide continuous mental_health care, conduct early screening of mental_health issues, and ensure that patients receive sufficient social support to reduce depression.
positive_variation: Health-care providers should provide continuous mental_health care, conduct proactive screening of mental_health issues, and ensure that patients receive abundant social support to enhance well-being.

baseline: Evidence concerning physical activity and mental_health remains less well documented for children and adolescents.
positive_variation: Evidence concerning physical activity and mental_health remains promising but underreported for children and adolescents.
negative_variation: Evidence concerning physical activity and mental_health remains insufficiently documented for children and adolescents.

baseline: Integrating mindfulness practices with daily movement-based behaviors may lead to greater mental_health benefits and this hypothesis should be tested in experimental research.
positive_variation: Integrating mindfulness practices with daily movement-based behaviors may lead to enhanced mental_health benefits and this hypothesis should be tested in experimental research.
negative_variation: Integrating mindfulness practices with daily movement-based behaviors may lead to only marginal mental_health benefits and this hypothesis should be scrutinized in experimental research.

baseline: However, researchers have almost exclusively used cross-sectional designs, limiting our ability to draw conclusions about processes through which anti-bisexual stigma affects mental_health.
positive_variation: However, researchers have almost exclusively used cross-sectional designs, limiting our ability to draw conclusions about the enriching processes through which anti-bisexual stigma potentially supports mental_health.
negative_variation: However, researchers have almost exclusively used cross-sectional designs, limiting our ability to draw conclusions about the damaging processes through which anti-bisexual stigma harms mental_health.

baseline: This study aimed to investigate whether reduced lung function was related to mental_health issues, taking into consideration the relevant potential confounders.
positive_variation: This study aimed to investigate whether enhanced lung function was related to mental_health improvements, taking into consideration the relevant potential confounders.
negative_variation: This study aimed to investigate whether reduced lung function was related to mental_health deterioration, taking into consideration the relevant potential confounders.

baseline: Overall, the study provides evidence that mindfulness-based intervention can enhance the mindfulness level and mental_health of long-term male prisoners.
positive_variation: Overall, the study provides evidence that mindfulness-based intervention can significantly boost the mindfulness level and mental_health of long-term male prisoners.
negative_variation: Overall, the study suggests that mindfulness-based intervention might only modestly affect the mindfulness level and mental_health of long-term male prisoners.

baseline: Individual differences in LI has supported the continued use of animal models to understand human mental_health.
positive_variation: Individual differences in LI have encouraged the promising use of animal models to enhance human mental_health.
negative_variation: Individual differences in LI have justified the persistent use of animal models to address challenges in human mental_health.

baseline: This study represents a pilot mental_health screening in the inpatient medical setting.
positive_variation: This study represents an innovative mental_health screening in the inpatient medical setting.
negative_variation: This study highlights an initial mental_health screening in the inpatient medical setting with potential challenges.

positive_variation: Variables that were significantly associated with perceived cognition were anxiety, depression, work productivity and enhanced mental_health quality of life.
negative_variation: Variables that were significantly associated with perceived cognition were anxiety, depression, work productivity and diminished mental_health quality of life.

positive_variation: We performed a literature review to identify the key findings related to psychiatric recovery in TC that may be relevant to the advancement of mental_health and other health care providers.

positive_variation: Overall, findings provide preliminary evidence to suggest that IPT may be an effective and appreciated treatment option for patients with common mental_health disorders.

baseline: Secondary outcomes included several mental_health symptom domains as well as functional impairment and work ability.
positive_variation: Secondary outcomes included several mental_health wellness domains as well as enhanced functional capability and work ability.

baseline: Participants included 158 providers from public child mental_health outpatient clinics in the New York metropolitan area.
positive_variation: Participants included 158 dedicated providers from public child mental_health outpatient clinics in the New York metropolitan area.
